88.Ahmed Ali: He said: "O my people, think. I have a clear sign from my Lord, who has also given me a goodly provision, and I do not wish for myself what I forbid you: I only wish to reform you as best I can. My success is from God alone. In Him I have placed my trust, and to Him I turn

89.Ahmed Ali: "O my people (I fear) lest your opposition to me should bring you the like of what befell the people of Noah or Hud or Saleh; and the people of Lot are not distant from you

90.Ahmed Ali: "Beg your Lord to forgive you, and turn to Him. Indeed my Lord is compassionate and loving."

91.Ahmed Ali: They said: "O Shu'aib, much of what you say is meaningless to us, and then (for sure) you are powerless among us. But for your clan we would have stoned you to death. You have no power over us

92.Ahmed Ali: He said: "My clan seems mightier to you than God whom you neglect and push behind your backs. Surely what you do is within the power of my Lord

93.Ahmed Ali: Do on your part what you can, O people, I will do what I will. You will come to know who suffers the punishment that would put him to shame, and who is the liar. So watch; I am watching with you."

94.Ahmed Ali: And when Our word came to pass, We rescued Shu'aib and those who believed, with him, by Our grace, but those who were wicked were seized by a punishment from heaven, and lay overturned in their homes in the morning

95.Ahmed Ali: As though they had not dwelt there at all. Beware! Condemmed were the people of Midian as those of Thamud had been before them

96.Ahmed Ali: We sent Moses with Our signs and full authorit

97.Ahmed Ali: To the Pharaoh and his nobles, but they followed the bidding of Pharaoh, though the bidding of Pharaoh was unrightful

98.Ahmed Ali: He shall be at the head of his people on the Day of Resurrection, and drive them into Hell like cattle driven to water -- what an evil watering-place to reach

99.Ahmed Ali: Damned will they be in this world, and on the Day of Doom how evil the gift that they will receive

100.Ahmed Ali: These are a few accounts of settlements that We narrate to you. Some still survive, and some have been mowed down

101.Ahmed Ali: We did not wrong them; they wronged themselves. When your Lord's chastisement descended upon them, their gods, on whom they called apart from God, were not of the least avail, and all they did was only to add to their destruction

102.Ahmed Ali: Such is the punishment of your Lord when He seizes human settlements in the acts of wickedness. Surely His hold is grievous and terrible

103.Ahmed Ali: In this surely is a sign for him who fears the torment of the Hereafter, the day when mankind will be assembled together, which will be a day when all things would become evident

104.Ahmed Ali: We are deferring it only for a time ordained

105.Ahmed Ali: The day it comes no soul will dare say a word but by His leave; and some will be wretched, some will be blessed

106.Ahmed Ali: And those who are doomed, will be in Hell: For them will be sighing and sobbing

107.Ahmed Ali: Where they will dwell so long as heaven and earth endure, unless your Lord will otherwise. Verily your Lord does as He wills

108.Ahmed Ali: Those who are blessed will be in Paradise, where they will dwell so long as heaven and earth survive, unless your Lord wills otherwise: This will be a gift uninterrupted

109.Ahmed Ali: So, you should not entertain any doubt about those whom they worship: They only worship what their fathers had worshipped before them. We shall verily give them their meed without diminution

110.Ahmed Ali: Verily We gave to Moses the Book, but there was disagreement about it. Had the decree of your Lord (delaying it) not been issued the matter would have been settled between them. They are still suspicious of it and in doubt

111.Ahmed Ali: Surely your Lord will reward everyone in accordance with his deeds. He is certainly aware of all they do

112.Ahmed Ali: So, you and those who turned to God with you, should walk along the straight path as you have been commanded, and do not transgress, for He verily sees whatsoever you do

113.Ahmed Ali: Do not lean towards the wicked, or you will be caught in the flames of Hell, and have none to befriend you other than God, nor will you be given help

114.Ahmed Ali: Stand up for the service of prayer at the two ends of day and the first watch of night. Remember that good deeds nullify the bad. This is a reminder for those who are observant

115.Ahmed Ali: Be steadfast, for verily God does not let the reward of those who are upright and do good to go waste

116.Ahmed Ali: If only there had been men endued with virtue in the ages before you, who could preserve men from doing evil in the world, other than the few We saved from among them. Those who were wicked followed that which made them dissolute, and became sinners

117.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord would not surely destroy unjustly human habitations so long as the people are righteous

118.Ahmed Ali: But if your Lord had pleased He could have made all human beings into one community of belief. But they would still have differed from one another

119.Ahmed Ali: Except those on whom your Lord had mercy for which He has created them. But fulfilled shall be the word of your Lord. "I will fill up Hell with jinns and men."

120.Ahmed Ali: The histories of apostles that We relate to you are (meant) to strengthen your heart. Through them has the truth come to you, and guidance, and reminder to those who believe

121.Ahmed Ali: Say to the infidels. "Act as best you can, we are acting too

122.Ahmed Ali: And wait (for what is to come), we are also waiting (to see)."

123.Ahmed Ali: To God belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and all things will go back to Him. So worship Him and put your trust in Him; your Lord is not heedless of what you do

1.Ahmed Ali: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the immaculate Book

2.Ahmed Ali: We have sent it down as a clear discourse that you may understand

3.Ahmed Ali: Through the revelation of this Qur'an We narrate the best of histories of which you were unaware before

4.Ahmed Ali: When Joseph told his father: "O my father, I saw eleven stars and the sun and the moon bowing before me in homage,"

5.Ahmed Ali: He said: "O son, do not narrate your dream to your brothers, or they will plot against you. Surely Satan is man's acknowledged foe

6.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord will choose you and teach you to interpret events, and confer His favours on you and the house of Jacob, as He had done in the case of two ancestors of yours, Abraham and Isaac, before you. Indeed your Lord is all-knowing and all-wise."

7.Ahmed Ali: In the story of Joseph and his brothers are lessons for those who inquire

8.Ahmed Ali: "Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we," (said his half brothers) "even though we are a well-knit band. Our father is surely in the wrong

9.Ahmed Ali: Let us kill Joseph or cast him in some distant land so that we may get our father's exclusive affection; then play innocent."

10.Ahmed Ali: One of them said: "If you must do so, then do not kill Joseph, but throw him into an unused well. Some passing caravan may rescue him."

11.Ahmed Ali: (Then going to their father) they said: "O father, why don't you trust us with Joseph? We are in fact his well-wishers

12.Ahmed Ali: Let him go out with us tomorrow that he may enjoy and play. We shall take care of him."

13.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I am afraid of sending him with you lest a wolf should devour him when you are unmindful."

14.Ahmed Ali: They replied: "If a wolf should devour him when we are there, a well-knit band, we shall certainly be treacherous."

15.Ahmed Ali: So, when they took him out they planned to throw him into an unused well. We revealed to Joseph: "You will tell them (one day) of this deed when they will not apprehend it."

16.Ahmed Ali: At nightfall they came to their father weeping

17.Ahmed Ali: And said: "We went racing with one another and left Joseph to guard our things when a wolf devoured him. But you will not believe us even though we tell the truth."

18.Ahmed Ali: They showed him the shirt with false blood on it. (Their father) said: "It is not so; you have made up the story. Yet endurance is best. I seek the help of God alone for what you impute."

19.Ahmed Ali: A caravan happened to pass, and sent the water-carrier to bring water from the well. He let down his bucket (and pulled Joseph up with it). "What luck," said the man; "here is a boy;" and they hid him as an item of merchandise; but what they did was known to God

20.Ahmed Ali: And they sold him as worthless for a few paltry dirham

21.Ahmed Ali: The Egyptian who bought him instructed his wife: "House him honourably. He may be of use to us. We may even adopt him as a son." So, We firmly established Joseph in the land, and taught him the interpretation of dreams. God dominated in his affairs, though most men do not know

22.Ahmed Ali: When he reached the prime of life We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus We reward those who are good

23.Ahmed Ali: But she in whose house he resided wished to seduce him and, closing the doors, said: "Come into me. "God forbid!" he said; "he is my master who has approved my stay. Surely those who act wrongly do not prosper."

24.Ahmed Ali: But the woman desired him, and he would have desired her but for the indication he received from his Lord. This was so that We may avert both evil and lechery from him, for he was one of Our chosen devotees

25.Ahmed Ali: Both of them raced to the door, and she (grabbed and) rent his shirt from behind. They met her lord outside the door. "There is no other penalty for a man," said she, "who wanted to outrage your wife but imprisonment or grievous punishment."

26.Ahmed Ali: (Joseph) said: "It was she who wanted to seduce me." And a witness from her family testified: "If the shirt is torn from the front then the woman is speaking the truth, and he is a liar

27.Ahmed Ali: But if the shirt is torn from behind then she is a liar, and he speaks the truth."

28.Ahmed Ali: When the husband saw the shirt torn at the back, he said: "Surely this is a woman's ruse, and the wiles of women are great

29.Ahmed Ali: Ignore this affair, O Joseph; and you, O woman, ask forgiveness for your sin, for you were surely errant."

30.Ahmed Ali: In the city the women gossiped: "The minister's wife longs after her page. He has captured her heart. We think she is in clear error."

31.Ahmed Ali: When she heard their slanderings, she sent for them and prepared a banquet, and gave each of them a knife (for paring fruit), and called (to Joseph): "Come out before them." When they saw him, the women were so wonderstruck they cut their hands, and exclaimed: "O Lord preserve us! He is no mortal but an honourable angel."

32.Ahmed Ali: She said: "This is the one you blamed me for. I did desire his person, but he preserved himself from sin. Yet in case he does not do my bidding he will be put into prison and disgraced."

33.Ahmed Ali: (Joseph) prayed: "O Lord, dearer is prison than what they invite me to. Unless You turn their guiles away from me I shall succumb to their charms and thus become a pagan."

34.Ahmed Ali: His Lord heard his prayer, and averted the women's wiles from him. He verily hears and knows everything

35.Ahmed Ali: And yet in spite of having seen these clear proofs they found it proper to incarcerate him for a time

36.Ahmed Ali: Two other youths were imprisoned along with him. Said one of them: "I dreamt that I was pressing grapes;" and the other: "I dreamt that I was carrying bread on my head, and the birds were pecking at it. You tell us the meaning of this. You seem to be a righteous man."

37.Ahmed Ali: (Joseph) answered: "I will give you its interpretation before the food you are served arrives. This knowledge is one of the things my Lord has taught me. I have given up the religion of those who do not believe in God and deny the life to come

38.Ahmed Ali: I follow the faith of my fathers, of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. We cannot associate anyone with God. This is among God's favours to us and to all mankind; but most men are not grateful

39.Ahmed Ali: (Tell me) O fellow-prisoners, are a number of gods better, or one God omnipotent

40.Ahmed Ali: (What) you worship besides Him are nothing but names that you and your fathers have assigned, for which no sanction has been sent down by God. Authority belongs to God alone. He commands that you worship none but Him. This is the right way; but most men are ignorant

41.Ahmed Ali: O fellow-prisoners, one of you will serve wine to your master, the other will be crucified and the birds will peck at his brain. Determined is the matter of your inquiry."

42.Ahmed Ali: And (Joseph) asked the man he knew would be released: "Remember me to your lord;" but Satan made him forget to mention this to his lord, and Joseph remained in prison for a number of years

43.Ahmed Ali: (One day) the king said (to his courtiers): "I saw seven fat cows in a dream being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven ears of corn that were green and seven others that were seared. O courtiers, tell me the significance of my dream, if you know how to interpret them."

44.Ahmed Ali: "They were only confused dreams," they said; "we do not know how to interpret them."

45.Ahmed Ali: Then the servant, who of the two had been released, remembering (Joseph), said: "I will give you its interpretation; let me go for it."

46.Ahmed Ali: (And coming to the prison) he said: "O Joseph the truthful, tell us (the meaning of) seven fat cows being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven green ears of corn and seven seared, that I may go back to the people and tell them."

47.Ahmed Ali: He said: "Sow as usual for seven years, and after reaping leave the corn in the ears, except the little you need for food

48.Ahmed Ali: Then there will come seven years of hardship which will consume the grain you had laid up against them, except a little you may have stored away

49.Ahmed Ali: This will be followed by a year of rain, and people shall press (the grapes)."

50.Ahmed Ali: The king said: "Bring him to me. So when the messenger came to Joseph, he said: "Go back to your lord and ask him: 'How fare the women who had cut their hands?' My Lord is cognisant of their guile."

51.Ahmed Ali: The king asked the women: "What was the affair of seducing Joseph?" "God preserve us," they said; "we know no evil against him." The wife of the minister said: "The truth has now come out. It was I who desired to seduce him, but he is indeed a man of virtue." -

52.Ahmed Ali: (At this Joseph remarked:) "From this (the Minister) should know that I did not betray him in his absence, and that God does not surely let the wiles of those who betray ever succeed

53.Ahmed Ali: But I do not wish to absolve myself, for the soul is prone to evil, unless my Lord have mercy. Indeed my Lord is forgiving and kind." -

54.Ahmed Ali: When the king heard this he said: "Bring him to me. I shall take him in my special service." When he had talked to him, he said: "Today you are established in a rank of trust with us."

55.Ahmed Ali: "Appoint me over the granaries of the land," (he said); "I shall be a knowledgeable keeper."

56.Ahmed Ali: Thus We gave Joseph authority in the land so that he lived wherever he liked. We bestow Our favours on whomsoever We please, and do not allow the reward of those who are good to go waste

57.Ahmed Ali: And certainly the recompense of the life to come is better for those who believe and follow the right path

58.Ahmed Ali: The brothers of Joseph came (to Egypt) and visited him. He recognised them, though they did not recognise him

59.Ahmed Ali: When he had supplied their provisions, he said to them: "Bring your (half) brother with you. Have you not seen that I have given full measure, and that I am the best of hosts

60.Ahmed Ali: But if you do not bring him with you, then I shall have no grain for you, nor should you come back to me."

61.Ahmed Ali: They said: "We shall request his father, and will certainly do that."

62.Ahmed Ali: Then he ordered his servants: "Put their money back in their packs: They may find it on reaching home, and perhaps come again."

63.Ahmed Ali: When they returned to their father, they said: "O father, a further measure has been denied us. So send our brother with us that he may bring more grain. We shall take care of him."

64.Ahmed Ali: He replied: "Should I trust you with him as I did his brother? But God is the best of guardians, and most merciful of all."

65.Ahmed Ali: When they unpacked their goods they said: "O father, what more can we ask? Look, even our money has been returned. We shall go and bring a camel-load more of grain for our family, and take good care of our brother. That will be an easy measure."

66.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I will never send him with you until you swear by God that you will bring him back to me, unless all of you are overtaken (by misfortune)." When they had given their promise, he said: "God is witness to our conversation."

67.Ahmed Ali: (As they were leaving) their father said to them: "O my sons, do not seek one approach but employ different ways (of attaining your object). If anything should befall you from God I shall not be able to avert it, for all authority belongs to God. I have placed my trust in Him, and the trusting should rely on Him alone."

68.Ahmed Ali: When they entered as their father had advised them, nothing could avail them against (the will of) God, yet it confirmed a premonition Jacob had, for verily he had knowledge as We had taught him, though most men do not know

69.Ahmed Ali: When they came to Joseph he made his brother his guest, and said: "I am your brother. So do not grieve for what they had done."

70.Ahmed Ali: When he had given them their provisions he put his goblet in his brother's saddle-bag. Then a crier announced: "O men of the caravan, you are thieves."

71.Ahmed Ali: They turned to them and asked: "What is it you have lost?"

72.Ahmed Ali: "We cannot find the master's goblet. Whoever comes up with it will be given a camel-load of grain; I vouch for it."

73.Ahmed Ali: They said: "We swear by God. You know we did not come to commit any crime in the land, nor are we thieves."

74.Ahmed Ali: "What should be the punishment," they were asked, "in case you are liars?"

75.Ahmed Ali: "The punishment for that (should be)," they said, "that he in whose luggage it is found should be held as punishment. This is how we repay the wrong-doers."

76.Ahmed Ali: So he searched their saddle-bags before his brother's, then produced the cup from his brother's bag. That is how We planned an excuse for Joseph, for under the law of the king he could not detain his brother unless God so willed. We raise the status of whom We please. Over every man of knowledge there is one more knowing

77.Ahmed Ali: Said the brothers: "If he has stolen (no wonder), his brother had stolen before." But Joseph kept this secret and did not disclose it to them, and said (to himself): "You are worse in the degree of evil, for God knows better of what you allege."

78.Ahmed Ali: They said: "O Minister, he has an aged father, so keep one of us in his place. We see you are a virtuous man."

79.Ahmed Ali: "May God forgive us," he said, "if we hold any one but him with whom we found our property, or else we would be unjust."

80.Ahmed Ali: When they despaired of (persuading) him, they went aside to confer. The oldest of them said: "You know that your father has pledged you in the name of God, and you have been guilty of iniquity in the case of Joseph before. I will not leave this place unless my father permits or God decides for me, for He is the best of all judges

81.Ahmed Ali: So, go to your father and tell him: 'O father, your son has committed a theft. We bear witness to only what we know; we could not prevent the unknown

82.Ahmed Ali: Enquire from the people of that city, or ask the men of the caravan with whom we have come. We are verily speaking the truth.'"

83.Ahmed Ali: "No," said (the father). "You have made up the story; but patience is best; God may bring them back to me. He is all-knowing and all-wise."

84.Ahmed Ali: He turned away from them and cried: "Alas for Joseph!" And his eyes turned white with grief which he bore in silence

85.Ahmed Ali: "By God," said they, "you will never stop thinking of Joseph till you are consumed or perish."

86.Ahmed Ali: He replied: "I cry my plaint and grief to God, and know from God what you do not know

87.Ahmed Ali: O sons, go in search of Joseph and his brother, and do not despair of the mercy of God. Only they despair of God's mercy who do not believe."

88.Ahmed Ali: When they returned to him, they said (to Joseph): "O Minister, calamity has befallen us and our people. We have brought but a meagre sum, but give us full measure as alms bestowed. God surely rewards those who give alms."

89.Ahmed Ali: , He said: "Do you know what you did to Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?"

90.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Surely you are not Joseph!" "I am Joseph," he said, "and this is my brother. God has been gracious to us; for God does not verily deprive those who fear Him and are patient of the recompense of those who are good."

91.Ahmed Ali: They said: "By God, God has favoured you above us, for we have indeed been sinners."

92.Ahmed Ali: "There is no blame on you today," he said, "May God forgive you. He is the most merciful of all

93.Ahmed Ali: Take my shirt and put it on my father's face; his eyesight will be restored; and bring your entire family to me."

94.Ahmed Ali: The caravan departed (from Egypt) and Jacob said (at home): "Say not that I am in my dotage, but I get the smell of Joseph."

95.Ahmed Ali: They said: "By God, you are still persisting in your old delusion."

96.Ahmed Ali: Then, as the harbinger of happy news arrived and put the garment over his face his eyesight was restored. He said: "Did I not tell you? I know from God what you do not know."

97.Ahmed Ali: Said (the sons): "O our father, pray for us that our sins be forgiven, for we are really sinners."

98.Ahmed Ali: "I will ask my Lord to forgive you," he replied, "for He is forgiving and kind."

99.Ahmed Ali: When they went back to Joseph he gave his father and mother a place of honour, and said: "Enter Egypt in peace by the will of God."

100.Ahmed Ali: He seated his parents by his side on the throne; and they fell down before him in homage. "O my father," said Joseph, "this is the meaning of my earlier dream. My Lord has made it come true. He was gracious in getting me out of the prison, and bringing you out of the desert to me after the discord created by Satan between me and my brothers, for my Lord is gracious to whomsoever He please. He is indeed all-knowing and all-wise

101.Ahmed Ali: O my Lord, you have given me dominion and taught me the interpretation of dreams; O Creator of the heavens and the earth, You alone are my saviour in this world and the world to come; let me die submitting to You, and place me among the upright."

102.Ahmed Ali: This is news of the unknown We reveal to you, for you were not present when Joseph's brothers agreed on their course of action, and devised their plot

103.Ahmed Ali: Many men will not believe howsoever you wish

104.Ahmed Ali: Even though you ask no recompense (for it). It is only a warning for all mankind

105.Ahmed Ali: How many a sign there is in the heavens and the earth which most men pass by and ignore

106.Ahmed Ali: Not only do they not believe in God, but also associate others with Him

107.Ahmed Ali: Do they really believe that an all-embracing punishment of God will not come upon them, or the Day of Doom overtake them suddenly while they remain unaware

108.Ahmed Ali: Say: "My way, and that of my followers, is to call you to God with full perception. All glory to God, I am not an idolater."

109.Ahmed Ali: All the apostles We had sent before you were men of those regions, to whom We sent Our revelations. Have they not travelled on the earth and seen what befell the people before them? Surely the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who fear straying from the right path. Do you not understand

110.Ahmed Ali: When the apostles despaired and thought they were made false promises, Our help arrived, and We delivered whom We pleased; but never will Our punishment be averted from the sinners

111.Ahmed Ali: Verily in their accounts is a lesson for men of wisdom. This is not a fictitious tale, but a verification of earlier Books, and a clear exposition of everything, and a guidance and grace for those who believe

1.Ahmed Ali: ALIF LAM MIM RA. These are the verses of the Scripture. Whatsoever is sent down to you from your Lord is the truth; but most men do not believe

2.Ahmed Ali: It is God who raised the skies without support, as you can see, then assumed His throne, and enthralled the sun and the moon (so that) each runs to a predetermined course. He disposes all affairs, distinctly explaining every sign that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord

3.Ahmed Ali: It is He who stretched the earth and placed upon it stabilisers and rivers; and made two of a pair of every fruit; (and) He covers up the day with the night. In these are signs for those who reflect

4.Ahmed Ali: On the earth are tracts adjoining one another, and vineyards, fields of corn and date-palm trees, some forked, some with single trunks, yet all irrigated by the self-same water, though We make some more excellent than the others in fruit. There are surely signs in them for those who understand

5.Ahmed Ali: If you are surprised, then astonishing is the speech (of those who say:) "Having turned to dust shall we be raised as a new creation?" They are the ones who deny their Lord, and they will have collars around their necks. They are the inmates of Hell, where they will abide for ever

6.Ahmed Ali: They want you to hasten the evil before the good, even when there have been examples of retribution before them. Though certainly your Lord forgives human beings for their iniquities, your Lord is severe of retribution

7.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers say: "Why no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" But you are only a bearer of warnings, and a guide for every nation

8.Ahmed Ali: God is cognisant of what every female carries in her womb, or what the wombs want or exceed (of their disburdening time). With Him all things are in determined measure

9.Ahmed Ali: He is the knower of the known and the unknown, the mighty and most high

10.Ahmed Ali: He who keeps his secret among you is the same to Him as he who speaks out publicly, and he who hides himself in the night and walks freely in the day

11.Ahmed Ali: His angels keep watch over him in succession (night and day), in front and behind, by God's command. Verily God does not change the state of a people till they change themselves. When God intends misfortune for a people no one can avert it, and no saviour will they have apart from Him

12.Ahmed Ali: It is He who makes the lightning flash for fear and hope, and raises massive clouds

13.Ahmed Ali: The thunder sings His praises, and the angels too, for awe of Him. He sends thunder-bolts and strikes whosoever He will with them: Even then it is God they contend about! But mighty is He in (His) power

14.Ahmed Ali: To call on Him is true (supplication). For those they invoke other than Him do not answer them at all, except like a man who stretches his hands towards the water that it reach his mouth, but it will never reach it. Not more than error are the prayers of infidels

15.Ahmed Ali: Whosoever is in the heavens and on earth bows to God in submission with a will or perforce, as do their shadows in the morning and evening

16.Ahmed Ali: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" (They will) say: "God." Say: "Then why do you take protectors besides Him who have no power over their own gain or loss?" Say: "Can a blind man and one who can see be equal? Or, darkness and light be the same? Or, have those they have appointed equal of God created, as He has created, so that the (two) creations look alike to them?" Say: "God is the creator of everything. He is One, the omnipotent."

17.Ahmed Ali: He sends down water from the skies, which flows in channels according to their capacity, with the scum borne on the surface of the torrent, as rises the scum when metals are heated on the fire for making ornaments and household utensils. This is how God determines truth and falsehood. The scum disappears like the foam on the bank, and that which is useful to man remains on the earth. That is how God sets forth precepts of wisdom

18.Ahmed Ali: For those who obey their Lord is excellence. For those who fail to obey, the reckoning will be hard, even if they possess and give as ransom all that there is on the earth, and as much more; and Hell will be their abode: How wretched is its wide expanse

19.Ahmed Ali: Can a man who knows what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and one who cannot see, be the same? They alone take warning who are wise

20.Ahmed Ali: Who fulfil their covenant with God and do not break their agreement

21.Ahmed Ali: Who keep together what God has ordained held together, and fear their Lord and dread the hardship of the Reckoning

22.Ahmed Ali: Who persevere in seeking the way of their Lord, who fulfil their devotional obligations, and spend of what We have given them, secretly or openly, who repel evil with good: For them is the recompense of Paradise

23.Ahmed Ali: Perpetual gardens which they will enter with those of their fathers, spouses and children who were virtuous and at peace, with angels coming in through every doo

24.Ahmed Ali: Saying: "(Welcome,) peace on you, for you persevered." How excellent the recompense of Paradise

25.Ahmed Ali: As for those who break God's covenant after validating it, and sever relations which God ordained cohered, and spread corruption in the land, there is condemnation for them and an evil abode

26.Ahmed Ali: God increases or decreases the fortunes of whosoever He will, and they rejoice in the life of this world. Yet the life of this world is nothing but a merchandise as compared to the life of the next

27.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers say: "How is it that no miracle was sent down to him by his Lord?" Say: "God leads whosoever He wills astray, and guides whoever turns to Him in repentance

28.Ahmed Ali: Those who believe and find peace in their hearts from the contemplation of God: Surely there is peace of heart in the contemplation of God!"

29.Ahmed Ali: Those who believe and do the right, have happiness, and an excellent resting place

30.Ahmed Ali: That is how We have sent you to a people before whom many a people have come and gone, so that you may announce to them whatever We have revealed to you. But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman. Tell them: "He is my Lord. There is no other god but He. In Him have I placed my trust, and to Him is my reversion."

31.Ahmed Ali: Had there been a Qur'an which could have made the mountains move, or the earth to cleave asunder, or the dead to speak, yet all authority belongs to God. Have the believers not learnt that if God had so willed He could have guided all mankind? As for unbelievers, they will be visited by misfortune endlessly for what they have done; or it would sit in their homes till the promised threat of God comes to pass. Surely God does not go back on His promise

32.Ahmed Ali: Many an apostle have they mocked before you; but I allowed the unbelievers respite, then I seized them. How severe was My punishment then

33.Ahmed Ali: Who is it who stands (watch) over every soul for what it does? Yet they ascribe compeers to God. Say: "Then name them. Or are you announcing to God what He does not know on the earth? Or is it only empty talk? In fact, the unbelievers' plots are made to look attractive to them, so that they are held back from the right path. Whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way

34.Ahmed Ali: For them is punishment in this world; and the punishment of the world to come is far more severe. They will have no one to save them from God

35.Ahmed Ali: The likeness of Paradise promised the pious and devout is (of a garden) with streams of rippling water, everlasting fruits and shade. This is the recompense of those who keep away from evil; but the recompense of those who deny the truth is Hell

36.Ahmed Ali: Those to whom We have given the Scriptures rejoice in what We have sent down to you; but some of their factions reject some of it. Tell them: "I am commanded to worship only God, and not to associate compeers with Him. To Him I call you, and to Him is the destination."

37.Ahmed Ali: That is how We have sent down this (Qur'an) as a code of clear judgement. But if you follow their caprices, now that you have been given knowledge, you will have no friend or protector against God

38.Ahmed Ali: We sent many apostles before you, and bestowed on them wives and children, but it was not for any apostle to come up with a miracle unless by the leave of God. For every age there is a law

39.Ahmed Ali: God abrogates or confirms whatsoever He will, for He has with Him the Book of Books

40.Ahmed Ali: Whether We allow you to see (the punishment) We have promised them, or end your life before (its execution), it is certainly for you to convey the message; the reckoning is for Us to do

41.Ahmed Ali: Do they not see Us advancing from all sides into their land and reducing its frontiers? It is for God to judge; and there is none to reverse His judgement. He is swift at reckoning

42.Ahmed Ali: Surely those who had gone before them had also plotted; but God's is all the planning, for He has knowledge of what each does. The unbelievers will soon learn for whom is the guerdon of Paradise

43.Ahmed Ali: Yet those who are disbelievers say: "You are not the apostle sent (by God)." Tell them: "God is sufficient as witness between me and you, and he who has knowledge of the Book."

1.Ahmed Ali: ALIF LAM RA. A Book We have sent down to you that you may lead men out of darkness into light, by their Lord's command, to the path of the mighty, the worthy of praise

2.Ahmed Ali: God, to whom belongs all there is in the heavens and the earth. Woe to the unbelievers for the terrible punishment (that awaits)

3.Ahmed Ali: Those who hold the life of this world dearer than that of the next, who obstruct the path of God and seek obliquity in it, have wandered far into error

4.Ahmed Ali: We never sent a messenger who did not speak the tongue of his people, that he may explain to them distinctly. God leads whosoever He wills astray, and shows whoever He wills the way: He is all-mighty and all-wise

5.Ahmed Ali: Remember when We sent Moses with Our signs (We said): "Bring your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the visitations of God. Indeed there are signs in this for every steadfast, thankful soul"

6.Ahmed Ali: So Moses said to his people: "Remember the favours of God when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who afflicted you with oppression, slaying your sons but keeping alive your women, which was a great trial from your Lord."

7.Ahmed Ali: Remember, your Lord proclaimed: "I shall give you more if you are grateful; but if you are thankless then surely My punishment is very great."

8.Ahmed Ali: And Moses said: "What if you and all the people of the world deny, God is unconcerned and worthy of praise."

9.Ahmed Ali: Has not the news of those before you, the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them, come to you? None knows (about) them except God. Their apostles came to them with clear proofs, but they tried to silence them and said: "We do not believe in what you have been sent with, and we are in doubt of what you call us to, about which we are in disquiet.

10.Ahmed Ali: Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive some of your sins, and give you respite for a time ordained." They said: "You are only men like us, and yet you wish to turn us away from what our fathers worshipped. Bring to us then a clear proof."

11.Ahmed Ali: Their apostles said to them: "Indeed we are men like you, but God bestows His favours on whomsoever He wills among His creatures. It is not in our power to bring a miracle for you without the leave of God. The believers should only place their trust in God

12.Ahmed Ali: And why should we not repose our trust in God when He has shown us our paths of duty to Him? We shall bear with fortitude the hardships you inflict upon us. The trusting place their trust in God."

13.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land, or else you come back to our fold." Their Lord then communicated to them: "We shall annihilate these wicked people

14.Ahmed Ali: And establish you in their place. This is for him who fears My station, and dreads My commination."

15.Ahmed Ali: Then (the apostles) asked of God's assistance, and every arrogant tyrant was frustrated

16.Ahmed Ali: Before him is Hell, and he will get putrid liquid to drink

17.Ahmed Ali: He will sip it, yet will not be able to gulp it down. Death will crowd in upon him from every side, but die he will not. A terrible torment trails him

18.Ahmed Ali: Like ashes are the deeds of those who deny their Lord, which the wind blows away on a windy day. They shall have no power over what they earned. This is the farthest limit of going astray

19.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see that God has created the heavens and the earth with ultimate reason? If He so wills He could take you away from the earth and raise a new creation (in your place)

20.Ahmed Ali: This is well within the power of God

21.Ahmed Ali: When they will all appear before God together, the weak will say to those who were arrogant: "We were your followers, so can you now save us a little from God's punishment?" They will say: "If we had been guided by God we would surely have shown you the way. To lament or endure is all the same to us now. No getting away is there for us."

22.Ahmed Ali: When the reckoning is over Satan will say: "The promise that was made to you by God was indeed a true promise; but I went back on the promise I had made, for I had no power over you except to call you; and you responded to my call. So blame me not, but blame yourselves. Neither can I help you nor can you give me help. I disavow your having associated me earlier (with God). The punishment for those who are wicked is painful indeed."

23.Ahmed Ali: Those who believed and did the right, will be admitted to gardens with rivers flowing by, where they will abide by the leave of their Lord, with 'Peace' as their salutation

24.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see how God compares a noble act to a healthy tree whose roots are firm and branches in the sky, which yield

25.Ahmed Ali: By the leave of its Lord its fruit in all seasons, God presents words of wisdom to men that they might reflect

26.Ahmed Ali: An evil act is like a rotten tree torn out of the earth with no (base or) firmness

27.Ahmed Ali: With immutuble words God makes the faithful dauntless in the life of the world and the life to come, but leads the unjust into error, for God does as He pleases

28.Ahmed Ali: Have you not looked at those who repaid God's favours with ingratitude; who pulled their people down to ruin

29.Ahmed Ali: Hell, where they will roast in the fire? And what an evil repository

30.Ahmed Ali: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path. Tell them: "Enjoy yourselves (so long as you may). In the end you have to go to Hell."

31.Ahmed Ali: Tell those of My creatures who believe: "Observe your devotional obligations and give of what We have given you in charity, secretly or openly, before the Day arrives when there will be no buying or selling or befriending."

32.Ahmed Ali: It is God who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down rain from the sky producing fruits for your food thereby, and made you master of the ships that ply in the oceans by His command, subjected the rivers to your control

33.Ahmed Ali: And subjugated the sun and moon for you so that they perform their tasks diligently; and subdued the night and day for your service

34.Ahmed Ali: He gave you whatsoever you asked. If you try to count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Man is most unjust indeed, full of ingratitude

35.Ahmed Ali: Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols

36.Ahmed Ali: Many a man have they led astray, O Lord. So he who follows me is truly of me; but as for him who disobeys me, surely You are forgiving and kind

37.Ahmed Ali: I have settled some of my children, O Lord, in a barren valley near Your sacred House, so that, O our Lord, they may be constant in devotion. So put in the hearts of men some kindness for them, and provide fruits for them: They may haply be grateful

38.Ahmed Ali: O Lord, You have knowledge of what we hide and what we reveal, for nothing on the earth or in the skies is hidden from God

39.Ahmed Ali: All praise be to God who bestowed on me Ishmael and Isaac in old age. Verily my Lord listens to prayer

40.Ahmed Ali: Grant, O Lord, that I and my offspring may remain constant in devotion. Grant, O Lord, my supplication

41.Ahmed Ali: O Lord, forgive me, my parents and the faithful on the Day the reckoning is done."

42.Ahmed Ali: Think not God is oblivious of the deeds of the wicked. He has only allowed them respite till the Day on which all eyes would stare aghast

43.Ahmed Ali: (And) they would hasten forward, heads lifted upwards, gazes fixed, and emptied out their hearts

44.Ahmed Ali: Warn the people of that Day when the punishment would be inflicted upon them. Then will the wicked say: "O our Lord, give us respite a while more. We shall heed Your call and follow the apostles." (But they will be told,): "Are you not those who used to swear: 'There is no reverse for us?

45.Ahmed Ali: Yet you dwelt in the dwellings of those who had exceeded themselves, and it was evident to you how We had dealt with them; and We held out examples before you."

46.Ahmed Ali: Still they are plotting their plots, but evident are their plots to God, even though they are so adroit as to make the mountains move

47.Ahmed Ali: Think not that God would go back on His promise (made) to the apostles. Indeed God is mighty, the Lord of retribution

48.Ahmed Ali: The day when the earth will he replaced by some other than the earth, as will be the skies, and every one will appear before God the one and omnipotent

49.Ahmed Ali: You will see the wicked on that day bound together in chains

50.Ahmed Ali: Of molten pitch shall be their garments, their faces covered with flames

51.Ahmed Ali: That God may reward each soul for its deeds. Indeed God is swift at reckoning

52.Ahmed Ali: This is a message for mankind that they may take a warning from it, and may know that He is the one and only God, and that men of wisdom may reflect

1.Ahmed Ali: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the Book and the perspicuous oration

2.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers would haply like to wish that they had submitted (and become Muslim)

3.Ahmed Ali: Leave them to feast and revel, beguiled by hope; they will come to know soon

4.Ahmed Ali: Not one habitation have We destroyed but at the time determined for it

5.Ahmed Ali: No people can hasten or delay the term already fixed for them

6.Ahmed Ali: And yet they say: "You, to whom this Exposition has been sent are surely possessed of the Devil

7.Ahmed Ali: If you are a man of truth, why can't you bring the angels to us?"

8.Ahmed Ali: But then We never send the angels down save with the purpose (of enforcing their doom), after which they will not be given more respite

9.Ahmed Ali: We have sent down this Exposition, and We will guard it

10.Ahmed Ali: We had also sent apostles to people of earlier persuasions

11.Ahmed Ali: But never once an apostle came to them at whom they did not scoff

12.Ahmed Ali: We place in the hearts of sinners (disbelief)

13.Ahmed Ali: So, they will not believe in it: The example of former people is there

14.Ahmed Ali: Even if We open a door in the heavens and they ascend through it in broad daylight

15.Ahmed Ali: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."

16.Ahmed Ali: We have placed the signs of the Zodiac in the sky, and decked it out for those who can see

17.Ahmed Ali: And We have preserved it from every accursed devil

18.Ahmed Ali: Except the ones who listen on the sly, yet they are chased away by a shooting flame

19.Ahmed Ali: We stretched the earth and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and made all things grow upon it balanced evenly

20.Ahmed Ali: We have provided on it sustenance for you, and for those you cannot provide

21.Ahmed Ali: Of all things there are We have the stores, and send them down in determined measure

22.Ahmed Ali: We send rain-impregnated winds, and water from the sky which you drink, but you are not the keepers of its store

23.Ahmed Ali: It is We who give life and We who give death, and We are the One who will abide

24.Ahmed Ali: We surely know those of you who go forward and those of you who lag behind

25.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord will surely gather them together: Certainly He is all-wise and all-knowing

26.Ahmed Ali: Man We fashioned from fermented clay dried tingling hard

27.Ahmed Ali: As We fashioned jinns before from intense radiated heat

28.Ahmed Ali: But when your Lord said to the angels: "I am verily going to create a human being from fermented clay dried tingling hard

29.Ahmed Ali: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, bow before him in homage;"

30.Ahmed Ali: The angels bowed in homage in a bod

31.Ahmed Ali: Except Iblis. He refused to bow with the adorers

32.Ahmed Ali: "How is it, O Iblis," said (the Lord), "you did not join those who bowed in homage?"

33.Ahmed Ali: "How could I bow," said he, "before a mortal whom You created from fermented clay dried tingling hard?"

34.Ahmed Ali: "Go hence, execrable," (said the Lord), "from this place

35.Ahmed Ali: Condemned till the day of Doom!"

36.Ahmed Ali: "O my Lord," said he, "give me respite till the day the dead are raised."

37.Ahmed Ali: "You are among the reprieved," (said the Lord)

38.Ahmed Ali: "Till the predetermined time."

39.Ahmed Ali: "O my Lord," he said, "since You have led me into error I'll beguile them with the pleasures of the world and lead them astray

40.Ahmed Ali: Except the chosen ones among Your creatures."

41.Ahmed Ali: (To which God) said: "This way is right by Me

42.Ahmed Ali: No power shall you have over (all) My creatures except those who fall into error and follow you

43.Ahmed Ali: For whom the ordained place is surely Hell

44.Ahmed Ali: Which has several gates, and each gate is marked for every section of them."

45.Ahmed Ali: Verily those who keep away from evil and follow the straight path shall be in the midst of gardens and springs of water

46.Ahmed Ali: "Enter in peace and tranquility," (they will be told)

47.Ahmed Ali: We shall cast out any grudge they may have in their hearts. (There) they will sit on couches face to face like brothers together

48.Ahmed Ali: No weariness will come upon them, nor will they be sent away from there

49.Ahmed Ali: Announce to My creatures that I am indeed forgiving and kind

50.Ahmed Ali: But My punishment is surely a painful one

51.Ahmed Ali: Inform them about the matter of Abraham's guests

52.Ahmed Ali: When they came to him and said: "Peace," he answered: "Truly we are afraid of you."

53.Ahmed Ali: "Have no fear," they said. "We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."

54.Ahmed Ali: "You bring me the good news now," he said, "when old age has come upon me. What good news are you giving me then?"

55.Ahmed Ali: "We have given you the happy tidings of a truth," they replied. "So do not be one of those who despair."

56.Ahmed Ali: "Who would despair of the mercy of his Lord," he answered, "but those who go astray."

57.Ahmed Ali: And asked them: "What matter, O angels, brings you here?"

58.Ahmed Ali: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people

59.Ahmed Ali: "Except the family of Lot whom we shall sav

60.Ahmed Ali: "Other than his wife who, it is decreed, will remain with those who will stay behind."

61.Ahmed Ali: When the messengers came to the family of Lot

62.Ahmed Ali: He said: "You are people I do not know."

63.Ahmed Ali: "We have come to you with news," they said, "of what your people doubt

64.Ahmed Ali: "Yet we bring to you the truth, and we are truthful

65.Ahmed Ali: "So leave with your family late in the night, yourself remaining in the rear, and let none turn back to look, and go where you will be commanded."

66.Ahmed Ali: We issued this command to him, for they were going to be destroyed in the morning

67.Ahmed Ali: Then came the people of the city, exulting at the news

68.Ahmed Ali: Said Lot: "These are my guests; do not put me to shame

69.Ahmed Ali: "And do not disgrace me. Have some fear of God."

70.Ahmed Ali: "Did we not restrain you," they said, "from (entertaining) creatures from the outside world?"

71.Ahmed Ali: "Here are my daughters," said Lot, "if you are so active."

72.Ahmed Ali: Verily by your life they were utterly confused in their (lustful) drunkenness

73.Ahmed Ali: So they were seized by the mighty blast at break of day

74.Ahmed Ali: And We turned the city upside down, and rained on them stones of hardened lava

75.Ahmed Ali: Herein are really signs for those who discern

76.Ahmed Ali: This (city) lies on a road that still survives

77.Ahmed Ali: Indeed there is a portent in this for those who believe

78.Ahmed Ali: The dwellers of the Wood (near Midian) were also wicked

79.Ahmed Ali: So We punished them too. They are both situated by the highway, clearly visible

80.Ahmed Ali: The people of Al-Hijr denied Our apostles

81.Ahmed Ali: And though We had given them Our signs they turned away from them

82.Ahmed Ali: They used to hew dwellings in the mountains to live in security

83.Ahmed Ali: But they were seized by the mighty blast towards the morning

84.Ahmed Ali: And all that they had done (for security) availed them nothing

85.Ahmed Ali: We have not created but with reason the heavens and the earth and all that lies within them. The Hour (of the great change) is certain to come. So turn away (from them) with a grace

86.Ahmed Ali: Surely your Lord is the Creator and knows (everything)

87.Ahmed Ali: We have indeed given you the seven oft-repeated (examples), and the majestic Qur'an

88.Ahmed Ali: So covet not things We have bestowed on a portion of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and protect those who believe

89.Ahmed Ali: And say: "I am a distinct warner,"

90.Ahmed Ali: Like (those) We had sent to those schismatics who slandered their Book

91.Ahmed Ali: And severed their Scripture into fragments

92.Ahmed Ali: By your Lord We shall question them one and al

93.Ahmed Ali: About their deeds

94.Ahmed Ali: So declare to them what We have enjoined, and turn away from idolaters

95.Ahmed Ali: We are surely sufficient to deal with those who scoff at you

96.Ahmed Ali: Who place other gods besides God. They will come to know soon

97.Ahmed Ali: We are well aware that you are disheartened by what they say

98.Ahmed Ali: But you should glorify your Lord with praises, and be among those who bow in submission

99.Ahmed Ali: And go on worshipping your Lord till the certainty (of death) comes upon you

1.Ahmed Ali: THE DECREE of GOD will surely come; so do not try to hasten it: Too glorious and high is He for what they associate with Him

2.Ahmed Ali: He sends the angels with revelation by His command, to any of His creatures as He please, (saying): "Warn that there is no god but I, so fear Me."

3.Ahmed Ali: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. Too glorious and high is He for what they associate with Him

4.Ahmed Ali: Man He created from a drop of semen; and still he becomes an open contender

5.Ahmed Ali: He created the cattle from whom you get warm clothing and (other) advantages, and some you eat

6.Ahmed Ali: There is life and cheer for you as you drive them home in the evening, and lead them out in the morning to graze

7.Ahmed Ali: They carry your burdens to lands so distant you could not have reached without much hardship. Indeed your Lord is compassionate and kind

8.Ahmed Ali: He created horses, mules and donkeys for riding and for splendour. He created other things too which you do not know

9.Ahmed Ali: To God leads the right path, though some deviate. If He willed He could guide you all to the right way

10.Ahmed Ali: It is He who sends down water from the sky of which you drink, and which nourishes the plants you feed your cattle

11.Ahmed Ali: With which He makes crops grow, and olives, dates and grapes and fruits of every kind for you. In this is a sign for those who think

12.Ahmed Ali: He harnessed the day and night for you, as also the sun, the moon and the stars, by His command. In this are signs for men who understand

13.Ahmed Ali: And other things of different shades has He produced on the earth for you. In this are signs for those who reflect

14.Ahmed Ali: It is He who has subdued the sea that you may eat fresh meat from it, and obtain ornaments to wear. You see the ships plough through it that you may seek of His bounties and, perhaps, be grateful

15.Ahmed Ali: He placed stablisers in the earth so that while it revolves you live undisturbed, and rivers and tracks so that you may find your way

16.Ahmed Ali: As well as many other signs, as by the stars (you) find direction

17.Ahmed Ali: So, could one who creates be like one who cannot? Will you not then contemplate

18.Ahmed Ali: If you count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Assuredly God is forgiving and kind

19.Ahmed Ali: God knows what you hide and disclose

20.Ahmed Ali: , As for those they call besides God, they cannot create a thing, and have themselves been created

21.Ahmed Ali: Dead, without life they are, and do not know when they will be raised

22.Ahmed Ali: Your God is one God. But the hearts of those who believe not in the life to come are filled with denial, and they are puffed up with pride

23.Ahmed Ali: Surely God knows what they hide and what they disclose. He certainly does not love the proud

24.Ahmed Ali: For when they are asked: "What has your Lord sent down?" they say: "Tales of long ago."

25.Ahmed Ali: On the Day of Resurrection they will carry their own burden and some of the load of those they have led astray without any knowledge. Oh, how evil a burden they will carry

26.Ahmed Ali: Those who have gone before them had also conspired; then God uprooted their structure from its foundation; the roof fell over them from above, and punishment came upon them from somewhere they did not suspect

27.Ahmed Ali: On the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and ask: "Where are My compeers for whom you contended?" Those endowed with knowledge will say: "Shame and evil surely are for unbelievers today."

28.Ahmed Ali: They whose souls are drawn out by the angels while they are sinning, shall offer submission: "We did no evil." But God knows well what you did

29.Ahmed Ali: So enter the gates of Hell, and dwell there for ever. How dreadful a dwelling for the haughty

30.Ahmed Ali: When those who took heed for themselves would be asked: "What did your Lord send down?" They will answer: "The best." For those who do good there is good in the world, but certainly the abode of the next is better. How excellent the home of the virtuous

31.Ahmed Ali: They will enter perennial gardens with streams of water and all they wish. Thus will the pious and devout be rewarded

32.Ahmed Ali: When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."

33.Ahmed Ali: What! Do the (unbelievers) expect that the angels should descend, or the sentence of your Lord come to pass? So had the people done before them; yet God did not wrong them, they wronged themselves

34.Ahmed Ali: The evil they perpetrated overtook them, and what they mocked has turned upon them

35.Ahmed Ali: The idolaters say: "If God had willed we would not have worshipped anything apart from Him, nor would our fathers have done, nor would we have forbidden any thing without His (leave)." So had the people done before them. Therefore it is binding on the prophets to convey the message in clearest terms

36.Ahmed Ali: To every community We have sent an apostle. (saying:) "Worship God, and keep away from all other deities." Thus some of them were guided by God, and ruin was justified on some. Travel over the earth and see what befell those who accused (the apostles) of lies

37.Ahmed Ali: Even if you are eager to guide them, God does not surely guide those who have gone astray: They will have no one to help them

38.Ahmed Ali: They swear emphatically in the name of God that God will not raise the dead. On the contrary, it is a promise incumbent on Him, though most men do not understand

39.Ahmed Ali: For (they fear) He might make what they differed about plain to them, and that the infidels may realise that they were liars

40.Ahmed Ali: Yet when We will a thing We have only to say: "Be", and it is

41.Ahmed Ali: Those who left their homes in the cause of God after having been oppressed, will be given by Us a better place in the world, and if they knew, the guerdon of the next would be greate

42.Ahmed Ali: (For) those who persevere and place their trust in their Lord

43.Ahmed Ali: We sent before you none (as apostles) but men, to whom We sent revelations. In case you are unaware, enquire of those who are keepers of the Oracles of God

44.Ahmed Ali: We had Sent them with miracles and Books; and We have sent to you this Reminder so that you may explain distinctly to men what was sent down to them: They may haply reflect

45.Ahmed Ali: Have the plotters of mischief become unafraid that God will not split the earth to swallow them, or that punishment will not fall upon them from somewhere they do not (even) suspect

46.Ahmed Ali: Or that He will not seize them as they move about, and they will not be able to elude (His grasp)

47.Ahmed Ali: Or He may seize them by diminishing their portion. Yet your Lord is compassionate and kind

48.Ahmed Ali: Do they not see the shadows of all things God has created incline to the right and the left, bowing in obeisance to God

49.Ahmed Ali: All things that move on the earth and in the heavens, and the angels, bow in homage to God, and do not behave with pride

50.Ahmed Ali: They have fear of God for His power over them, and act as commanded

51.Ahmed Ali: God says: "Do not take to two gods, for there is only one God. So fear Me."

52.Ahmed Ali: Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him, and His the judgement for ever. So will you fear any other than God

53.Ahmed Ali: Whatsoever the blessings you enjoy are surely from God, and when in trouble you turn to Him in supplication

54.Ahmed Ali: Yet when He has delivered you from affliction, some of you ascribe companions to your Lor

55.Ahmed Ali: So as to deny what We have bestowed on them. Well, enjoy yourselves, you will come to know soon

56.Ahmed Ali: They set aside a portion of the food We have given them for those they do not know. By God, you will surely have to answer for all you contrive

57.Ahmed Ali: They attribute daughters to God, the glorious, but for themselves whatsoever they please

58.Ahmed Ali: Yet when news of the birth of a daughter reaches one of them, his face is darkened, and he is overwhelmed with silent grief

59.Ahmed Ali: And hides from people for shame at the news, (at a loss) whether he should keep her with shame, or bury her in the ground. How bad is the judgement that they make

60.Ahmed Ali: The semblance of those who believe not in the life to come is that of the meanest; but the semblance of God is the most sublime, for He is all-mighty and all-wise

61.Ahmed Ali: If God were to punish men for their inequity He would not leave a single moving thing on earth. Yet He gives them latitude for a time ordained. When that time is come, there will not be a moment's delay nor a moment's haste

62.Ahmed Ali: Yet they attribute to God what they find detestable; and their tongues assert the lie that for them is only good. On the contrary, there is Fire for them, and they will be thrown into it

63.Ahmed Ali: By God, We sent apostles to many a people before you, but Satan made their acts seem attractive to them, and he is their friend this day, and a painful torment awaits them

64.Ahmed Ali: We have sent down this Book to you that you may explain to them what it is that they are differing about, and as guidance and a grace for those who believe

65.Ahmed Ali: God sends down water from the skies and quickens the dead earth to a new birth. Here is a sign for those who listen

66.Ahmed Ali: And surely in cattle there is a lesson for you: We give you a drink from the extract of food in their bellies and blood-purest milk so delicious to drink

67.Ahmed Ali: And in fruits of the date-palm and the vine, from which you obtain inebriating drinks and excellent food. In this indeed are signs for those who understand

68.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord predisposed the bees to make their hives in mountains, trees and trellices

69.Ahmed Ali: And suck from all fruits and flit about the unrestricted paths of their Lord. A drink of various hues comes out of their bellies which contains medicine for men. In this is a sign for those who reflect

70.Ahmed Ali: It is God who creates you, then makes you die; and some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they had known before. God is indeed all-knowing and all-powerful

71.Ahmed Ali: God has favoured some of you over others in the means of subsistence. But those who have been favoured with more do not give of their means to their dependents so that they may become equal with them. Do they then deny God's beneficence

72.Ahmed Ali: God has provided mates for you of your own kind, and has bestowed on you sons and daughters from your mates, and has given you good things for food. Will they even then believe in the false and deny God's grace

73.Ahmed Ali: Yet they worship those apart from God who cannot provide for them any sustenance from the heavens or the earth, nor will they have power to do so

74.Ahmed Ali: So do not invent similitudes for God. Indeed God knows, and you do not know

75.Ahmed Ali: God presents the example of a man who is a hired servant with no power over anything, and another on whom We have bestowed a handsome fortune, who spends from it in private and in public: Can they be equal? Praised be God! But most men do not understand

76.Ahmed Ali: God presents another example of two men, one dumb and unable to do a thing and is a burden on his master. Wherever he is sent he returns without any good (result). Could he be equal to one who enjoins what is just, and follows the right path

77.Ahmed Ali: To God belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and the Hour of Doom is a matter of the winking of an eye, even less, for God has certainly power over all things

78.Ahmed Ali: God produced you from your mothers' wombs knowing nothing, but gave you ears and eyes and hearts so that you may be grateful

79.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see the birds held high between the heavens and the earth? Nothing holds them (aloft) but God. There are verily signs in this for those who believe

80.Ahmed Ali: God has given you homes to live in, and tents (made) from the hides of cattle convenient for days of travelling and halting; and from their wool and fur and hair you make domestic articles and goods that last a certain time

81.Ahmed Ali: God has given you of things created, shade, and places of shelter in the mountains, and clothes for protection against the heat, and coats (of mail) for defence during war. He thus bestows His favours on you so that you may be grateful to Him

82.Ahmed Ali: If they still turn away, your duty is to warn them in clear terms

83.Ahmed Ali: They do know the favours of God, and yet they deny them, for most of them are not grateful

84.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall call a witness from every people, the unbelievers will not be allowed to make excuses

85.Ahmed Ali: And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased, nor will they be reprieved

86.Ahmed Ali: When the idolaters see their partners they will call out: "O our Lord, these are the partners we invoked instead of You;" but they will retort: "You are liars."

87.Ahmed Ali: They will offer submission to God that Day, and the lies they fabricated will not be of the least avail

88.Ahmed Ali: For those who deny the truth and obstruct (others) from the way of God, We shall add torment to torment as they were perpetrating corruption

89.Ahmed Ali: Remind them of the Day when We shall call from every people a witness against them, and make you a witness over them, for We have revealed to you the Book as an exposition of everything, and as guidance and grace and happy tidings for those who submit

90.Ahmed Ali: Verily God has enjoined justice, the doing of good, and the giving of gifts to your relatives; and forbidden indecency, impropriety and oppression. He warns you so that you may remember

91.Ahmed Ali: Fulfil your covenant with God, having made the covenant, and do not break your oaths once you have sworn them, as you have made God a witness over you. Indeed God knows what you do

92.Ahmed Ali: And do not be like her who untwists her yarn having spun it into durable thread. Do not use your oaths deceitfully because one party has ascendency over you. God surely tries you in this way: He will make it clear to you on the Day of Resurrection what you were differing about

93.Ahmed Ali: If God had pleased He would surely have made you a single community of belief; but He leads whosoever He wills astray, and guides whosoever He please. But you will surely be questioned about what you used to do

94.Ahmed Ali: So do not make your oaths a means of deceiving one another, lest your foot should slip after having found its hold, and you taste of evil for having hindered (others) from the way of God, and suffer a grievous punishment

95.Ahmed Ali: And do not trade God's covenant for a paltry price. Remember, what is with God is better for you, if only you knew

96.Ahmed Ali: For what you possess will pass, but what is with God will abide. We shall certainly award those who persevere a recompense in keeping with their deeds

97.Ahmed Ali: We shall invest whosoever works for good, whether man or woman, with a pleasant life, and reward them in accordance with the best of what they have done

98.Ahmed Ali: So, when you recite the Qur'an seek refuge in God from Satan the execrable

99.Ahmed Ali: He does not have power over those who believe and place their trust in their Lord

100.Ahmed Ali: His power is only over those who take him as their patron, and those who ascribe equals (to God)

101.Ahmed Ali: When We replace a message with another -- and God knows best what He reveals -- they say: "You have made it up;" yet most of them do not know

102.Ahmed Ali: You say: "It has been sent by divine grace from your Lord with truth to strengthen those who believe, and as guidance and good news for those who have submitted (to God)."

103.Ahmed Ali: Yet We know what they say: "It is only a man who instructs him." The speech of the man they imply is obscure while this is clear Arabic

104.Ahmed Ali: Those who do not believe in the words of God are verily not guided by God. For them is severe punishment

105.Ahmed Ali: They alone invent lies who do not believe in the words of God, and they are liars

106.Ahmed Ali: Whosoever denies having once believed -- unless he is forced to do so while his heart enjoys the peace of faith -- and opens his mind to disbelief will suffer the wrath of God. Their punishment will be great

107.Ahmed Ali: For they loved the life of this world more than the life to come; and God does not guide those who do not believe

108.Ahmed Ali: They are the ones whose hearts and ears and eyes have been sealed by God; and these are the heedless

109.Ahmed Ali: They will surely be losers in the life to come

110.Ahmed Ali: But (to) those who were victimised and left their homes and then fought and endured patiently, your Lord will surely be forgiving and kind

111.Ahmed Ali: On the day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be recompensed for what it had done, no one will be wronged

112.Ahmed Ali: God presents the example of a town which enjoyed peace and security, its provisions coming from everywhere in abundance, but it denied the favours of God; so God acquainted it with intimate hunger and fear (as punishment) for what they had done

113.Ahmed Ali: An apostle came to them who was one of them, but they called him a liar. Then they were seized by torment for they were sinners

114.Ahmed Ali: Eat the good and lawful of things that God has given you, and be grateful for the bounty of God, if you really worship Him

115.Ahmed Ali: He has forbidden carrion and blood and the flesh of the swine, and what has been killed in the name of any other but God; but if one is driven by necessity (to eat it) without craving or reverting to it, then God is forgiving and kind

116.Ahmed Ali: Do not utter the lies your tongues make up: "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," in order to impute lies to God; for they who impute lies to God will not find fulfilment

117.Ahmed Ali: For them there is some enjoyment, but the punishment is painful

118.Ahmed Ali: We have already told you what We have forbidden the Jews. We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves

119.Ahmed Ali: To those who do wrong out of ignorance, then repent and correct themselves, your Lord is indeed forgiving and kind

120.Ahmed Ali: Abraham was certainly a model of faith, obedient to God and upright, and not one of idolaters

121.Ahmed Ali: Grateful to Him for His favours; so He chose him and guided him to the path that is straight

122.Ahmed Ali: And gave him what is good in the world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous and the good

123.Ahmed Ali: So We commanded you to follow the way of Abraham the upright who was not of idolaters

124.Ahmed Ali: As for the Sabbath, it was imposed on those who had differed about it; and your Lord will tell them on the Day of Resurrection what it was they had differed about

125.Ahmed Ali: Call them to the path of your Lord with wisdom and words of good advice; and reason with them in the best way possible. Your Lord surely knows who strays from His path, and He knows those who are guided the right way

126.Ahmed Ali: If you have to retaliate, do so to the extent you have been injured; but if you forbear it is best for those who bear with fortitude

127.Ahmed Ali: Endure with patience, for your endurance is not without the help of God. Do not grieve for them, and do not be distressed by their plots

128.Ahmed Ali: God is verily with those who are pious and devout, and those who are doers of good

1.Ahmed Ali: GLORY TO HIM who took His votary to a wide and open land from the Sacred Mosque (at Makkah) to the distant Mosque whose precincts We have blessed, that We may show him some of Our signs. Verily He is all-hearing and all-seeing

2.Ahmed Ali: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a guidance for the children of Israel that they should not take another protector apart from Me

3.Ahmed Ali: O you, the offspring of those We bore (in the ark) with Noah, he was indeed a grateful votary

4.Ahmed Ali: We announced to the children of Israel in the Book: "You will surely create disorder twice in the land, and become exceedingly arrogant."

5.Ahmed Ali: So, when the time of the first prediction came, We sent against you Our creatures full of martial might, who ransacked your cities; and the prediction was fulfilled

6.Ahmed Ali: Then We gave you a chance against them, and strengthened you with wealth and children, and increased your numbers (and said)

7.Ahmed Ali: "If you do good, you will do so for your own good; if you do ill, you will do it for your own loss." So, when the time of the second prediction comes, (We shall rouse another people) to shame you, and enter the Temple as they had done the first time, and to destroy what they conquered utterly

8.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord may haply be merciful to you. But if you repeat it, We shall do the same. We have constituted Hell as prison for unbelievers

9.Ahmed Ali: Verily this Qur'an directs you to the path that is straight, and gives happy tidings to those who believe and do the right: For them is a great reward

10.Ahmed Ali: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared a painful punishment

11.Ahmed Ali: Man prays for evil as he prays for good, for man is hasty

12.Ahmed Ali: We have created night and day as two signs, then We efface the sign of the night, and make the sign of the day resplendent that you may seek the bounty of your Lord, and know the computation of years and numbers. We have expounded most distinctly everything

13.Ahmed Ali: Round each man's neck We have hung his ledger of deeds, and on the Day of Resurrection will present it as a book spread out (and say)

14.Ahmed Ali: "Read your ledger; this day you are sufficient to take your own account

15.Ahmed Ali: "He who finds the right path does so for himself; and he who goes astray does so to his own loss; and no one who carries a burden bears another's load. We never punish till We have sent a messenger

16.Ahmed Ali: "And when We destroy a human habitation We send Our command to (warn) its people living a life of ease; and when they disobey, the sentence against them is justified, and We destroy them utterly

17.Ahmed Ali: "How many generations have We laid low after Noah, for your Lord knows and notices well enough the sins of His creatures

18.Ahmed Ali: "Whosoever desires what hastes away, We hasten to give him (in this life) as much as We please to whosoever We will; but afterwards there is Hell for him in which he will burn, disgraced and ostracised

19.Ahmed Ali: "But he who desires the Hereafter, and strives for it with a will, and is a believer, will be favoured for his endeavour

20.Ahmed Ali: "We bestow from the gifts of your Lord on these and on those, for the gifts of your Lord are not restricted

21.Ahmed Ali: "See, how We favour one over the other; and in life to come are higher ranks and favours greater still

22.Ahmed Ali: "Do not set up another god with God, or you will remain disgraced and destitute

23.Ahmed Ali: "So your Lord has decreed: Do not worship anyone but Him, and be good to your parents. If one or both of them grow old in your presence, do not say fie to them, nor reprove them, but say gentle words to the

24.Ahmed Ali: "And look after them with kindness and love, and say: "O Lord, have mercy on them as they nourished me when I was small."

25.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord knows what is in your heart. If you are righteous, then He is indeed forgiving to those who turn (to Him) in repentance

26.Ahmed Ali: So give to your relatives what is their due, and to those who are needy, and the wayfarers; and do not dissipate (your wealth) extravagantly

27.Ahmed Ali: Those who dissipate (their wealth) are the brethren of the devils, and the Devil was ungrateful to his Lord

28.Ahmed Ali: If you neglect (your parents) while seeking the bounty of your Lord, of which you are hopeful, speak to them softly

29.Ahmed Ali: Do not be niggardly, nor extravagant that you may later feel reprehensive and constrained

30.Ahmed Ali: Certainly your Lord provides with open hands whosoever He will, but according to capacity, for He knows and watches His creatures

31.Ahmed Ali: Do not abandon your children out of fear of poverty. We will provide for them and for you. Killing them is certainly a great wrong

32.Ahmed Ali: And do not go near fornication, as it is immoral and an evil way

33.Ahmed Ali: And do not take a life, which God has forbidden, except in a just cause. We have given the right (of redress) to the heir of the person who is killed, but he should not exceed the limits (of justice) by slaying (the killer), for he will be judged (by the same law)

34.Ahmed Ali: And do not touch the property of the orphans except for bettering it, until they come of age; and fulfil the promise made: You will surely be questioned about the promise

35.Ahmed Ali: Give full measure when you are measuring, and weigh on a balanced scale. This is better, and excellent its consequence

36.Ahmed Ali: Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Verily the ear, the eye, the heart, each will be questioned

37.Ahmed Ali: And do not strut about the land with insolence: Surely you cannot cleave the earth, nor attain the height of mountains in stature

38.Ahmed Ali: All these are evil and odious to your Lord

39.Ahmed Ali: This is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. So do not take another god apart from God, or you will be cast into Hell, reproved, ostracised

40.Ahmed Ali: Has God chosen to give you sons, and taken for Himself daughters from among the angels? You utter grievous things indeed

41.Ahmed Ali: We have explained (the truth) in various ways in this Qur'an, that they may be warned; but it only increased their refractoriness

42.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Had there been other gods with Him, as they assert, they would surely have sought a way (of opposition) against the Lord of the Throne."

43.Ahmed Ali: Too glorious and high is He, too exalted for what they say

44.Ahmed Ali: The seven skies, the earth, and all that lies within them, sing hallelujas to Him. There is nothing that does not chant His praises, but you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is verily clement and forgiving

45.Ahmed Ali: When you recite the Qur'an, We place a hidden veil between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter

46.Ahmed Ali: And We put covers over their hearts and deafness in their ears that they should not understand it. So when you invoke your Lord alone in the Qur'an they turn their backs and walk away

47.Ahmed Ali: We know well with what (intent) they hear you, for when they confer privately the wicked say: "You follow but a man deluded."

48.Ahmed Ali: See, what comparisons they coin for you, and go astray, and thus cannot find the way

49.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "When we are turned to bones and bits, shall we be raised as a new creation?"

50.Ahmed Ali: Tell them: "(Even if) you turn to stones or steel

51.Ahmed Ali: Or some other created thing which may seem to you most difficult (to create)!" They will then say: "Who will revert us back?" Say: "He who originated you in the first place." They will shake their heads at you and say: "When will that be?" Say: "In the near future, perhaps

52.Ahmed Ali: "On the day when He will call you, and you will answer with His praises and imagine you did not tarry but a while."

53.Ahmed Ali: Tell My creatures only to speak words that are good. Verily Satan sows dissensions: Satan is indeed the acknowledged enemy of mankind

54.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord knows you better: He may have mercy on you if He please, or punish you if He will. Yet We have not sent you as warden over them
