55.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord knows whoever is in the heavens and the earth. We exalted some of the prophets over the others; and to David We gave the Book of Psalms

56.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Call those whom you imagine to be gods besides Him; yet they have no power to relieve you of any distress or to avert it."

57.Ahmed Ali: Those they invoke themselves seek the way to their Lord, (striving) which one of them shall be nearest (to Him); and hope for His grace, and dread His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is to be feared

58.Ahmed Ali: There is not a habitation We shall not destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or not inflict severe punishment upon it. This is in accordance with the law (of God)

59.Ahmed Ali: Nothing could stop Us from sending signs except that the earlier people had rejected them as lies. We sent to Thamud the she-camel as a token to make it clear to them, but they treated her cruelly; and We send signs only to deter

60.Ahmed Ali: When We said to you: "Verily your Lord circumscribes mankind," and showed you the vision and the accursed tree of the Qur'an, it was as a bone of contention for men. Thus do We (instil) fear in them; but they only transgress the more

61.Ahmed Ali: When We asked the angels to bow before Adam, they all bowed but Iblis, who said: "Can I bow before him whom You created from clay?"

62.Ahmed Ali: (And) said: "Look! This is what you have honoured above me! If You defer (my term) till the Day of Resurrection, I will bring his progeny into complete subjugation, barring a few."

63.Ahmed Ali: (And God) said: "Away! Whosoever of them follows you will surely have Hell with you as requital -- an ample recompense

64.Ahmed Ali: Mislead any of them you may with your voice, attack them with your cavalry and soldiers on foot, share their wealth and children with them, and make promises to them." -- But the promises of Satan are nothing but deceit

65.Ahmed Ali: "You will surely have no power over My devotees: Your Lord is sufficient as their protector."

66.Ahmed Ali: It is your Lord who drives your ships across the seas that you may seek of His bounty. He is verily kind to you

67.Ahmed Ali: When a calamity befalls you on the sea, all those you invoke fail you except Him. But when He brings you safely to the shore, you turn away, for man is most ungrateful

68.Ahmed Ali: Have you then become so sure that He will not cleave the earth and sink you in it by the shore, or send a gale against you, when you will not find any protector

69.Ahmed Ali: Or you feel so secure that He will not send you back (to sea) again or send a gravel-hurtling storm against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will not find any avenger against Us

70.Ahmed Ali: Indeed We have honoured the children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, provided them with good things for their sustenance, and exalted them over many of Our creatures

71.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall summon all men with their leaders, whosoever is given his record in his right hand will be able to read his account, and none will be wronged the breadth of a thread

72.Ahmed Ali: But whoso has been blind in this world shall be blind in the world to come, even farther astray from the path

73.Ahmed Ali: They had almost led you away from what has been revealed to you, that you may invent things about Us besides those revealed, when they would have taken you as friend

74.Ahmed Ali: If We had not kept you constant you had almost leaned towards them

75.Ahmed Ali: In that case We would have made you taste a double anguish of life and a double anguish of death, and then you would not have been able to find a helper against Us for yourself

76.Ahmed Ali: They had nearly expelled you from the land and driven you away from it. But then, they too would have stayed but a little after you

77.Ahmed Ali: This has been Our way with the apostles whom We sent before you. You will not find any variation in Our line of action

78.Ahmed Ali: Observe the service of prayer from the sun's declining from the meridian to the darkening of the night, and the recitation at dawn. Indeed the Recitation at dawn is palpably evident

79.Ahmed Ali: Say a supererogatory prayer at the hour of the first watch: Your Lord may raise you to a most exalted station

80.Ahmed Ali: And pray: "O my Lord, let my entry be with honour, and let my exit be with honour, and grant me power from You which would help (sustain) me."

81.Ahmed Ali: And say: "Truth has come and falsehood nullified." Verily falsehood is perishable

82.Ahmed Ali: What We have sent down of the Qur'an is a healing and a grace for the faithful, and adds only loss for the sinners

83.Ahmed Ali: When We are gracious to man he turns away and moves aside; yet when evil befalls him he begins to despair

84.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Each one acts according to his disposition, but your Lord knows well who follow the right path."

85.Ahmed Ali: They ask you about revelation. Say, revelation is by the command of your Lord, and that you have been given but little knowledge

86.Ahmed Ali: If We pleased We could take away what We have revealed to you. Then you will not find any one to plead for it with Us

87.Ahmed Ali: Unless your Lord have mercy. His blessings on you are great indeed

88.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Surely if men and jinns get together to produce the like of this (Qur'an), they will not be able to produce the like of it, however they might assist one another

89.Ahmed Ali: We have given examples of every kind to men in this Qur'an in various ways, and even then most men disdain everything but unbelief

90.Ahmed Ali: And say: "We will not believe you until you make a spring of water gush forth from the earth for us

91.Ahmed Ali: Or, until you acquire an orchard of date-palm trees and grapes, and produce rivers flowing through it

92.Ahmed Ali: Or, let chunks of sky fall over us, as you assert (you will); or, bring God and the angels as a surety

93.Ahmed Ali: Or, you come to possess a house of gold; or ascend to the skies, though we shall not believe in your having ascended till you bring down a book for us which we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord. I am only man and a messenger."

94.Ahmed Ali: Nothing prevented men from believing when guidance came to them, other than (what) they said: "Has God sent (only) a man as messenger?"

95.Ahmed Ali: Say: "If angels had peopled the earth and walked about in peace and quiet, We would surely have sent to them an angel as messenger

96.Ahmed Ali: Tell them: "God is sufficient witness between me and you, for He knows His creatures well, and is well-informed."

97.Ahmed Ali: He is guided whom God guides. As for him He allows to go astray, you will not find a protector other than Him. We shall raise them on the Day of Resurrection in their own image, blind and dumb and deaf: Their habitation will be Hell. Every time (its fire) subsides We will intensify its flame

98.Ahmed Ali: This will be their retribution for having denied Our signs and said: "Once we are turned to bones and bits, can we be raised as a new creation?"

99.Ahmed Ali: Do they not perceive that God, who created the heavens and the earth, has the power to create the like of them? There is no doubt that. He has fixed a term for them. Even then the wicked disdain everything but unbelief

100.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Even if you owned the stores of the mercy of my Lord, you would have held them back for fear of spending them, for man is niggardly."

101.Ahmed Ali: We gave Moses nine clear signs; so ask the children of Israel. When (Moses) came to them the Pharaoh said: "I think, O Moses, you have been deluded."

102.Ahmed Ali: He replied: "You know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these (signs) as cogent proof. I truly think, O Pharaoh, your days are done."

103.Ahmed Ali: Then he sought to turn them out of the land, but We drowned him and all his followers

104.Ahmed Ali: After this We told the children of Israel: "Dwell in the land. When the promise of reckoning comes, We shall bring you together from a motley crowd

105.Ahmed Ali: We have sent it down with truth, and with truth has (the Qur'an) come down. And We have sent you only to give good news and to warn

106.Ahmed Ali: We have divided the Qur'an into parts that you may recite it to men slowly, with deliberation. That is why We sent it down by degrees

107.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Believe in it or do not believe: Those who were given knowledge before it bow in adoration when it is read out to them

108.Ahmed Ali: And say: "Glory be to our Lord. The promise of our Lord has indeed been fulfilled."

109.Ahmed Ali: And weeping they kneel down, and this increases their humility

110.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Call Him Allah or call Him Ar-Rahman; whatever the name you call Him by, all His names are beautiful." Do not say your prayers too loudly or in too low a voice, but follow a middle coarse

111.Ahmed Ali: And say: "All praise be to God who has neither begotten a son nor has a partner in His kingdom; nor has He need of any one to protect Him from ignominy. So extol Him by extolling His majesty."

1.Ahmed Ali: ALL PRAISE BE to God who has revealed to His votary the Book which is free of all obliquity

2.Ahmed Ali: Immutable, so that it may warn of a severe punishment from Him; and give happy tidings to those who believe and do the right that there is a better reward (of Paradise) for them

3.Ahmed Ali: Where they will abide for ever

4.Ahmed Ali: And that it may warn those who say: "God has begotten a son."

5.Ahmed Ali: They have no knowledge of this, as their fathers did not have. How terrible are the words they utter! They speak nothing but lies

6.Ahmed Ali: Will you kill yourself for grief of them if they do not believe in this presentation

7.Ahmed Ali: We have made whatever exists on the earth its adornment to test and try them (and) know who acts better

8.Ahmed Ali: For We shall certainly turn it to barren dust

9.Ahmed Ali: Do you think the men of the cave and Ar-Raqim were so strange among Our signs

10.Ahmed Ali: When those young men took shelter in the cave, and prayed: "O Lord, grant us Your favour and dispose our affair aright,"

11.Ahmed Ali: We sealed off their ears in the cave for a number of years

12.Ahmed Ali: Then roused them to ascertain which of the two groups could account for the period they had stayed

13.Ahmed Ali: We narrate their story to you in all truth. They were a few young men who believed in their Lord; so We gave them greater guidance

14.Ahmed Ali: And strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We shall invoke no god beside Him, for we shall have uttered a blasphemy then

15.Ahmed Ali: As for these our people here, they have taken to other gods apart from Him. Then why do they not bring a clear authority for them? Who is more wicked than he who fabricates a lie against God?"

16.Ahmed Ali: (And they said to each other:) "Now that you have withdrawn from them and what they worship beside God, it is better to take refuge in the cave. Your Lord may bestow of His mercy on you, and facilitate your affair."

17.Ahmed Ali: You may well have seen when the sun came up it moved away to the right of the cave, and when it went down it turned away to the left, and they stayed in its open space. This was among the signs of God. Whoever is guided by God follows the right path; and whosoever goes astray will not find a guide to show him the way

18.Ahmed Ali: You may have thought that they were awake, yet they were asleep. We made them turn right and left, while their dog lay with his forelegs stretched across the threshold. If you had looked at them you would have surely turned away and fled with horror at the sight

19.Ahmed Ali: Even so We roused them that they may question one another. One of them asked: "How long have you stayed here?" They said: "A day or less than a day." "Your Lord knows best," they said, "how long you have stayed. So send one of you to the town with this money of yours to look for wholesome food and bring it for you; but he should be careful not to let your presence known

20.Ahmed Ali: If they come to know of you they will stone you to death, or force you to go back to their creed; then you will never succeed."

21.Ahmed Ali: Thus did We inform the people about them that they may know the promise of God is true, and there is no doubt that the Hour will come. As they were arguing among themselves as to what should be done with them, (some) said: "Erect a monument over them. Their Lord is best cognisant of them." Those who prevailed, said: "We shall build a place of worship over their (sepulchre)."

22.Ahmed Ali: Some will say: "They were three, and their dog was the fourth;" and some will also say: "They were five and their dog was the sixth," -- guessing in the dark. And some will even say: "They were seven, and their dog the eighth." Say: "My Lord alone knows best their number; none but only a few know of them." So do not argue about it with them but lightly, and do not enquire about them from any one of them

23.Ahmed Ali: Do not say of any thing: "I will do it tomorrow,"

24.Ahmed Ali: Without (adding), "if God may please;" and think of your Lord in ease you forget, and say: "Perhaps my Lord will show me a nearer way to rectitude."

25.Ahmed Ali: (It is said) they stayed in the cave three hundred years and nine

26.Ahmed Ali: You say: "God only knows how long they stayed. He alone knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. How distinctly He sees and hears! They have no other guardian but Him, and He does not share His authority with any one."

27.Ahmed Ali: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no one who can change the word of God; and you will not find refuge except in Him

28.Ahmed Ali: Persevere with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His magnificence. Do not turn your eyes away from them, seeking the splendours of this world, and do not follow him whose heart We have made oblivious to Our remembrance, who follows his own lust and exceeds the bound

29.Ahmed Ali: Say: "The truth is from your Lord: So believe if you like, or do not believe if you will." We have prepared for the sinners a fire which will envelope them in its tent. If they ask for water they will be helped to liquid like molten brass that would scald their mouths. How evil the drink, and evil the resting-place

30.Ahmed Ali: But surely We do not let the reward of those who believe and do the right to go waste

31.Ahmed Ali: There will be gardens of Eden for them, with rivers flowing by, where they will be decked in bracelets of gold, with silken robes of green and of brocades to wear, reclining on couches. How excellent the guerdon, and excellent the resting-place

32.Ahmed Ali: Tell them the parable of two men. We gave one two gardens of grapes surrounded by date-palm trees, with corn fields in between

33.Ahmed Ali: Each of the gardens yielded its fruit and did not withhold the least; and We made a stream flow in between them

34.Ahmed Ali: So he became rich. Arguing one day with his friend he said: "I have more wealth than you and more powerful kinsmen."

35.Ahmed Ali: And he walked into his garden, and, (forgetting) his limit, said: "I cannot imagine that this will ever be ruined

36.Ahmed Ali: Nor can I think that the Hour (of Doom) will come, And even if I am brought back to my Lord, I will surely find a better place there than this."

37.Ahmed Ali: Disputing with him, his companion said: "Do you disbelieve in Him who created you from dust, then a drop of semen, then formed you into a man

38.Ahmed Ali: And He is God, my Lord, and I do not associate any one with my Lord

39.Ahmed Ali: When you entered your garden, why did you not say: 'As God may please;' for no one has power except given by God? Though you see me poorer in wealth and children than you

40.Ahmed Ali: Yet, my Lord may haply give me a garden better than yours, and He may send a thunder-bolt, from the skies and in the morning it will be a barren plain

41.Ahmed Ali: Or else of a morning its water may sink underground, and you will not find a trace of it."

42.Ahmed Ali: And his vines were overtaken (with disaster), and he began to wring his hands (at the loss) of what he had spent on them, for the vines had fallen upon their trellises; and he said: "Would to God that I had not associated any one with my Lord."

43.Ahmed Ali: He had no body to help him other than God, nor was he able to save himself

44.Ahmed Ali: The jurisdiction in this province belongs to God. His is the best reward, and His the best requital

45.Ahmed Ali: Present to them the example of the life of this world so like the water We send down from the skies that mingles with the earth to nourish its vegetation, which then on the morrow turns to stubble and is blown away by the wind. God has power over everything

46.Ahmed Ali: Wealth and children are only the gloss of this world, but good deeds that abide are better with your Lord for recompense, and better for expectation

47.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall move the mountains, and you see the earth an open plain, We shall gather them together, leaving none behind

48.Ahmed Ali: They will be arraigned before their Lord row on row, (and He will say): "Well, you have come to Us as We had first created you, even though you imagined We had fixed no time for this meeting."

49.Ahmed Ali: The ledger (of their deeds) would be placed before them. Then you will see the sinners terrified at its contents, and say: "Alas, what a written revelation this, which has not left unaccounted the smallest or the greatest thing!" They will find in it whatsoever they had done. Your Lord does not wrong any one

50.Ahmed Ali: When We said to the angels: "Bow before Adam in adoration," they all bowed but Iblis. He was one of the jinni and rebelled against his Lord's command. And yet you take him and his offspring as your friends instead of Me, even though they are your enemies. How sad a substitute for the evil-doers

51.Ahmed Ali: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation. I would not take as helpers those who lead (men) astray

52.Ahmed Ali: The day He will say: "Call those you had called My compeers," they will call them, but will get no response, and We shall place a gulf between them

53.Ahmed Ali: The sinners will see the Fire and know that they will be thrown into it and will not find a way of escape from it

54.Ahmed Ali: We have explained in various ways all things to men in this Qur'an; but of all things man is most contentious

55.Ahmed Ali: There is nothing to prevent men from believing when the guidance has come to them, and asking for their Lord's forgiveness, unless they want the example of earlier people visited upon them, or the punishment to appear right before their eyes

56.Ahmed Ali: We never send apostles but to convey happy tidings, and to warn. But those who disbelieve contend with false arguments to nullify the truth. They make a mockery of My revelations and of what they had been warned

57.Ahmed Ali: Who is more unjust than he who, on being reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets the evil deeds he had committed in the past. Verily We have placed a covering on their hearts so that they do not understand, and a deafness in their ears so that however you may call them to guidance they will never be guided aright

58.Ahmed Ali: But your Lord is forgiving, full of benevolence. If He had pleased to punish them for their doings He would have punished them immediately. But a term is fixed for them from which they will find no escape

59.Ahmed Ali: As for these habitations, We destroyed them only when they transgressed; even so We had fixed a time for their annihilation

60.Ahmed Ali: When Moses said to his servant (Joshua): "I will not give up till I reach the confluence of two oceans, or I will journey on and on."

61.Ahmed Ali: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea

62.Ahmed Ali: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."

63.Ahmed Ali: He said: "You see, I forgot the fish on the rock where we had stopped. Only Satan made me forget to mention this; but the wonder is the fish escaped to the sea."

64.Ahmed Ali: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps

65.Ahmed Ali: Then they found one of Our votaries, whom We had blessed and given knowledge from Us

66.Ahmed Ali: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"

67.Ahmed Ali: He said: "You will not be able to bear with me

68.Ahmed Ali: "How can you bear that which is beyond your comprehension?"

69.Ahmed Ali: "You will find me patient if God wills," said Moses; "and I will not disobey you in any thing."

70.Ahmed Ali: "If you must follow me," he said, "do not ask me any thing until I speak of it to you myself."

71.Ahmed Ali: So they set out till they (came to the quay) and went on board a ship in which he made a hole, (and Moses said:) "You have made a hole in the boat to drown its passengers? You have done a strange thing!"

72.Ahmed Ali: "Did I not tell you," he replied, "that you will not be able to bear with me?"

73.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."

74.Ahmed Ali: The two went on till they came to a boy, whom he killed. Moses exclaimed: "You have killed an innocent soul who had taken no life. You have done a most abominable thing!"

75.Ahmed Ali: He said: "Did I not tell you you will not be able to bear with me?"

76.Ahmed Ali: Moses said: "If I ask you any thing again then do not keep me with you. You have my apology."

77.Ahmed Ali: The two went on till they came upon some villagers, and asked the people for food, but they refused to entertain them. There they found a wall that was crumbling, which he repaired. Moses remarked: "You could have demanded wages for it if you liked."

78.Ahmed Ali: "This is the parting of our "ways," he said. "But I will now explain the things you could not bear

79.Ahmed Ali: That boat belonged to poor people who used to toil on the sea. I damaged it because there was a king after them who used to seize every ship by force

80.Ahmed Ali: As for the boy, his parents were believers, but we feared that he would harass them with defiance and disbelief

81.Ahmed Ali: We hoped their Lord would give them a substitute better than him in virtue and goodness

82.Ahmed Ali: As for that wall, it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and their treasure was buried under it. Their father was an upright man. So your Lord willed that on reaching the age of maturity they should dig out their treasure as a favour from their Lord. So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."

83.Ahmed Ali: They ask you about Dhu'l-Qarnain

84.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I will cite before you his commemoration." We gave him authority in the land and means of accomplishing every end

85.Ahmed Ali: So he followed a certain roa

86.Ahmed Ali: Till he reached the point of the setting sun, and saw it set behind a muddy lake, and near it found a people. We said: "O Dhu'l-Qarnain, you may either punish them or treat them with kindness."

87.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I shall punish whosoever is wicked. He will then be sent back to his Lord who will inflict on him a terrible punishment

88.Ahmed Ali: But he who believes and does the right will have an excellent reward, and we shall make things easy for him."

89.Ahmed Ali: He then followed (another) roa

90.Ahmed Ali: Till he reached the point of the rising sun, and saw it rise over a people for whom We had provided no shelter against it

91.Ahmed Ali: It was so, for We were fully informed about him

92.Ahmed Ali: He then followed (another) roa

93.Ahmed Ali: Till he reached a place between two mountains, and found this side of it a people who understood but little of what was spoken

94.Ahmed Ali: They said: 'O Dhu'l-Qarnain, Gog and Magog are oppressing the land. May we pay you some tribute so that you could build a rampart between us and them?"

95.Ahmed Ali: He said: "The ability my Lord has given me is better. So help me with your manual labour; I will build a wall between you and them

96.Ahmed Ali: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up. "Blow your bellows," he said; (and they blew) until it was red hot. "Bring me molten brass," he said, "that I may pour over it."

97.Ahmed Ali: Thus (Gog and Magog) could neither climb over it nor dig a hole through (the rampart)

98.Ahmed Ali: "This is the benevolence of my Lord," he said; "but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will reduce it to a mound of dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."

99.Ahmed Ali: We shall leave them on that day surging like waves pressing one against the other, and the trumpet blast will be sounded, when We shall gather them all together

100.Ahmed Ali: Then We shall bring Hell right before the infidel

101.Ahmed Ali: Whose eyes were veiled against My warning, and they could not hear

102.Ahmed Ali: Do the unbelievers think they can make My own creatures their protectors against Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of infidels

103.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Shall I tell you whose labour will be wasted

104.Ahmed Ali: Theirs whose effort is misspent in pursuit of the pleasures of the world, even though they think they are doing good things."

105.Ahmed Ali: They are those who reject the signs of their Lord, and the meeting with Him. So their good deeds will be fruitless, and on the Day of Judgement We shall not appoint any weighing for them

106.Ahmed Ali: Their requital will be Hell, because they disbelieved and mocked My signs and messengers

107.Ahmed Ali: But surely those who believe and do the right will have gardens of Paradise as gift

108.Ahmed Ali: Where they will abide for ever, never wanting a change

109.Ahmed Ali: Say: "If the ocean turned to ink for writing down the colloquy of my Lord, the ocean itself would be exhausted ere the words (and wonders) of my Lord come to end, even if we brought another like it for replenishment."

110.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am only a man like you, but it has been communicated to me that your Lord is one and single God, and that whosoever hopes to meet his Lord should do what is right, and not associate any one in the worship of his Lord."

1.Ahmed Ali: KAF HA YA 'AIN SAD

2.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate the beneficence of your Lord on Zachariah, His devotee

3.Ahmed Ali: When he called to his Lord inwardly

4.Ahmed Ali: And said: "O my Lord, my bones decay, my head is white and hoary, yet in calling You, O Lord, I have never been deprived

5.Ahmed Ali: But I fear my relatives after me; and my wife is barren. So grant me a successor as a favour from Yo

6.Ahmed Ali: Who will be heir to me, and heir to the house of Jacob; and make him obedient to You, O Lord."

7.Ahmed Ali: "O Zachariah," (it was) said, "We give you good news of a son by name of John.' To none have We attributed the name before."

8.Ahmed Ali: "How can I have a son, O Lord" he said, "when my wife is barren and I am old and decrepit?"

9.Ahmed Ali: (The angel) answered: "Thus will it be. Your Lord said: 'This is easy for Me; for when I brought you into being you were nothing.

10.Ahmed Ali: He said: "O Lord, give me a token." "Though sound," He answered, "you will not talk to any one for three nights running."

11.Ahmed Ali: So he came from the chamber to his people, and suggested to them (by signs) to sing the praises of the Lord morning and evening

12.Ahmed Ali: (We said:) "O John, hold fast to the Book;" and We gave him wisdom right from boyhood

13.Ahmed Ali: And compassion from Us, and goodness. So he was devout

14.Ahmed Ali: And kind to his parents, neither arrogant nor disobedient

15.Ahmed Ali: So peace on him the day he was born, the day he will die, and the day that he will be raised from the dead

16.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate Mary in the Book. When she withdrew from her family to a place in the Eas

17.Ahmed Ali: And took cover from them, We sent a spirit of Ours to her who appeared before her in the concrete form of a man

18.Ahmed Ali: "I seek refuge in the Merciful from you, if you fear Him," she said

19.Ahmed Ali: He replied: "I am only a messenger from your Lord (sent) to bestow a good son on you."

20.Ahmed Ali: "How can I have a son," she said, "when no man has touched me, nor am I sinful?"

21.Ahmed Ali: He said: "Thus will it be. Your Lord said: 'It is easy for Me,' and that: 'We shall make him a sign for men and a blessing from Us.' This is a thing already decreed."

22.Ahmed Ali: When she conceived him she went away to a distant place

23.Ahmed Ali: The birth pangs led her to the trunk of a date-palm tree. "Would that I had died before this," she said, "and become a thing forgotten, unremembered."

24.Ahmed Ali: Then (a voice) called to her from below: "Grieve not; your Lord has made a rivulet gush forth right below you

25.Ahmed Ali: Shake the trunk of the date-palm tree, and it will drop ripe dates for you

26.Ahmed Ali: Eat and drink, and be at peace. If you see any man, tell him: 'I have verily vowed a fast to Ar-Rahman and cannot speak to any one this day.

27.Ahmed Ali: Then she brought the child to her people. They exclaimed: "O Mary, you have done a most astonishing thing

28.Ahmed Ali: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a wicked person, nor your mother sinful!"

29.Ahmed Ali: But she pointed towards him. "How can we talk to one," they said, "who is only an infant in the cradle?"

30.Ahmed Ali: "I am a servant of God," he answered. "He has given me a Book and made me a prophet

31.Ahmed Ali: And blessed me wherever I may be, and enjoined on me worship and zakat for as long as I live

32.Ahmed Ali: And be dutiful to my mother. He has not made me haughty or rebellious

33.Ahmed Ali: There was peace on me the day I was born, and will be the day I die, and on the day I will be raised from the dead."

34.Ahmed Ali: This was Jesus, son of Mary: A true account they contend about

35.Ahmed Ali: It does not behove God to have a son. Too immaculate is He! When He decrees a thing He has only to say: "Be", and it is

36.Ahmed Ali: (Jesus only said:) "Surely God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is the straight path."

37.Ahmed Ali: Yet the sectarians differed among themselves. Alas for the unbelievers when they see the Terrible Day

38.Ahmed Ali: How keenly would they hear and see when they come before Us then, even though today the evil-doers are lost in palpable error

39.Ahmed Ali: Warn them of that day of pining when all matters will have been settled, though they would still be unaware and unbelieving (of the truth)

40.Ahmed Ali: Verily We shall inherit the earth and whosoever is on it, and to Us they will return

41.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate Abraham in the Book: He was upright, a prophet

42.Ahmed Ali: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least

43.Ahmed Ali: O my father, to me has come such knowledge as never came to you. So follow me that I may show you the right path

44.Ahmed Ali: Why do you worship Satan, O father? Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman

45.Ahmed Ali: O my father, I fear lest a punishment from Ar-Rahman should befall you, and you should become a friend of the Devil."

46.Ahmed Ali: He said: "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall have you stoned to death. So go away for a while from me."

47.Ahmed Ali: He answered: "Peace be on you. I will seek forgiveness of my Lord for you. He has been gracious to me

48.Ahmed Ali: I will leave you and those you invoke apart from God, and pray to my Lord. Haply in praying to my Lord I will not be deprived."

49.Ahmed Ali: Thus, when he left them and the (idols) they worshipped, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet

50.Ahmed Ali: And bestowed on them some of Our blessings, and gave them high renown

51.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate Moses in the Book. He was a chosen one, both an apostle and a prophet

52.Ahmed Ali: We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him close for communion

53.Ahmed Ali: And bestowed on him his brother Aaron, a prophet, through Our benevolence

54.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate Ishmael in the Book. He was true of his promise, and a messenger, a prophet

55.Ahmed Ali: He enjoined on his household worship and zakat, and he was obedient to his Lord

56.Ahmed Ali: Commemorate Enoch in the Book. He was a truthful person and a prophet

57.Ahmed Ali: And We raised him to an exalted station

58.Ahmed Ali: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them

59.Ahmed Ali: But they are succeeded by a generation who neglect their devotional obligations and follow only earthly pleasures; but they will reach the wrong road and meet destruction

60.Ahmed Ali: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right. These will enter Paradise and will not be wronged the leas

61.Ahmed Ali: In the gardens of Eden promised by Ar-Rahman to His creatures in the unknown (future). Verily His promise will come to pass

62.Ahmed Ali: They will hear no vain talk there, but only salutations of peace, and they will have their sustenance morning and evening."

63.Ahmed Ali: This is the Paradise those of Our creatures will inherit who take heed and fear the displeasure of God

64.Ahmed Ali: "We do not come down," (will the angels say) "but only by your Lord's command." To Him belongs whatever lies before us and behind us, and the space in between. Your Lord does not ever forget

65.Ahmed Ali: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. Therefore worship Him, and be constant in His worship. Do you know any namesake of His

66.Ahmed Ali: Yet man says: "When I am dead, will I come to life again?"

67.Ahmed Ali: Does man not remember that before We created him he was nothing

68.Ahmed Ali: By your Lord, We shall gather them and the devils together, then bring them crawling on their knees around Hell

69.Ahmed Ali: We shall pull out of every section those who were most perversely rebellious against Ar-Rahman

70.Ahmed Ali: We know best who deserve to be burnt in (the Fire)

71.Ahmed Ali: There is not one among you who will not reach it. Your Lord has made this incumbent on Himself

72.Ahmed Ali: We shall deliver those who took heed for themselves, and leave the evil-doers kneeling there

73.Ahmed Ali: When Our lucid revelations are read out to them, the infidels say to those who believe: "Which of the two groups is better in standing, and whose company is more excellent?"

74.Ahmed Ali: How many generations that had far more wealth and ostentation have We laid low before them

75.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Ar-Rahman extends the life of those who are astray until they come to realise what had been promised them was either (physical) affliction or (the terror) of Resurrection. Then will they know who is worse in position, and who is weak in supporters

76.Ahmed Ali: God gives greater guidance to those who are guided; and good deeds that endure are better with your Lord for reward, and better for consequence

77.Ahmed Ali: Have you seen him who denies Our revelations, and says: "I will certainly be given wealth and children."

78.Ahmed Ali: Has he peeped into the Unknown, or obtained a promise from Ar-Rahman

79.Ahmed Ali: Never so. We shall certainly write down what he says, and prolong the extent of his punishment

80.Ahmed Ali: All that he claims will revert to Us, and he will come before Us all alone

81.Ahmed Ali: They have taken other gods apart from God that they might be a strength to them

82.Ahmed Ali: Never. They will deny their devotion and become their adversaries

83.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see that We have set the devils against the infidels to rouse and instigate them

84.Ahmed Ali: So, do not be hasty with them. We are counting their number (of days)

85.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall usher the righteous before Ar-Rahman like envoys into the presence of a king

86.Ahmed Ali: And drive the wicked into Hell like cattle driven to water

87.Ahmed Ali: None will have power to intercede for them except one who obtains a promise from Ar-Rahman

88.Ahmed Ali: They say: "God has begotten a son."

89.Ahmed Ali: You have uttered a grievous thin

90.Ahmed Ali: Which would cleave the skies asunder, rend the earth, and split the mountains

91.Ahmed Ali: For they have attributed a son to Ar-Rahman

92.Ahmed Ali: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son

93.Ahmed Ali: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but comes before Ar-Rahman in all obedience

94.Ahmed Ali: He has counted them and calculated their number

95.Ahmed Ali: Every one of them will come before Him all alone on the Day of Resurrection

96.Ahmed Ali: Surely Ar-Rahman will show love for those who believe and do the right

97.Ahmed Ali: So We have made this (Qur'an) easy in your tongue that you may give good news to those who take heed, and warn the people who are contentious

98.Ahmed Ali: How many generations have We laid low before them. Do you see any sign of them, or hear the least whisper of them

1.Ahmed Ali: TA HA

2.Ahmed Ali: We have not sent down the Qur'an to you that you should be burdened

3.Ahmed Ali: But as admonition for him who fears -

4.Ahmed Ali: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high ascending skies

5.Ahmed Ali: The ever-merciful, established on the throne (of authority)

6.Ahmed Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth and in between them, belongs to Him, as whatever lies under the earth

7.Ahmed Ali: Whether you say a thing aloud or inaudibly, He has knowledge of the secret and the hidden

8.Ahmed Ali: God: There is no god but He. To Him belong the attributes most beautiful

9.Ahmed Ali: Has the story of Moses come to you

10.Ahmed Ali: When he saw a fire he said to his family: "You wait here. I have seen a fire. I may haply be able to bring an ember from it, or find direction by the fire."

11.Ahmed Ali: When he approached it, a voice called out

12.Ahmed Ali: "O Moses, I am verily your Lord, so take off your shoes, for you are in the holy plain of Towa

13.Ahmed Ali: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed to you

14.Ahmed Ali: I am God, and there is no god but I, so serve Me, and observe acts of prayer to remember Me

15.Ahmed Ali: Verily the Hour (of the great change) is about to come. I keep it secret that every soul may be rewarded for its endeavour

16.Ahmed Ali: So do not let those who do not believe in it and follow their vain desires, turn you away from it

17.Ahmed Ali: What is that in your right band, O Moses?"

18.Ahmed Ali: "It's my staff," he answered; "I lean on it, and fell leaves for my goats with it, and I have other uses for it."

19.Ahmed Ali: "Throw it down, O Moses," said (the Voice)

20.Ahmed Ali: So he threw it down, and lo, it became a running serpent

21.Ahmed Ali: "Catch it," said He, "and have no fear; We shall revert it to its former state

22.Ahmed Ali: And face what is to come with patience, your hand will not be tarnished with blame: Another sig

23.Ahmed Ali: That We may go on showing you Our greater signs

24.Ahmed Ali: Go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious."

25.Ahmed Ali: Moses said: "O my Lord, enlarge my breast

26.Ahmed Ali: And make my mission easy

27.Ahmed Ali: Remove the defect of my tongu

28.Ahmed Ali: That they may understand my speech

29.Ahmed Ali: And give me as assistant from my famil

30.Ahmed Ali: Aaron my brothe

31.Ahmed Ali: To strengthen m

32.Ahmed Ali: And share my task

33.Ahmed Ali: That we may sing Your praises much

34.Ahmed Ali: And remember you a great deal

35.Ahmed Ali: Surely You know us well."

36.Ahmed Ali: He answered: "Granted is your prayer, O Moses

37.Ahmed Ali: We have bestowed Our favour on you before thi

38.Ahmed Ali: When We told your mother what We relate

39.Ahmed Ali: 'Put him in a wooden box and cast it in the river. The river will cast it on the bank. An enemy of Ours, and his, will retrieve it.' We bestowed Our love on you that you may be reared under Our eyes

40.Ahmed Ali: Then your sister followed you, and said (to the people who had retrieved the child): 'Should I guide you to a person who can nurse him?' We thus brought you back to your mother that her heart may be cheered, and she may not grieve. (Remember) when you killed a man We saved you from anguish; and tested and steeled you (in other ways). Afterwards you sojourned for several years with the people of Midian; then you came up to the measure

41.Ahmed Ali: And I chose you for Myself

42.Ahmed Ali: Go with My signs, you and your brother, and do not be lax in remembering Me

43.Ahmed Ali: Then go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious

44.Ahmed Ali: Speak to him gently. He may possibly take heed or may come to have fear."

45.Ahmed Ali: They said: "O our Lord, we are really frightened lest he behave insolently with us or become violent."

46.Ahmed Ali: (The Lord) said: "Be not afraid. I am verily with you, and I hear and see

47.Ahmed Ali: So go to him and say: 'The two of us have indeed been sent by your Lord. So let the children of Israel come with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a token from your Lord. Peace on him who follows the way of guidance

48.Ahmed Ali: It has been revealed to us that punishment will befall him who denies and turns away

49.Ahmed Ali: He asked: "Who then is that Lord of yours, O Moses?"

50.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "Our Lord is He who gave everything its natural form and directed it."

51.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said: "And what about the former generations?"

52.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) replied: "Knowledge of that is with my Lord (recorded) in the Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

53.Ahmed Ali: It is He who made the earth a bed for you, and traced for you paths upon it, and sends down water from the sky, and brings out through it every kind of vegetatio

54.Ahmed Ali: To eat and feed your cattle. Surely there are signs in these for those who are wise

55.Ahmed Ali: We created you from the earth and will revert you back to it; and raise you up from it a second time

56.Ahmed Ali: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused

57.Ahmed Ali: And said: "Have you come to us, O Moses, to drive us out of our land with your witchery

58.Ahmed Ali: We shall certainly meet you with like magic. So make an appointment when we and you could meet on common ground, which neither we nor you should fail to keep."

59.Ahmed Ali: Said (Moses): "Let your meeting be on the day of the Feast, and let people assemble in broad daylight."

60.Ahmed Ali: After this the Pharaoh withdrew and settled his stratagem, then came back

61.Ahmed Ali: Moses said to them: "Woe betide you. Do not fabricate a lie against God, or He will destroy you with some affliction. For he who fabricates lies is doomed to failure."

62.Ahmed Ali: So they discussed their strategy among themselves and conferred privately

63.Ahmed Ali: (And) said: "These two are surely magicians. They want to deprive you of your land with their magic, and eradicate your distinct way (of life)

64.Ahmed Ali: So prepare your strategy and come forward. He alone shall win today who is superior."

65.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Either you cast (your spell), O Moses, or we shall cast it first."

66.Ahmed Ali: Moses said: "No. You cast it first" Then it seemed to Moses that by their magic their cords and rods were flying

67.Ahmed Ali: And Moses felt afraid within himself

68.Ahmed Ali: We said to him: "Fear not. You will certainly be victorious

69.Ahmed Ali: Throw down what is in your right hand: It will swallow up what they have conjured. For what they have fashioned is only a trick of the sorcerer; and a sorcerer does not succeed wherever he may come."

70.Ahmed Ali: The magicians, (seeing the miracle), fell down in prostration, saying: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

71.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said: "You have come to believe without my dispensation. Surely he is your chief who taught you magic. I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunks of date-palm trees. You will come to know whose punishment is harder and protracted."

72.Ahmed Ali: They replied: "We cannot choose you in the face of the clear testimony we have received, and over Him who created us. So do what you are determined to do. All that you would do will only be confined to our life on earth

73.Ahmed Ali: We have certainly come to believe in our Lord that He may forgive our trespasses and the magic you have forced us to perform, for God is nobler and abiding."

74.Ahmed Ali: Surely for him who comes before his Lord a sinner shall be Hell, where he will neither die nor live

75.Ahmed Ali: But whoever comes before Him a believer having done good deeds, will be raised to higher stations -

76.Ahmed Ali: Gardens of Eden with rippling streams, where he will live for ever. This is the recompense of those who achieve integrity

77.Ahmed Ali: We commanded Moses: "Journey by night with Our creatures, and strike a dry path for them through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, nor have dread of any thing."

78.Ahmed Ali: Then the Pharaoh followed them with his army, but the sea overpowered and engulfed them

79.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them

80.Ahmed Ali: O children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount, and sent down for you manna and quails

81.Ahmed Ali: (And said): "Eat of the good things We have given you for food, and do not exceed the bounds (of law) in this, or My wrath will surely fall upon you; and he who incurs My wrath will fall into the abyss

82.Ahmed Ali: Yet I am gracious to him who repents and believes, and does the right, and follows the straight path

83.Ahmed Ali: What made you hurry away, O Moses, from your people?"

84.Ahmed Ali: He said: "They are right behind me. I have hastened to You, O Lord, so that You may be pleased."

85.Ahmed Ali: He said: "We have put your people on trial in your absence; and Sameri has led them astray."

86.Ahmed Ali: So Moses returned to his people full of anger and regret. "O my people," he said, "did not your Lord make you a better promise? Did the time of covenant seem too long to you? Or did you wish the wrath of your Lord to fall upon you that you broke the promise you had made to me?"

87.Ahmed Ali: They said: "We did not break our promise to you of our own will, but we were made to carry the loads of ornaments belonging to the people, which we threw (into the fire), and so did Sameri

88.Ahmed Ali: Then he produced the image of a calf which mooed like a cow. And they said: 'This is your god and the god of Moses (whom) he has neglected."

89.Ahmed Ali: Did they not see that it did not give them any answer, nor had it power to do them harm or bring them gain

90.Ahmed Ali: Aaron had indeed told them earlier: "O my people, you are being only misled with this. Surely your Lord is Ar-Rahman. So follow me and obey my command."

91.Ahmed Ali: They said "So long as Moses does not come back we are not going to give it up, and we will remain devoted to it."

92.Ahmed Ali: But (Moses) said: "O Aaron, when you saw that they had gone astray, what hindered yo

93.Ahmed Ali: From coming after me? Did you not disobey my command?" (And Moses pulled him by the hair)

94.Ahmed Ali: "O son of my mother," (Aaron cried), do not pull me by my beard or my hair! I was really afraid you may say that I had created a rift among the children of Israel, and did not pay heed to your command."

95.Ahmed Ali: Moses asked: "O Sameri, what was the matter?"

96.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I saw what they did not see. I picked up a handful of dust from the messenger's tracks and threw it in, for the idea seemed attractive to me."

97.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "Go hence! All your life you are (cursed) to say: 'Do not touch me; and a threat hangs over you which you will not be able to escape. Look at your god to whom you are so attached: We shall verily burn it, and disperse its ashes into the sea

98.Ahmed Ali: Your god is only God. There is no other god but He. His knowledge extends over everything."

99.Ahmed Ali: Thus do We narrate some account to you of what has gone before, and We have truly given you a Reminder of Our own

100.Ahmed Ali: Whoever turns away from it will surely carry a burden on the Day of Judgement

101.Ahmed Ali: And will live for ever under it. How evil the burden they will carry on the Day of Doom

102.Ahmed Ali: The day the trumpet blast is sounded We shall raise the sinners blind

103.Ahmed Ali: Whispering to one another: "You have tarried but ten days."

104.Ahmed Ali: We know well what they will say when the most upright among them will say: "You did not tarry more than a day."

105.Ahmed Ali: They will ask you about the mountains. Tell them: "My Lord will uproot them from the base

106.Ahmed Ali: And turn them into a level plain

107.Ahmed Ali: Over which you will see no curves or elevations

108.Ahmed Ali: That day they will follow the summoner from whom there will be no receding; and their voices will be hushed before Ar-Rahman, and you will not hear a sound but faint shuffling

109.Ahmed Ali: On that day no intercession will matter other than his whom Ar-Rahman grants permission and accepts

110.Ahmed Ali: He knows what is before them and hidden from them, but they cannot grasp it with their knowledge

111.Ahmed Ali: All heads will be bowed before the Living, the Eternal; and whosoever bears a load of iniquity will be full of despair

112.Ahmed Ali: But he who has done good things and believes, will have no fear of either being wronged or deprived

113.Ahmed Ali: That is why We have sent it down as an eloquent Qur'an, and explained in different ways the intimidations through it that they may haply take heed, or perhaps it may lead them to contemplate

114.Ahmed Ali: Exalted then be God, the real King; and do not try to anticipate the Qur'an before the completion of its revelation, but pray: "O Lord, give me greater knowledge."

115.Ahmed Ali: We had commanded Adam before, but he disregarded it: We found him lacking in resolution

116.Ahmed Ali: When We said to the angels: ''Bow before Adam,'' they all bowed but Iblis, who refused

117.Ahmed Ali: So We said; "O Adam, he is truly your enemy and your wife's. Do not let him have you turned out of Paradise and come to grief

118.Ahmed Ali: Verily you will have no hunger or nakedness there

119.Ahmed Ali: Nor thirst nor exposure to the sun."

120.Ahmed Ali: But then Satan tempted him by saying: "O Adam, should I show you the tree of immortality, and a kingdom that will never know any wane?"

121.Ahmed Ali: And both ate of (its fruit), and their hidden parts were exposed to one another, and they patched the leaves of the garden (to hide them). Adam disobeyed his Lord, and went astray

122.Ahmed Ali: Then his Lord chose him and relented towards him, and showed him the way

123.Ahmed Ali: (And) said: "Go down hence together, one the enemy of the other. Then will guidance come to you from Me; and whoever follows My direction will neither be disgraced nor be miserable

124.Ahmed Ali: But he who fails to heed My warning will have his means restricted; and on the Day of Resurrection We shall raise him blind."

125.Ahmed Ali: He will ask: "O Lord, why have you raised me blind when I was able to see?"

126.Ahmed Ali: (God) will say: "Because Our signs came to you, but you disregarded them. So shall We disregard you this day."

127.Ahmed Ali: And that is how We requite him who is extravagant and does not believe the signs of his Lord; and surely the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and persistent

128.Ahmed Ali: Did they not learn from the many generations that We destroyed before them, whose habitations they now frequent? Verily there are signs in this for men of understanding

129.Ahmed Ali: If the decree (of respite) had not been pronounced by your Lord, (the inevitable judgement would have ensued); but a term is fixed (for everything)

130.Ahmed Ali: So you bear with patience what they say, and sing the praises of your Lord before the rising and setting of the sun, and honour Him in the watches of the night, and then at the two ends of day, that you may find acceptance

131.Ahmed Ali: Do not covet what We have granted myriads of people of the pomp and glitter of this world to tempt them. The means your Lord has given you are better far and more enduring

132.Ahmed Ali: Enjoin on your people service to God, and be yourself constant in it. We do not ask you to provide: It is We who provide for you. The reward is for piety and fear of God

133.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "Why does he not bring a sign from his Lord?" Have not clear proofs come to them in what is contained in the earlier Books

134.Ahmed Ali: If We had destroyed them by some calamity sooner than this, they would have surely said: "O Lord, if You had sent to us a messenger we would have followed Your command before being humbled and disgraced."

135.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Each one awaits the consequence; so you wait. You will come to know soon who are the men of the straight path and who have come to guidance

1.Ahmed Ali: NEAR HAS COME the reckoning for men, but they turn away in remissness

2.Ahmed Ali: Never does a new reminder come to them from their Lord but they listen to it with dalliance

3.Ahmed Ali: Their minds are lost in frivolous pastimes; and the evil-doers discuss secretly: "Is he not but only a man like you? Then why are you taken in by magic seeingly?"

4.Ahmed Ali: He said: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in the heavens and the earth. He hears all and knows everything."

5.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "These are only confused dreams," or rather: "He has invented them;" or: "He is only a poet. Let him therefore bring a miracle to us as the earlier (apostles) were sent with."

6.Ahmed Ali: Not one habitation that We destroyed before them had believed. So how can they believe

7.Ahmed Ali: Never did We send a message before you but through a man, whom We inspired. If you do not know, then ask the keepers of the oracles of God

8.Ahmed Ali: We did not make their bodies immune to hunger, nor were they immortal

9.Ahmed Ali: Then We made Our promise good to them and delivered whomsoever We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors

10.Ahmed Ali: We have sent down to you a Book which has a reminder for you. Do you not understand

11.Ahmed Ali: How many habitations that were sinful have We demolished utterly, and raised other people after them

12.Ahmed Ali: Whensoever they sensed Our punishment they fled from them

13.Ahmed Ali: "Do not flee; go back to your halls of pleasure and your habitations, so that you may be interrogated."

14.Ahmed Ali: "Woe, alas," they said, "we were really sinful."

15.Ahmed Ali: And this remained their lament till We mowed them down and made them extinct

16.Ahmed Ali: We have not created the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, out of fun

17.Ahmed Ali: If We had pleased to make a plaything We could have made it Ourself, if We had cared to do so

18.Ahmed Ali: In fact We strike the truth against the false, which shatters it, and it disappears. Woe to you for what you attribute (to Him)

19.Ahmed Ali: Whosoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him; and those who are near Him do not disdain to worship Him or weary (of His service)

20.Ahmed Ali: Nor cease to endeavour praising Him night and day

21.Ahmed Ali: Or have they taken gods from the earth who can raise the dead

22.Ahmed Ali: Had there been gods apart from God, both (the heavens and the earth) would have been despoiled. Much too glorious is God, the Lord of the mighty throne, for things they assert

23.Ahmed Ali: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned

24.Ahmed Ali: Have they taken gods besides God? Say: "Then bring your proof. Here is the Book of those who are with me, and the Book of those who have gone before me." But most men do not know the truth and turn away

25.Ahmed Ali: We have not sent an apostle before you without instructing him that there is no god but I, so worship Me

26.Ahmed Ali: And yet they say: "Ar-Rahman has begotten a son." Too exalted is He! In fact, those (they call His sons) were His honoured votaries

27.Ahmed Ali: They did not precede Him in their speech, and acted on His command

28.Ahmed Ali: He knows what was there before them and what came after them; and they did not intercede for any one but whom He willed, and they were filled with awe of Him

29.Ahmed Ali: If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him," We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers

30.Ahmed Ali: Do not these unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were an integrated mass, then We split them and made every living thing from water? Will they not believe even then

31.Ahmed Ali: We placed stabilisers in the earth so that as it revolved with them you lived undisturbed; and We provided passageways between them so that men may find their way

32.Ahmed Ali: And We made the sky a well-protected roof. Still they turn away from His signs

33.Ahmed Ali: It is He who created night and day, the sun and the moon, revolving on its orbit

34.Ahmed Ali: We have given no man everlastingness before you. So then if you die, will they live ever after

35.Ahmed Ali: Every soul will know the taste of death. We tempt you with evil and with good as a trial; and to Us you will return

36.Ahmed Ali: But when the unbelievers see you they make fun of you (and say): "Is this the one who mentions your gods (deridingly)?" Yet in Ar-Rahman they disbelieve

37.Ahmed Ali: Man is made of inordinate haste. We will show you Our signs, then you will not desire to hasten (the punishment)

38.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "When will the promised threat come to pass, if you speak the truth?"

39.Ahmed Ali: If only the unbelievers could apprehend the moment when they would neither be able to ward off the fire from their faces and their backs, nor help reach them

40.Ahmed Ali: It will come upon them unawares confounding them, and they will not be able to keep it back, nor will they be given respite

41.Ahmed Ali: Many apostles have been scoffed before you; but they who scoffed were themselves caught by what they had ridiculed

42.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Who guards you from Ar-Rahman by night and by day?" Yet from a mention of their Lord they turn away

43.Ahmed Ali: Or do they have lords of their own besides Us who can defend them? But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us

44.Ahmed Ali: We allowed them and their fathers time to enjoy till the very end of their lives. Do they not see Us advancing into the land, reducing its frontiers? Would they still prevail

45.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am warning you by God's command." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned

46.Ahmed Ali: Even if a whiff of the Lord's chastisement were to touch them they would surely say: "Ah woe, alas, we were surely sinful."

47.Ahmed Ali: We shall fix the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection, so that none will be wronged in the least; and even if it were equal to a mustard seed in weight We shall take it (into account). We are sufficient for computation

48.Ahmed Ali: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and a light and reminder for those who take heed for themselves

49.Ahmed Ali: Who are fearful of their Lord inwardly and dread the Hour

50.Ahmed Ali: And this is a blessed reminder that We have sent down. Will you then deny it

51.Ahmed Ali: We had earlier given Abraham true direction, for We knew him well

52.Ahmed Ali: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these idols to which you cling so passionately?"

53.Ahmed Ali: They replied: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

54.Ahmed Ali: He said: "You and your fathers were in clear error."

55.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Are you speaking in earnest, or only jesting?"

56.Ahmed Ali: He said: "In fact it was your Lord, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them; and I bear witness to this

57.Ahmed Ali: I swear by God I will do something to your idols when you have turned your backs and gone."

58.Ahmed Ali: So he smashed them up to pieces with the exception of the biggest, so that they may turn to it

59.Ahmed Ali: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."

60.Ahmed Ali: They said: "We heard a youth talk about them. He is called Abraham."

61.Ahmed Ali: "Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."

62.Ahmed Ali: "Did you do this to our gods, O Abraham?" they enquired

63.Ahmed Ali: "No," he said. "It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."

64.Ahmed Ali: Then they thought and observed: "Surely you are yourselves unjust."

65.Ahmed Ali: Then crestfallen (they confessed): "Truly, as you know, they cannot speak."

66.Ahmed Ali: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm

67.Ahmed Ali: Fie on you and those you worship besides God! Will you not understand?"

68.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Burn him, and save your gods, if you are men of action."

69.Ahmed Ali: "Turn cold, O fire," We said, "and give safety to Abraham."

70.Ahmed Ali: They wished to entrap him, but We made them greater losers

71.Ahmed Ali: So We delivered him and Lot, and brought them to the land We had blessed for all the people

72.Ahmed Ali: And We bestowed on him Isaac, and Jacob as an additional gift, and made them righteous

73.Ahmed Ali: And We made them leaders to guide (the people) by Our command; and We inspired them to perform good deeds and observe their moral obligations and pay the zakat; and they obeyed Us

74.Ahmed Ali: To Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and saved him from a people who acted villainously and were certainly wicked and disobedient

75.Ahmed Ali: Thus We admitted him to Our grace. He is surely one of the righteous

76.Ahmed Ali: Remember Noah when he called to Us before this. We heard him and saved him and those with him from great distress

77.Ahmed Ali: And We helped him against the people who rejected Our signs as lies. They were a wicked people indeed, so We drowned them one and all

78.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) David and Solomon, when they pronounced judgement about the field which was eaten up at night by sheep belonging to certain people. We were witness to their judgement

79.Ahmed Ali: We made Solomon understand the case, and bestowed on each wisdom and knowledge, We subdued the al-jibal (mountains) with David to sing Our praises, and at-tair (birds). It is We who did it

80.Ahmed Ali: And We taught him the art of making coats of mail to shield you from each other's violence. Will you not be grateful even then

81.Ahmed Ali: We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon which blew swiftly to sail at his bidding (with his ships) to the land We had blessed. We are cognisant of everything

82.Ahmed Ali: And many of the devils (We also made obedient to him) who dived for him, and did many other things; and We kept watch over them

83.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) Job when he called to his Lord: "I am afflicted with distress, and You are the most compassionate of all."

84.Ahmed Ali: So We heard his cry and relieved him of the misery he was in. We restored his family to him, and along with them gave him others similar to them as a grace from Us and reminder for those who are obedient

85.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) Ishmael, Edris and Dhu'l-Kifl. They were men of fortitude

86.Ahmed Ali: And they were admitted to Our grace. Verily they were among the doers of good

87.Ahmed Ali: And (remember) Dhu'n-Noon (Jonah of the fish), when he went away in anger and imagined We will not test him (with distress). Then he called out from the darkness: "There is no god other than You. All glory to You; surely I was a sinner

88.Ahmed Ali: We heard his cry, and saved him from the anguish. That is how We deliver those who believe

89.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) Zachariah when he called to his Lord: "Do not leave me alone (and childless), for you are the best of givers."

90.Ahmed Ali: So We heard him and gave him John, and cured his wife (of barrenness). These were men who vied in good deeds with one another, and prayed to Us with love and awe, and were meek before Us

91.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) her who preserved her chastity, into whom We breathed a new life from Us, and made her and her son a token for mankind

92.Ahmed Ali: Verily this your order is one order, and I am your Lord; so worship Me

93.Ahmed Ali: But they split up the order among themselves; (yet) all of them have to come back to Me

94.Ahmed Ali: So he who does the right and is a believer, will not have his labour denied, for We are congnisant of it

95.Ahmed Ali: It is imperative that a habitation We have destroyed will not desist (from unbelief

96.Ahmed Ali: Until when the way is opened up for Gog and Magog and they press from every elevated place

97.Ahmed Ali: And the certain promise (of Doom) comes near. Then the eyes of unbelievers will be fixed in horror, (and they will cry:) "Ah, woe betide, we were indeed heedless of this, and were oppressors and unjust."

98.Ahmed Ali: Verily you and those you worship other than God will be faggots for Hell; and come to it you will

99.Ahmed Ali: Had they really been gods they would not have entered it: They will all abide in it for ever

100.Ahmed Ali: There will only be groaning for them, and they will not hear any thing

101.Ahmed Ali: But those for whom a good reward had been fore-ordained by Us, will be far removed from it

102.Ahmed Ali: And will not hear its hissing, and will live for ever in the midst of what their hearts desire

103.Ahmed Ali: They will have safety from the mighty terror, and angels will receive them, (saying:) "This is your day which had been promised you."

104.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall roll up the heavens like a written scroll, We shall revert it (to nothing) as it was before We first created it. This is a promise incumbent on Us; We will certainly fulfil it

105.Ahmed Ali: We had prescribed in the Book of Psalms after the reminder and admonition, that those of Our creatures who are good will in the end rule the earth

106.Ahmed Ali: Verily there is a message in this for people who are devout

107.Ahmed Ali: We have sent you as a benevolence to the creatures of the world

108.Ahmed Ali: Say: "This is what has been revealed to me: 'Your God is one and only God.' So will you bow in homage to Him?"

109.Ahmed Ali: If they turn away, tell them: "I have warned you all alike. I do not know if what has been promised you is near or far away

110.Ahmed Ali: He knows surely what you say aloud, and what you hide within your breasts

111.Ahmed Ali: I do not know if this be a trial for you, or a little advantage for a while."

112.Ahmed Ali: "Judge in truth (between us), O Lord," he said. "Our Lord is merciful, whose help we seek against what you attribute."

1.Ahmed Ali: O YOU PEOPLE, fear your Lord. The great upheaval of the Hour will indeed be terrible

2.Ahmed Ali: The day you see it every suckling female will forget her suckling, and every pregnant female will discharge her burden. You will see men drunk, yet it will not be intoxication. The torment of God will be severe

3.Ahmed Ali: And yet there are men who contend about God without understanding, and follow every wayward devi

4.Ahmed Ali: Who, it is inscribed, will beguile whoever follows him, and lead him to the torment of Hell

5.Ahmed Ali: If you have any doubt, O men, about being raised to life again, (remember) that We created you from dust, then a drop of semen, then an embryo, then a chewed up lump of flesh shaped and shapeless, that We may reveal (the various steps) to you. We keep what We please in the womb for a certain time, then you come out as a child, then reach the prime of age. Some of you die, some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they knew, having known it once. You see the earth all withered, then We send down rain upon it, and it bestirs itself, swells, and brings forth every kind of beauteous verdure

6.Ahmed Ali: That is so for God is the undeniable Reality. It is He who brings the dead to life, for He has power over everything

7.Ahmed Ali: The Hour will come without a doubt, and God will raise those who are dead

8.Ahmed Ali: Yet there are some who contend about God without any knowledge or guidance or enlightening Book

9.Ahmed Ali: Turning their backs that they may lead away from the path of God. For such there is disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement We shall make them taste the torment of burning

10.Ahmed Ali: That is on account of what you had done in the past; yet God is not unjust to His creatures

11.Ahmed Ali: There are some men who worship God only from the margin. If there is some profit they are content; but if calamity befalls them they turn about, thus losing both this world and the next. This is indeed a palpable loss

12.Ahmed Ali: Leaving God they pray to those who cannot harm or profit them. That is the limit of going astray

13.Ahmed Ali: They pray to him whose bane is more imminent than his boon: How bad the protector and how bad the associate

14.Ahmed Ali: God will admit those who believe and do the right to gardens full of rippling streams. Verily God does as He pleases

15.Ahmed Ali: He who thinks that God will not help him in this world and the next should stretch a rope to the sky then cut it off and see if his mind is relieved (of doubts) by this stratagem

16.Ahmed Ali: That is why We have sent down these clear revelations, for God gives guidance whomsoever He please

17.Ahmed Ali: God will judge between those who believe and the Jews, the Sabians, Christians and the Magians and the idolaters, on the Day of Judgement. Verily God is witness to everything

18.Ahmed Ali: Do you see how all things in heavens and the earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, trees and beasts, and men in abundance, pay homage to God? Yet there are many who deserve the punishment. And whosoever God disgraces will have none to raise him up in honour. God does verily as He will

19.Ahmed Ali: These two (believers and unbelievers) are disputants, who contend about their Lord. But they who disbelieve will be fitted out with garments of flames. Boiling water will be poured down over their head

20.Ahmed Ali: Which will dissolve everything within their bellies, and their skins

21.Ahmed Ali: There are iron maces for them

22.Ahmed Ali: As often as they try to escape from its anguish they would be put back into (the fire), and taste the torment of burning

23.Ahmed Ali: God will surely admit those who believe and do the right to gardens with rivers running by, where they will be decked in bracelets of gold and of pearls; and of silk will be their garments

24.Ahmed Ali: They will be guided with gentle words, and guided to the commended path

25.Ahmed Ali: As for those who disbelieve, and obstruct the way of God and the holy Mosque which We have set down for all men, the native and the visitor alike. Whoever puts obstructions in this mischievously will taste of painful punishment

26.Ahmed Ali: When We chose the site of the House for Abraham (We said:) "Associate no one with Me, and clean My House for those who will circumambulate it, stand (in reverence), and bow in homage

27.Ahmed Ali: Announce the Pilgrimage to the people. They will come to you on foot and riding along distant roads on lean and slender beasts

28.Ahmed Ali: In order to reach the place of advantage for them, and to pronounce the name of God on appointed days over cattle He has given them for food; then eat of the meat and feed the needy and the poor

29.Ahmed Ali: Let them then attend to their persons and complete the rites of pilgrimage, fulfil their vows and circuit round the ancient House

30.Ahmed Ali: Apart from this, whoever respects the sacred ordinances of God, will find a better reward for him with his Lord. You are allowed to eat all cattle except those already mentioned to you. Avoid the repugnance of idols, and false and frivolous talk

31.Ahmed Ali: Turn uprightly to God without ascribing compeers to Him; for he who associates any one with God is like a thing that falls from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or carried far away by the wind

32.Ahmed Ali: All this, and honouring the offerings to God, comes from purity of heart

33.Ahmed Ali: , There are advantages for you in these (cattle) up to a time, then their place is the ancient House for sacrifice

34.Ahmed Ali: For every community We have ordained certain rites that they may commemorate the name of God by reading it over the cattle We have given them for sacrifice. Your God is one God, so be obedient to Him. Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God

35.Ahmed Ali: Whose hearts are filled with awe when the name of God is mentioned before them, who endure with fortitude what befalls them, and fulfil their moral obligations, and expend of what We have given them

36.Ahmed Ali: We have made the camels signs of God for you. There is good for you in this. So pronounce the name of God over them as they stand with their forefeet in a line. When they have fallen (slaughtered) on their sides, eat of (their meat) and feed those who are content with little, and those who supplicate. That is why We have brought them under your subjugation so that you may be grateful

37.Ahmed Ali: It is not their meat or blood that reaches God: It is the fealty of your heart that reaches him. That is why He has subjugated them to you that you may glorify God for having shown you the way. So give glad tidings to those who are doers of good

38.Ahmed Ali: God will certainly defend the believers. Surely God does not like the traitors who deny the truth

39.Ahmed Ali: Permission is granted those (to take up arms) who fight because they were oppressed. God is certainly able to give help to thos

40.Ahmed Ali: Who were driven away from their homes for no other reason than they said: "Our Lord is God." And if God had not restrained some men through some others, monastries, churches, synagogues and mosques, where the name of God is honoured most, would have been razed. God will surely help those who help Him, -- verily God is all-powerful and all-mighty, -

41.Ahmed Ali: Those who would be firm in devotion, give zakat, and enjoin what is good and forbid what is wrong, if We gave them authority in the land. But the resultance of things rests with God

42.Ahmed Ali: If they accuse you of falsehood, (remember that) the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud had accused (their apostles) before

43.Ahmed Ali: And the people of Abraham and Lot

44.Ahmed Ali: And the people of Midian too. Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them. How was My reprobation then

45.Ahmed Ali: How many a habitation given to wickedness have We destroyed, whose roofs tumbled down, which fell into ruins. How many a well and fortress reinforced lie abandoned

46.Ahmed Ali: Have they not travelled in the land that they could have the heart to understand, and ears to hear? It is not the eyes alone that do not see, oblivious are the hearts within their breasts

47.Ahmed Ali: That is how they ask you to hasten the punishment; but God does not go back on His promise. Verily a day with your Lord is equal by your reckoning to a thousand years

48.Ahmed Ali: To how many habitations did We give respite, though given to wickedness, and then seized them. To Me they had to come back in the end

49.Ahmed Ali: Tell them: "O men, it's my duty to warn you clearly."

50.Ahmed Ali: For those who believe and do the right is forgiveness and gracious provision

51.Ahmed Ali: But those who try to defeat Our signs are people of Hell

52.Ahmed Ali: We have sent no messenger or apostle before you with whose recitations Satan did not tamper. Yet God abrogates what Satan interpolates; then He confirms His revelations, for God is all-knowing and all-wise

53.Ahmed Ali: This is in order to make the interpolations of Satan a test for those whose hearts are diseased and hardened: Surely the sinners have gone far in dissent

54.Ahmed Ali: At the same time those who have been given knowledge may know that this is the truth from your Lord, and come to believe in it, and their hearts become submissive to Him. Verily God guides those who believe, to the even path

55.Ahmed Ali: The infidels will remain in doubt about it till the Hour overtakes them unawares, or the punishment of the barren day destructive should come upon them

56.Ahmed Ali: The order will be God's on that Day; He will judge between them. Then those who had come to believe and done the right will be in gardens of delight

57.Ahmed Ali: But those who did not believe and called Our revelations lies, will be given disgraceful punishment

58.Ahmed Ali: Those who left their homes in the way of God, and then were killed or died, will surely be given a better provision by God, for God is surely the best of providers

59.Ahmed Ali: God will surely lead them to a place with which they will be gratified. Verily God is all-knowing and forbearing

60.Ahmed Ali: Whosoever retaliates to the extent of injury suffered by him, and is wronged again, will certainly be helped by God. Verily God is forgiving and kind

61.Ahmed Ali: That is so for God turns night into day and day into night, for God is all-hearing and all-seeing

62.Ahmed Ali: That is so for God is the undeniable truth, and what they invoke apart from Him is false; yet God is all-high and supreme

63.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see how God sends down water from the sky and in the morning the earth turns green? Truly God is benign and well-informed

64.Ahmed Ali: Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. Surely God is all-sufficing, worthy of praise

65.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see God has harnessed all that is in the earth, to your service? And the boats ply in the ocean by His command. He holds the sky in position lest it should fall upon the earth save by His dispensation. Verily God is compassionate and kind to men

66.Ahmed Ali: It is He who gives you life, then makes you die; then He will bring you back to life again. Man is surely most ungrateful

67.Ahmed Ali: We have determined for each community a way of worship which they follow. So they should not contend with you in this matter; and you should go on calling them to your Lord. You are surely on the right path

68.Ahmed Ali: If they argue with you, tell them: "God knows well what you are doing

69.Ahmed Ali: God will judge between you on the Day of Judgement in what you are at variance."

70.Ahmed Ali: Do you not know that God knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? This is surely in accordance with the law. This is certainly how (the law of) God works inevitably
