71.Ahmed Ali: Yet they worship in place of God that for which no authority has been sent to them, and of which they have no knowledge. The wicked will have none to help them

72.Ahmed Ali: When Our clear messages are read out to them you can see denial on the faces of unbelievers. They can hardly restrain themselves from attacking those who recite Our revelations. Tell them: "Should I give you news of something worse than this?" -- Hell, which God has promised the infidels. How evil a destination

73.Ahmed Ali: O men, give ear to this parable: Those you worship other than God can never create as much as a fly, even if they get together to do so; and if the fly were to rob them of a thing they would not be able to snatch it away from it. How weak the seeker and how weak the sought

74.Ahmed Ali: They do not esteem God with the right estimation. God is surely all-powerful and all-mighty

75.Ahmed Ali: God chooses messengers from the angels and human beings. Verily God is all-hearing and all-seeing

76.Ahmed Ali: He knows what is before them and what lies behind them, and all things go back to God

77.Ahmed Ali: O you who believe, bow in adoration, Worship your Lord and do what is good that you may find success

78.Ahmed Ali: Strive in the way of God with a service worthy of Him. He has chosen you and laid no hardship on you in the way of faith, the faith of your forbear Abraham. He named you Muslim earlier, and in this (Qur'an), in order that the Prophet be witness over you, and you be witness over mankind. So be firm in devotion, pay the zakat, and hold on firmly to God. He is your friend: How excellent a friend is He, how excellent a helper

1.Ahmed Ali: THE TRUE BELIEVERS will be successful

2.Ahmed Ali: Who are humble in their service

3.Ahmed Ali: Who shun all frivolities

4.Ahmed Ali: Who strive for betterment

5.Ahmed Ali: Who guard their se

6.Ahmed Ali: Except from their wives and women slaves of old are free of blame

7.Ahmed Ali: But those who covet more than this will be transgressors

8.Ahmed Ali: And those who fulfil their trusts and keep their promises

9.Ahmed Ali: And those who are watchful of their acts of prayer

10.Ahmed Ali: These are the real gainers

11.Ahmed Ali: Who will inherit Paradise, and live in it for ever

12.Ahmed Ali: We created man from the finest extract of clay

13.Ahmed Ali: Then We placed him as a sperm in a firmly established lodging

14.Ahmed Ali: Then We fashioned the sperm into an embryo, then fashioned the embryo into a shapeless lump of flesh; then from the lump of flesh We fashioned bones, then clothed the bones with flesh. Thus We formed him into a new creation. So blessed be God the best of Creators

15.Ahmed Ali: And then you will certainly die

16.Ahmed Ali: Then will be raised up on the Day of Resurrection

17.Ahmed Ali: We made several highways one over the other above you. We are not neglectful of creation

18.Ahmed Ali: We send down water from the sky in determined measure, and store it up in the earth; and We have power to drain it away

19.Ahmed Ali: We grow orchards of dates and grapes from it for you, Which yield fruits in abundance that you eat

20.Ahmed Ali: The tree that grows on Mount Sinai yields oil and seasoning for those who eat

21.Ahmed Ali: There are lessons for you in the cattle from whose bellies We give you milk to drink, and there are other advantages that you derive from them, and some of them you eat

22.Ahmed Ali: And you are carried on them and on boats

23.Ahmed Ali: We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"

24.Ahmed Ali: The chiefs of his people, who did not believe, said: "He is only a man like you. He wishes to acquire ascendancy over you. If God had willed He would have sent down angels. We never heard this from our elders

25.Ahmed Ali: He is only a man possessed; so wait and watch him for a time."

26.Ahmed Ali: "O my Lord," prayed (Noah), "help me against them, for they accuse me of lies."

27.Ahmed Ali: So We asked him to build the ark under Our eyes and guidance, (and said): "When Our command is issued and the source of water boils over, put a pair of every species in it, and your family except those for whom Our sentence has been passed already; and do not speak to Me for those who are wicked: They will be drowned

28.Ahmed Ali: When you and those with you have boarded the ark, say: 'All praise be to God who has delivered us from the people who were sinful.

29.Ahmed Ali: And say: 'O Lord, disembark me in a welcome place; You are the best of deliverers.

30.Ahmed Ali: There were surely signs in this; We will surely put you to the test

31.Ahmed Ali: After them We raised a new generation

32.Ahmed Ali: Then We sent to them an apostle from among them (who said): "Worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed and fear God?"

33.Ahmed Ali: The chiefs of the people who did not believe and denied the life to come, though We had given them good things of this life to enjoy, (said): "He is only a mortal like you. He eats as you do, and drinks as you drink

34.Ahmed Ali: So if you follow a man like yourself you will certainly be doomed

35.Ahmed Ali: Does he give you a promise that when you are dead and turned to dust and bones, you will be raised to life again

36.Ahmed Ali: How far-fetched what you are promised

37.Ahmed Ali: There is only the life of this world: We die and we live: there is no rising from the dead for us

38.Ahmed Ali: He is just a man who invents a lie about God; we cannot believe in him."

39.Ahmed Ali: (The apostle prayed): "O Lord, deliver me, for they accuse me of lies."

40.Ahmed Ali: Answered (the Lord): "They shall wake up repenting soon."

41.Ahmed Ali: So they were rightly seized by a mighty blast; and We turned them into mouldy rubbish: A good riddance of the wicked people

42.Ahmed Ali: Then after them We raised other generations

43.Ahmed Ali: No nation can live beyond its allotted time, or lag behind

44.Ahmed Ali: Then We sent Our apostles one after the other. Every time an apostle came to a people they denied him. So We made one follow the other (to its doom), and turned them into bygone tales. Cursed be the people who do not believe

45.Ahmed Ali: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear proof

46.Ahmed Ali: To Pharaoh and his nobles who behaved with arrogance, for they were a conceited lot

47.Ahmed Ali: And said: "Should we believe in two men like yourselves, whose people are our subjects?"

48.Ahmed Ali: Then they accused them of lies, and joined the company of those who were destroyed

49.Ahmed Ali: And We gave the Book to Moses so that they may be guided

50.Ahmed Ali: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them shelter on an elevated ground, sequestered, watered by a spring

51.Ahmed Ali: O you apostles, eat things that are clean, and do things that are good. We are surely cognisant of what you do

52.Ahmed Ali: Verily this your order is one order, and I am your Lord, so fear Me

53.Ahmed Ali: But then they divided up their order into different creeds, each section rejoicing in what it had come to have

54.Ahmed Ali: So leave them to their ignorance for a time

55.Ahmed Ali: Do they think that by increasing their wealth and childre

56.Ahmed Ali: We are hastening to reward them for good deeds? No. They do not comprehend

57.Ahmed Ali: Surely those who live in awe of their Lord

58.Ahmed Ali: Who believe in their Lord's revelations

59.Ahmed Ali: Who do not associate any one with their Lord

60.Ahmed Ali: Who give whatsoever they give (in His way), and their hearts tremble with fear that they have to go back to their Lord

61.Ahmed Ali: Are the ones who hasten to goodness and outpace the others

62.Ahmed Ali: We do not burden a soul beyond capacity, for We have a record that tells the truth. No wrong will be done to any one

63.Ahmed Ali: Yet their hearts are oblivious of this; and besides, they are busy with other things

64.Ahmed Ali: So that when We seize the affluent among them with affliction, they will begin to implore for help

65.Ahmed Ali: "Do not supplicate for help today; you will not be rescued by Us

66.Ahmed Ali: For when My revelations were read out to you, you turned back on your heels and fle

67.Ahmed Ali: Insolently, treating them like tales told at night."

68.Ahmed Ali: Why did they not think over the message? Or has something come to them which had not come to their fathers

69.Ahmed Ali: Or did they not recognise their apostle, and rejected him

70.Ahmed Ali: Or do they say that he is possessed? In fact, he has brought the truth to them, but most of them abhor the truth

71.Ahmed Ali: Had truth been subject to their whims the heavens and the earth and all those within them would have been depraved. In fact We had sent them their reminder, but they turned away from good advice

72.Ahmed Ali: Or do you ask of them any tribute? In that case the tribute of your Lord is better, for He is the best of providers

73.Ahmed Ali: You are surely calling them to the right path

74.Ahmed Ali: But those who believe not in the Hereafter turn away from the straight path

75.Ahmed Ali: If We took compassion on them and removed the affliction they are in, they would only wander lost in confusion

76.Ahmed Ali: We had seized them with the punishment, but they did not bow before their Lord nor turned to Him in humility

77.Ahmed Ali: So that when at last We open up the gate of severe punishment on them they will be overwhelmed with despair

78.Ahmed Ali: It is He who gave you hearing, sight, and hearts, but only few of you give thanks

79.Ahmed Ali: It is He who multiplied you on the earth, and it will be before Him that you will be gathered

80.Ahmed Ali: It is He who gives you life and death, and His the alternation of night and day. Even then you do not understand

81.Ahmed Ali: And talk as did the people of old

82.Ahmed Ali: They say: "When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we be raised to life again

83.Ahmed Ali: We and our fathers were promised this before; it is nothing but ancient lore!"

84.Ahmed Ali: Say: "To whom does the earth and whosoever is upon it then belong, if you know?"

85.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "To God." Say: "Then why do you not bethink yourselves?"

86.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Then who is the Lord of the seven skies? And who is the Lord of the mighty Throne?"

87.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "God." Say: "Then why do you not obey and fear Him?"

88.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Whose is the sovereignty over all things, who protects, and against whom there is no protection? {Answer) if you have knowledge."

89.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "God's." Say: "Then why are you so deluded?"

90.Ahmed Ali: In fact We have sent the truth to them, but they are liars

91.Ahmed Ali: God has not begotten a son, nor is there any god besides Him. Had this been so, each god would have taken away what he had created with him, and some would have risen over the others. God is much too glorious for what they attribute (to Him)

92.Ahmed Ali: The knower of the absent and the present, too exalted is He for what they associate (with Him)

93.Ahmed Ali: Say: "O Lord, if I am made to see what has been promised them

94.Ahmed Ali: Then do not, O Lord, put me among the sinners."

95.Ahmed Ali: We have certainly the power to make you see what We have promised them

96.Ahmed Ali: Dispel evil with what is good. We know well what they attribute (to Us)

97.Ahmed Ali: Say: "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the evil promptings of the devils

98.Ahmed Ali: I seek refuge in You lest they come to me."

99.Ahmed Ali: (But the unbelievers will persist) until when death comes to one of them he will say: "O Lord, send me back agai

100.Ahmed Ali: That I may do some good I did not do (in the world)." Not so. These are only words he utters. Behind them lies the intervening barrier (stretching) to the day of their resurrection

101.Ahmed Ali: When the trumpet blast is sounded no ties of lineage will hold among them, nor will they ask after one another

102.Ahmed Ali: Only those whose scales are heavier in the balance will find happiness

103.Ahmed Ali: But those whose scales are lighter will perish and abide in Hell for ever

104.Ahmed Ali: Their faces will be scorched by flames, and they will grin and scowl within it

105.Ahmed Ali: "Were not My messages read out to you? But you denied them."

106.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "O Lord, our misery overwhelmed us, so we remained a people astray

107.Ahmed Ali: Get us out of this, O Lord. If we transgress we will surely be sinful."

108.Ahmed Ali: He will say: "Remain condemned in it, and do not speak to Me

109.Ahmed Ali: There was a section among My creatures that said: 'O Lord, we believe. Forgive us and have mercy upon us, for You are the best of the merciful.

110.Ahmed Ali: But you ridiculed them. So much so that out of (spite) for them you forgot to remember Me and laughed at them

111.Ahmed Ali: I have rewarded them this day for they were constant, and they have come to attainment."

112.Ahmed Ali: They will be asked: "How long did you live on the earth in terms of years?"

113.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "A day or less than a day. Ask the enumerators of numbers."

114.Ahmed Ali: He will say: "You stayed there only a moment, if you knew

115.Ahmed Ali: Do you think We created you for nothing, and that you will not return to Us?"

116.Ahmed Ali: Exalted then be God, the King, the Real. There is no god but He, the Lord of the glorious throne

117.Ahmed Ali: Whoever worships another god apart from God, for which he holds no proof, will have to account for it before his Lord. Verily the unbelievers will not prosper

118.Ahmed Ali: Say: "My Lord, forgive and have mercy. You are the best of the merciful."

1.Ahmed Ali: WE HAVE REVEALED this Surah and made it obligatory as We have sent down clear injunctions in it that you may be warned

2.Ahmed Ali: The adulteress and adulterer should be flogged a hundred lashes each, and no pity for them should deter you from the law of God, if you believe in God and the Last Day; and the punishment should be witnessed by a body of believers

3.Ahmed Ali: The adulterer can marry no one but an adulteress or his partner (in the act) , and the adulteress cannot marry any but an adulterer or her partner (in the act). This is forbidden the believers

4.Ahmed Ali: Those who defame chaste women and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes, and their testimony should not be accepted afterwards, for they are profligates

5.Ahmed Ali: Except those who repent after this and reform; and God is surely forgiving and kind

6.Ahmed Ali: Those who accuse their wives and do not have any witnesses except themselves, should swear four times in the name of God, the testimony of each such person being that he is speaking the truth

7.Ahmed Ali: And (swear) a fifth time that if he tell a lie the curse of God be on him

8.Ahmed Ali: The woman's punishment can be averted if she swears four times by God as testimony that her husband is a liar

9.Ahmed Ali: Her fifth oath being that the curse of God be on her if her husband should be speaking the truth

10.Ahmed Ali: (This would not have been possible) if the grace and benevolence of God were not upon you; but God is compassionate and wise

11.Ahmed Ali: Those who spread lies were a clique among you. Do not think that it was bad for you: In fact it has been good for you. Each of them will pay for the sin he has committed, and he who had greater share (of guilt) will suffer grievous punishment

12.Ahmed Ali: Why did the faithful men and women not think well of their people when they heard this, and said: "This is a clear lie?"

13.Ahmed Ali: Why did they not bring four witnesses (in support of their charge)? And since they did not bring the four witnesses they are themselves liars in the sight of God

14.Ahmed Ali: Were it not for the grace of God and His mercy upon you in this world and the next, you would have suffered a great affliction for the false accusation

15.Ahmed Ali: When you talked about it and said what you did not know, and took it lightly -- though in the sight of God it was serious -

16.Ahmed Ali: Why did you not say when you heard it: "It is not for us to speak of it? God preserve us, it is a great calumny!"

17.Ahmed Ali: God counsels you not to do a thing like this, if you are believers

18.Ahmed Ali: God explains His commands to you clearly, for God is all-knowing and all-wise

19.Ahmed Ali: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know

20.Ahmed Ali: But for the grace of God and His mercy (much harm would have been done); yet God is compassionate and kind

21.Ahmed Ali: O you who believe, do not follow in the footsteps of Satan, for he who follows in the footsteps of Satan will be induced by him to what is shameful and forbidden. But for the grace of God and His mercy upon you none of you would have escaped undefiled; but God makes whosoever He will grow in goodness, for God is all-hearing and all-knowing

22.Ahmed Ali: Let not those who are men of plenty and means among you swear that they will not give to their relatives and the poor and those who leave their homes in the service of God. They should forgive and overlook (their failings). Would you not like God to forgive you? And God is forgiving and kind

23.Ahmed Ali: Verily those who blaspheme unsuspecting chaste believing women will be cursed in this world and the next; and for them there will be severe punishment

24.Ahmed Ali: The day their tongues and hands and feet bear witness to what they had done

25.Ahmed Ali: God will pay them on that day their just due in full, and they will come to know that God is the tangible Reality

26.Ahmed Ali: Bad women deserve bad men, and bad men are for bad women; but good women are for good men, and good men for good women, for they are innocent of what people say. There is forgiveness for them and a gracious provision

27.Ahmed Ali: O you who believe, do not enter other houses except yours without first asking permission and saluting the inmates. This is better for you: You may haply take heed

28.Ahmed Ali: If you find that no one is in, then do not enter unless you have received permission. If you are asked to go away, turn back. That is proper for you. God is aware of what you do

29.Ahmed Ali: There is no harm in going into uninhabited houses where there is some convenience for you, as God has knowledge of what you hide and what you disclose

30.Ahmed Ali: Tell the believing men to lower their eyes and guard their private parts. There is for them goodness in this. God is aware of what they do

31.Ahmed Ali: Tell the believing women to lower their eyes, guard their private parts, and not display their charms except what is apparent outwardly, and cover their bosoms with their veils and not to show their finery except to their husbands or their fathers or fathers-in-law, their sons or step-sons, brothers, or their brothers' and sisters' sons, or their women attendants or captives, or male attendants who do not have any need (for women), or boys not yet aware of sex. They should not walk stamping their feet lest they make known what they hide of their Ornaments. O believers, turn to God, every one of you, so that you may be successful

32.Ahmed Ali: Marry off those who are single among you, and those of your male and female servants who are righteous. If they are poor, God will enrich them of His grace, for God is bounteous and all-knowing

33.Ahmed Ali: Those who cannot afford to marry should abstain from what is unlawful until God enriches them by His grace. And free those slaves you possess who wish to buy their freedom after a written undertaking, if you know they have some goodness, and give them out of the riches God has given you. Do not force your maids to prostitution if they wish to lead married lives, in order to get the benefits of this world. But if someone forces them, surely God (will forgive them) after their forced helplessness, for He is forgiving and kind

34.Ahmed Ali: We have sent down clear instructions to you, and illustrations from (the accounts) of those who have gone before you, and a warning for those who take heed for themselves

35.Ahmed Ali: God is the light of the heavens and the earth. The semblance of His light is that of a niche in which is a lamp, the flame within a glass, the glass a glittering star as it were, lit with the oil of a blessed tree, the olive, neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil appears to light up even though fire touches it not, -- light upon light. God guides to His light whom He will. So does God advance precepts of wisdom for men, for God has knowledge of everything

36.Ahmed Ali: (The light is lit) in houses of worship which God has allowed to be raised, and His name remembered in them. His praises are sung there morning and evening

37.Ahmed Ali: By men not distracted from the remembrance of God either by trade and commerce or buying and selling, who stand by their devotional obligations and pay the zakat, who fear the day when hearts and eyes would flutter with trepidatio

38.Ahmed Ali: That God may reward them for the best of their deeds, and bestow more on them of His bounty, for God gives whom He please without measure

39.Ahmed Ali: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in the desert which the thirsty takes for water till he reaches it to find that there was nothing, and finds God with him who settles his account, for God is swift at the reckoning

40.Ahmed Ali: Or like darkness in a wide, wide sea, waves surging upon waves, with clouds overhanging, darkness on darkness. If you stretch your hand, you could hardly see it. For him whom God does not give any light, there is no light

41.Ahmed Ali: Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds on the wing, sing the praises of God. Each one knows its obligations and its duties, and God knows whatever they do

42.Ahmed Ali: For God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and the returning is to God

43.Ahmed Ali: Have you not seen that God drives the clouds, then joins them together and puts them fold on fold. Then you see the rain fall through them; and He sends down hail from the sky where there are mountains of it, and strikes those with it whom He will, and wards it off from whomsoever He please. His lightning could snatch away their eyes

44.Ahmed Ali: It is God who alternates night and day. There is surely a lesson in this for men of sight

45.Ahmed Ali: God created every moving thing from water: One crawls on its belly, one walks on two legs, another moves on four. God creates whatsoever He will. Indeed God has power over everything

46.Ahmed Ali: We have surely sent down clear signs. It is God who guides whom He will to the path that is straight

47.Ahmed Ali: They say they believe in God and the Prophet, and have come to believe, yet a section of them turns back even after this; and these are not believers

48.Ahmed Ali: When they are called to God and His Prophet, that he may judge between them, a section of them turns away

49.Ahmed Ali: Had right been on their side they would have come to him submissively

50.Ahmed Ali: Is there a malady in their hearts, or they are deluded, or afraid that God and His Prophet would be unjust in dealing with them? Not so; they are themselves unjust

51.Ahmed Ali: The answer of the believers when they are called to God and His Apostle that he may judge between them, is: "We hear and obey." And they are the ones who will prosper

52.Ahmed Ali: Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success

53.Ahmed Ali: They swear solemnly by God: "If you command us we shall go forth." Say: "Do not swear. What is wanted is obedience, as should be. God is certainly aware of what you do."

54.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Obey God and obey the Apostle. If you turn away, then for him is his duty to fulfil, and for you the burden that you carry; yet if you obey him you will be rightly guided. The duty of the Messenger is to convey the message clearly

55.Ahmed Ali: God has promised to make those of you who believe and do the right, leaders in the land, as He had made those before them, and will establish their faith which He has chosen for them and change their fear into security. They will worship Me and not associate any one with Me. But those who disbelieve after this will be reprobates

56.Ahmed Ali: So observe your devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and obey the Apostle so that you may be shown mercy

57.Ahmed Ali: Do not think that unbelievers will subvert (the authority of God) on earth. Their abode is Hell; and what an evil destination

58.Ahmed Ali: O you who believe, let your dependants and those who have not yet reached the age of puberty, ask permission (to enter your presence) on three occasions: Before the early morning prayer; when you disrobe for the mid-day siesta; and after prayer at night. These are the three occasions of dishabille for you. There is no harm if you or they visit one another at other times (without permission). God thus explains things to you clearly, for God is all-knowing and all-wise

59.Ahmed Ali: When your children have reached the age of puberty, they should similarly ask your leave (for entering) as others did before them. God thus clearly explains His commands to you, for God is all-knowing and all-wise

60.Ahmed Ali: As for your women past the age of bearing children, who have no hope of marriage, there is no harm if they take off their outer garments, but in such a way that they do not display their charms; yet if they avoid this it would be better for them. God is all-hearing and all-knowing

61.Ahmed Ali: There is no harm if the blind, the lame, the sick, or you yourselves, eat in your own houses or the houses of your fathers, mothers, or your brothers' houses, or those of your sisters, or your fathers' brothers' or sisters', or your mothers' brothers' or sisters', or in the houses whose care is entrusted to you, or the houses of your friends

62.Ahmed Ali: There is no harm in your eating together or separately. But when you enter the houses, salute the inmates with a greeting in the name of God, invoking blessings and good health. That is how God explains things to you clearly so that you may understand. They alone are true believers who believe in God and His Apostle, and when they are with him on a matter of common concern, do not depart without obtaining his leave. Surely those who ask leave of you are the ones who believe in God and His Apostle. Therefore when they ask leave of you for personal business give leave to those you please, and seek God's forgiveness for them. Surely God is forgiving and kind

63.Ahmed Ali: Do not consider your being summoned by the Apostle to be like your summoning one another. God knows those of you who go away surreptitiously. So let those who act in contravention of his command take heed lest a trial should befall them or a grievous punishment come upon them

64.Ahmed Ali: Does not everything in the heavens and the earth belong to God? He surely knows what state you are in; and on the day they go back to Him. He will tell them what they used to do, for God has knowledge of everything

1.Ahmed Ali: BLESSED IS HE who revealed the Criterion (of right and wrong) to His votary that it may be a warning for the world, -

2.Ahmed Ali: He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, who has neither begotten a son nor has He a partner in His kingdom, (who) created everything and determined its exact measure

3.Ahmed Ali: Yet they choose apart from Him gods who have not created any thing and have themselves been created, who possess no power over their loss or gain, or their death or life or being raised to life again

4.Ahmed Ali: Yet the unbelievers say: "This is nothing but a lie he has concocted in which others have aided him." They have come down to mischief and lies

5.Ahmed Ali: And they say: "These are fables of antiquity he has invented, which are dictated to him morning and evening."

6.Ahmed Ali: Say: "He who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth has revealed it to me; and He is surely forgiving and kind."

7.Ahmed Ali: But they say: "What sort of prophet is this who eats food and walks the market places? Why was no angel sent to him to act as admonisher with him

8.Ahmed Ali: Or a treasure should have been given to him, or he should have had an orchard from which he could eat." And these wicked people say: "You only follow a man ensorcelled."

9.Ahmed Ali: Just see what comparisons they bring up for you! They are lost and cannot find the way

10.Ahmed Ali: Blessed be He who, if He pleased, could give you better than that, -- gardens with rivers flowing by; and make palaces for you

11.Ahmed Ali: Yet they reject the Hour as untrue. We have prepared a Fire for those who deny the Resurrection

12.Ahmed Ali: When (Hell) appears to them from a distance they will hear it raging and roaring

13.Ahmed Ali: And when they are cast within a narrow space of it chained together, they would plead for death

14.Ahmed Ali: "Do not ask for one death but many deaths on this day."

15.Ahmed Ali: Ask them: "Is this better or a garden for everlasting abode which has been promised the pious and devout? It would be their guerdon and their destination

16.Ahmed Ali: There will they have whatever they wish, and there abide for ever." This is a promise incumbent on your Lord which will certainly be fulfilled

17.Ahmed Ali: The day He will gather them together along with those they worshipped other than God, He will ask them: "Did you lure these creatures of Mine away, or did they themselves go astray?"

18.Ahmed Ali: They will answer: "Glory to You. It was not worthy of us to seek any protector other than You. But You allowed them and their fathers a life of ease until they turned oblivious of the Reminder. They were a people impenitent

19.Ahmed Ali: (The idolaters will be told): "Your gods have refuted your assertion. You can neither avert (your doom) nor receive any help. We shall make the wicked among you taste of severe punishment."

20.Ahmed Ali: We never sent before you apostles who did not eat food and walk the market places. We make some of you the means of trying the others. So will you persevere? Your Lord is always watching

21.Ahmed Ali: Those who do not hope to meet Us say: "Why are no angels sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?" They are full of self-conceit and behave with intense arrogance

22.Ahmed Ali: The day they see the angels there will be no happy tidings for the sinners; and they will say: "There is an insurmountable barrier!"

23.Ahmed Ali: We shall turn to their deeds and scatter them like particles of dust

24.Ahmed Ali: The inmates of Paradise will have a better abode that day, and a better resting place

25.Ahmed Ali: The day the heavens splits asunder with a dazzling white cloud gathering and the angels descend in a continuous stream

26.Ahmed Ali: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels

27.Ahmed Ali: The sinner will then bite his hand and say: "Would that I had taken the road with the Prophet

28.Ahmed Ali: Woe alas, ah would I had not taken so-and-so as friend

29.Ahmed Ali: He led me astray from the Warning after it had come to me. Satan always betrays man

30.Ahmed Ali: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."

31.Ahmed Ali: Thus do We keep opponents among the sinners for every apostle; yet your Lord is sufficient as a guide and helper

32.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers say: "Why was the whole Qur'an not sent down all at once to him?" It was sent thus that We may keep your heart resolute. So We enunciated it by steps and distinctly

33.Ahmed Ali: There is not an example they advance to which We do not give you a right answer and a better explanation

34.Ahmed Ali: Those who will be pushed faces forward into Hell will be in a worse position, farther away from the path

35.Ahmed Ali: We gave Moses the Book, and made his brother Aaron his minister

36.Ahmed Ali: Then We told them: "Go to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We annihilated them completely

37.Ahmed Ali: We had drowned the people of Noah when they had accused the apostles of lies, and turned them into an example for men. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wicked

38.Ahmed Ali: (As for) 'Ad, Thamud and the people of ar-Rass, and many generations in between them

39.Ahmed Ali: We administered warnings to each of them, and then destroyed them completely

40.Ahmed Ali: They must have surely passed by the town on which We had rained the terrible rain of ruin. How could they not have seen it? Still they do not dread the Resurrection

41.Ahmed Ali: When they see you they take you only in jest: "Is this the one whom God has sent as messenger

42.Ahmed Ali: He would have surely turned us away from our gods if we had not adhered to them." They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment

43.Ahmed Ali: Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him

44.Ahmed Ali: Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are no better than cattle; in fact they are farther astray from the path

45.Ahmed Ali: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? He could have kept it motionless if He liked. Yet We make the sun its pilot to show the way

46.Ahmed Ali: Then We draw it back to Us, withdrawing it little by little

47.Ahmed Ali: It is He who made the night a covering for you; and made sleep for rest, the day for rising

48.Ahmed Ali: It is He who sends the winds with auspicious news in advance of His benevolence; and We send pure water down from the sk

49.Ahmed Ali: To quicken a region that was dead, and to give it as drink to animals We have created and to men in plenty

50.Ahmed Ali: And We distribute it among them in various ways that they may ponder and reflect; yet most men disdain everything but denial and thanklessness

51.Ahmed Ali: Had We pleased We could have raised a warner in every town

52.Ahmed Ali: So do not listen to unbelievers, and strive against them with greater effort

53.Ahmed Ali: It is He who made two bodies of water flow side by side, one fresh (and) sweet, the other brine (and) bitter, and has placed an interstice, a barrier between them

54.Ahmed Ali: It is He who created man from water, then gave him consanguinity and affinity. Your Lord is omnipotent

55.Ahmed Ali: And yet they worship besides God what cannot bring them gain or do them harm. The unbeliever has always been an auxiliary against his Lord

56.Ahmed Ali: Yet We have not sent you but to give good tidings and to warn

57.Ahmed Ali: Tell them: "I do not ask any recompense of you for this other than (urging) whoever likes may take the way to his Lord."

58.Ahmed Ali: Have trust in God the Living, who will never die, and sing His hallelujas; for He is well aware of the sins of His creatures

59.Ahmed Ali: He created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them in six spans then assumed His authority. He is the benevolent: Ask those who are well-informed

60.Ahmed Ali: When you say to them: "Bow before Ar-Rahman," they say: "What is Ar-Rahman? Should we adore whoever you ask us to?" And their aversion increases further

61.Ahmed Ali: Blessed is He who placed in the heavens constellations of stars, and placed a burning lamp in it and the luminous moon

62.Ahmed Ali: It is He who made the night and day an alternation for him who cares to reflect and be grateful

63.Ahmed Ali: Devotees of Ar-Rahman are those who walk with humility on the earth, and when they are addressed by the ignorant, say: 'Peace;"

64.Ahmed Ali: And those who spend their nights bowed and standing before their Lord

65.Ahmed Ali: Who say: "O our Lord, avert from us the torment of Hell: Its punishment is surely continuous

66.Ahmed Ali: It is indeed an evil halt and an evil abode;"

67.Ahmed Ali: Who are neither prodigal nor miserly in their spending but follow a middle path

68.Ahmed Ali: Who do not invoke any god apart from God, who do not take a life which God has forbidden except for a cause that is just, and do not fornicate -- and any one who does so will be punished for the crime

69.Ahmed Ali: Whose punishment will be doubled on the Day of Judgement, and he will live for ever in disgrace

70.Ahmed Ali: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right, for whom God will turn evil into goodness, for God is forgiving and kind

71.Ahmed Ali: Whosoever repents and does the right, will have turned back to God by way of repentance

72.Ahmed Ali: And those who do not give false evidence, and if they come across unbecoming talk ignore it and pass by in a sedate way

73.Ahmed Ali: Who, when reminded of their Lord's revelations, do not fall for them like the deaf and blind

74.Ahmed Ali: And those who say: "O Lord, give us comfort in our spouses and children, and make us paragons of those who follow the straight path."

75.Ahmed Ali: They will be rewarded for their perseverance with lofty mansions in empyrean where they will be received with greetings of peace and salutations

76.Ahmed Ali: And abide there for ever: What an excellent destination and abode

77.Ahmed Ali: Say: "My Lord is not concerned on your account if you do not pray to Him. You have surely done with denying; soon will come the inevitable judgement

1.Ahmed Ali: TA SIN MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book

3.Ahmed Ali: You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief

4.Ahmed Ali: We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased, before which their heads would remain bowed

5.Ahmed Ali: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it

6.Ahmed Ali: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at

7.Ahmed Ali: Do they not see the earth, how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it

8.Ahmed Ali: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe

9.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful

10.Ahmed Ali: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people

11.Ahmed Ali: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"

12.Ahmed Ali: : He said: "O Lord, I fear that they will deny me

13.Ahmed Ali: My heart is constrained, my tongue falters, so delegate Aaron

14.Ahmed Ali: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."

15.Ahmed Ali: (It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs, both of you. I am verily with you and I hear

16.Ahmed Ali: Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: 'We bring a message from the Lord of all the world

17.Ahmed Ali: That you should send the children of Israel with us.

18.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us

19.Ahmed Ali: And you commited what you did, and you are ungrateful!"

20.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong

21.Ahmed Ali: So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom, and made me an apostle

22.Ahmed Ali: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."

23.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"

24.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."

25.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"

26.Ahmed Ali: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."

27.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."

28.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."

29.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."

30.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"

31.Ahmed Ali: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."

32.Ahmed Ali: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent

33.Ahmed Ali: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders

34.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician

35.Ahmed Ali: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So, what do you bid?"

36.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile, and send summoners to the cities to gathe

37.Ahmed Ali: And bring the ablest magicians to you."

38.Ahmed Ali: So the magicians were assembled at a stated time and place on an appointed day

39.Ahmed Ali: And the people were also asked to assemble

40.Ahmed Ali: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."

41.Ahmed Ali: When the magicians arrived, they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" -

42.Ahmed Ali: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."

43.Ahmed Ali: Moses said to them: "Cast what you have to cast."

44.Ahmed Ali: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."

45.Ahmed Ali: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations

46.Ahmed Ali: Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration

47.Ahmed Ali: And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds

48.Ahmed Ali: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

49.Ahmed Ali: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."

50.Ahmed Ali: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord

51.Ahmed Ali: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."

52.Ahmed Ali: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."

53.Ahmed Ali: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities

54.Ahmed Ali: (Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives)

55.Ahmed Ali: They are always harassing us

56.Ahmed Ali: But we are a fully accounted army."

57.Ahmed Ali: So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water

58.Ahmed Ali: And treasures and agreeable mansions

59.Ahmed Ali: Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them

60.Ahmed Ali: But they pursued them at sunrise

61.Ahmed Ali: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."

62.Ahmed Ali: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."

63.Ahmed Ali: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain

64.Ahmed Ali: Then We brought the others to that place

65.Ahmed Ali: We delivered Moses and every one with him

66.Ahmed Ali: And We drowned the others

67.Ahmed Ali: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe

68.Ahmed Ali: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful

69.Ahmed Ali: Relate the news of Abraham to them

70.Ahmed Ali: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

71.Ahmed Ali: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."

72.Ahmed Ali: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them

73.Ahmed Ali: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"

74.Ahmed Ali: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."

75.Ahmed Ali: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping

76.Ahmed Ali: You and your fathers

77.Ahmed Ali: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the world

78.Ahmed Ali: Who created me and showed me the way

79.Ahmed Ali: Who gives me food and drink

80.Ahmed Ali: And heals me when I am sick

81.Ahmed Ali: Who will make me die, then give me life again

82.Ahmed Ali: And who, I hope, will condone my faults on the Day of Judgement

83.Ahmed Ali: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous

84.Ahmed Ali: And uphold my name with posterity

85.Ahmed Ali: And put me among the inheritors of Paradise

86.Ahmed Ali: Forgive me and my father: He was surely among those who went astray

87.Ahmed Ali: And do not disgrace me on the day when they are raised from the graves

88.Ahmed Ali: The day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avai

89.Ahmed Ali: But to him who comes to God with a tranquil heart."

90.Ahmed Ali: Paradise will be brought near those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path

91.Ahmed Ali: And Hell made visible to those who had gone astray

92.Ahmed Ali: They will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped

93.Ahmed Ali: Other than God? Can they save you or even save themselves?"

94.Ahmed Ali: They will then be thrown into Hell with those who had gone astra

95.Ahmed Ali: Together with the hordes of Iblis

96.Ahmed Ali: Disputing among themselves they will say

97.Ahmed Ali: "By God, we were plainly in erro

98.Ahmed Ali: In equating you with the Lord of all the worlds

99.Ahmed Ali: No one but the sinners led us astray

100.Ahmed Ali: Now we have none to intercede for us

102.Ahmed Ali: If only we could return and be among the believers!"

103.Ahmed Ali: Verily there is a sign in this, but many of them do not believe

104.Ahmed Ali: Verily your Lord is mighty and merciful

105.Ahmed Ali: The people of Noah accused the apostles of lies

106.Ahmed Ali: When their brother Noah said to them: "Will you not take heed

107.Ahmed Ali: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you

108.Ahmed Ali: So be fearful of God and listen to me

109.Ahmed Ali: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds

110.Ahmed Ali: So fear God and follow me."

111.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"

112.Ahmed Ali: He said: "It is not for me to know what they were doing

113.Ahmed Ali: It is for my Lord to bring them to book, if you can understand

114.Ahmed Ali: I am certainly not one to drive away the believers

115.Ahmed Ali: I am only a plain admonisher."

116.Ahmed Ali: They said: "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will be stoned to death."

117.Ahmed Ali: He prayed: "O Lord, verily my people accuse me of lies

118.Ahmed Ali: So adjudge between me and them conclusively, and save me and the believers who are with me."

119.Ahmed Ali: So We delivered him and those with him in the loaded ark

120.Ahmed Ali: And drowned the rest of them

121.Ahmed Ali: Verily there is a sign in this, yet many of them do not believe

122.Ahmed Ali: But surely your Lord is mighty and merciful

123.Ahmed Ali: The people of 'Ad accused the messengers of lies

124.Ahmed Ali: When their brother Hud said to them: "Will you not take heed

125.Ahmed Ali: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you

126.Ahmed Ali: So fear God and listen to me

127.Ahmed Ali: I ask no recompense of you for it. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds

128.Ahmed Ali: You construct monuments on every hill in vain

129.Ahmed Ali: Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever

130.Ahmed Ali: And whenever you apply force become tyrannical

131.Ahmed Ali: So be fearful of God and follow me

132.Ahmed Ali: Fear Him who has bestowed on you what you know

133.Ahmed Ali: Gave you increase of cattle and sons

135.Ahmed Ali: I fear the punishment of a terrible day for you

136.Ahmed Ali: They said: "It is the same to us if you warn us or do not warn

137.Ahmed Ali: This is just a habit of antiquated people

138.Ahmed Ali: We are not going to be damned."

139.Ahmed Ali: Then they accused him of lies; so We annihilated them. Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe

140.Ahmed Ali: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and merciful

141.Ahmed Ali: The Thamud accused the messengers of lies

142.Ahmed Ali: When their brother Saleh said to them: "Will you not take heed?"

143.Ahmed Ali: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you

144.Ahmed Ali: So fear God and follow me

145.Ahmed Ali: I do not ask any recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds

146.Ahmed Ali: (Do you think) you will be left secure her

147.Ahmed Ali: In these gardens and these springs

148.Ahmed Ali: The fields of corn and date-palm trees with soft and tender spathes

149.Ahmed Ali: And dwellings hewed out of mountains ingeniously

150.Ahmed Ali: So be mindful of God and listen to me

151.Ahmed Ali: Do not follow those who are extravagant

152.Ahmed Ali: Who corrupt the land and do not reform it."

154.Ahmed Ali: You are nothing but a man like us. Bring us a token if you speak the truth."

155.Ahmed Ali: (Saleh) said: "Here is a she-camel. She has a right of drinking water, and you have a right of drinking it on appointed turns

156.Ahmed Ali: Do not treat her unkindly or the punishment of a grievous day will fall on you."

157.Ahmed Ali: But they hamstrung her; and on the morrow were repentant

158.Ahmed Ali: For they were seized by the torment. Verily there was a sign in this, but most of them did not believe

159.Ahmed Ali: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful

160.Ahmed Ali: The people of Lot accused the messengers of lies

161.Ahmed Ali: When their brother Lot said to them: "Will you not take heed

162.Ahmed Ali: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you

163.Ahmed Ali: So fear God and listen to me

164.Ahmed Ali: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds

165.Ahmed Ali: Why do you go for males unlike all other creature

166.Ahmed Ali: Leaving the consorts your Lord has made for you? But you are a people who exceed the bounds."

167.Ahmed Ali: They said: "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will be expelled (from the city)."

168.Ahmed Ali: (Lot) said: "I am disgusted with your actions,"

169.Ahmed Ali: (And prayed:) "O Lord, save me and my family from what they do."

170.Ahmed Ali: So We saved him and his whole famil

171.Ahmed Ali: Except one old woman who remained behind

172.Ahmed Ali: Then We destroyed the rest of them

173.Ahmed Ali: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned

174.Ahmed Ali: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe

175.Ahmed Ali: Yet surely your Lord is mighty and powerful

176.Ahmed Ali: The people of the Wood too called the messengers liars

177.Ahmed Ali: When Shu'aib said to them: "Will you not take heed

178.Ahmed Ali: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you

179.Ahmed Ali: So fear God and follow me

180.Ahmed Ali: I ask no recompense of you for this. My reward is due from none but the Lord of all the worlds

181.Ahmed Ali: Give full measure and do not cheat

183.Ahmed Ali: And do not withhold from people what belongs to them, and do not corrupt the land

184.Ahmed Ali: And fear Him who created you and all the earlier people."

186.Ahmed Ali: You are nothing but a man like us, and we think you are a liar

187.Ahmed Ali: But in case you are speaking the truth, then make a segment of the sky to fall upon us."

188.Ahmed Ali: (Shu'aib) said: "My Lord knows well what you are doing."

189.Ahmed Ali: But they denied him, and We seized them with the torment of the Day of Shadowing (when the cloud had rained down fire). It was indeed the torment of a terrible day

190.Ahmed Ali: Verily in this was a sign, but most of them do not believe

191.Ahmed Ali: Yet verily your Lord is mighty and merciful

192.Ahmed Ali: And this (Qur'an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds

193.Ahmed Ali: Which the trusted spirit descended wit

194.Ahmed Ali: To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warne

196.Ahmed Ali: This is (indicated) in the Books of earlier people

197.Ahmed Ali: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of Israel knew about this

198.Ahmed Ali: Had We revealed it to a man of obscure tongu

199.Ahmed Ali: And he had recited it to them, and they had not believed (it would have been different)

200.Ahmed Ali: Thus do We cause (unbelief) to enter the hearts of sinners

201.Ahmed Ali: They will not believe it until they behold the painful punishment

202.Ahmed Ali: It will come upon them unawares, and they will not comprehend it

203.Ahmed Ali: Then will they say: "Can we be given respite?"

204.Ahmed Ali: Do they wish Us then to hasten the punishment

205.Ahmed Ali: Just think: If We let them enjoy (the good things of life) for a few years more

206.Ahmed Ali: And then what they were promised comes upon them

207.Ahmed Ali: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them

208.Ahmed Ali: Never have We destroyed a habitation till We had sent admonishers to the

209.Ahmed Ali: To warn. For We are never unjust

210.Ahmed Ali: The devils did not bring it down

211.Ahmed Ali: They are not worthy of it, nor have they power

212.Ahmed Ali: They have been precluded from hearing it

213.Ahmed Ali: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment

215.Ahmed Ali: And take those believers under your wing who follow you

216.Ahmed Ali: If they do not obey you, tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."

217.Ahmed Ali: Have trust in the Mighty, the Merciful

218.Ahmed Ali: Who watches you when you get up

219.Ahmed Ali: And your movements among those who bow in homage to God

221.Ahmed Ali: Should I tell you on whom the devils descend

222.Ahmed Ali: They come down to every mendacious sinner

223.Ahmed Ali: Who listens to you (for spreading rumours); but most of them are liars

224.Ahmed Ali: As for the poets, only those who go astray follow them

225.Ahmed Ali: Have you not seen that they wander distract in every valley

226.Ahmed Ali: And they say what they do not do

227.Ahmed Ali: Except those who believe and do the right, and remember God a great deal, who retaliate only when they have been wronged. Yet the oppressors will now come to know through what reversals they will be overthrown

1.Ahmed Ali: TA SIN. THESE are the verses of the Qur'an, and collection of explicit laws

2.Ahmed Ali: A guidance and good tidings for the believers

3.Ahmed Ali: Who fulfil their devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and believe with certainty in the life to come

4.Ahmed Ali: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity

5.Ahmed Ali: They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life, and will be the greatest losers in the life to come

6.Ahmed Ali: You have been conveyed the Qur'an from One all-wise and all-knowing

7.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."

8.Ahmed Ali: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds

9.Ahmed Ali: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise

10.Ahmed Ali: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence

11.Ahmed Ali: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful

12.Ahmed Ali: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."

13.Ahmed Ali: And when Our signs came as distinct proofs, they said: "This is only magic."

14.Ahmed Ali: And they denied them out of malice and pride, though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers

15.Ahmed Ali: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."

16.Ahmed Ali: Solomon was heir to David, and he said: "O people, we have been taught the language of Tair, and have been given of everything. This is a clear favour indeed."

17.Ahmed Ali: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched

18.Ahmed Ali: Till they reached the Valley of Naml. Said the lady of Naml: "O Naml, go into your dwellings lest Solomon and his hordes should crush you unawares."

19.Ahmed Ali: (Solomon) smiled, amused at her speech, and said: "O Lord grant me that I should be grateful for the favours You have bestowed on me and my parents, and do good things of Your pleasing; and admit me among Your righteous devotees by Your grace."

20.Ahmed Ali: When he reviewed the Tair, he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent

21.Ahmed Ali: I will punish him severely, or cut his throat, unless he bring a valid excuse."

22.Ahmed Ali: But he was not long in coming, and reported: "I have been around where you have not been. I come from Saba with positive news

23.Ahmed Ali: I found a woman reigning over them, and she has been favoured with everything; and she has a throne that is magnificent

24.Ahmed Ali: I found that she and her people worship the sun in place of God, for Satan has made their deeds look attractive to them and has turned them away from the Path, so they do not find the wa

25.Ahmed Ali: To worship God who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and is cognisant of what you hide and what you disclose

26.Ahmed Ali: God: There is no god but He, the Lord of the glorious throne."

27.Ahmed Ali: (Solomon) said: 'We shall see if you speak the truth or you are a liar

28.Ahmed Ali: Take this letter from me, and deliver it to them and withdraw, then see what reply they give in return."

29.Ahmed Ali: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me

30.Ahmed Ali: It is from Solomon, and (says): 'In the name of Allah, Ar-Rahman, Ar-Rahim

31.Ahmed Ali: Do not rise against me, but come to me in submission.

32.Ahmed Ali: ." Advise me, O nobles," she said "in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."

33.Ahmed Ali: They said: "We are men of valour, and brave fighters. It is for you to decide. So consider what you should command."

34.Ahmed Ali: She said: "Surely when kings enter a city they destroy it and despoil the honour of its nobility. So will they do (to us)

35.Ahmed Ali: But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."

36.Ahmed Ali: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth? Yet what God has given me is better than what He has given you. No. Be gratified in your present

37.Ahmed Ali: Go back to them. We shall soon come with our armies which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them out of (the land) with ignominy, and they will be humbled."

38.Ahmed Ali: He (then) said (to his courtiers): "O you nobles, is there any one who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

39.Ahmed Ali: A crafty jinn said: "I will bring it before you rise from your seat, for I am strong and trustworthy."

40.Ahmed Ali: But one who had knowledge of the letter, said: "I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye." When Solomon saw it before him, (he said): "This is by the grace of my Lord that He may test me whether I am grateful or I am thankless. Yet if one is grateful, he is grateful for himself, and if one is thankless, then surely my Lord is unconcerned and magnanimous."

41.Ahmed Ali: (Turning to his nobles) he said: "Change the appearance of her throne. Let us see if she is rightly guided, or is not guided at all."

42.Ahmed Ali: When she arrived, they asked her: "Is your throne like this?" She said: "As though this is it. We had come to have knowledge and already submitted."

43.Ahmed Ali: She was (in fact) turned away by what she worshipped other than God, for she came of an unbelieving people

44.Ahmed Ali: She was invited to enter the court. When she saw it, she took it for a sheet of water, and (pulling up her skirts) uncovered her legs. (Solomon) told her: "This is paved with tiles of glass." "O Lord," she said, "I have wronged myself, and I submit to the Lord of all the worlds with Solomon."

45.Ahmed Ali: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh (who said): "Worship God." But they were divided into two groups disputing with one another

46.Ahmed Ali: (Saleh) said: "O people, why do you wish to hasten evil rather than good? Why not ask for God's forgiveness? You may well be forgiven."

47.Ahmed Ali: They said: "You betoken evil, and those with you." (Saleh) replied: "The evil you presage can only come from God. In reality you are a people under trial (for your own inauspiciousness)."

48.Ahmed Ali: There were in that city nine persons who spread disorder in the land, and did not reform

49.Ahmed Ali: They said: "Let us swear by God that we will attack Saleh and his family at night, and later tell his heirs: 'We did not see his family destroyed, and we speak the truth.'"

50.Ahmed Ali: They hatched up the plot; We also planned without their knowledge

51.Ahmed Ali: Now see the end of their machinations: We destroyed them and their entire people

52.Ahmed Ali: So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand

53.Ahmed Ali: We deliver those who believe and take heed for themselves

54.Ahmed Ali: (Remember) Lot, when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)

55.Ahmed Ali: You lust after men in place of women. You are indeed a stolid people."

56.Ahmed Ali: His people had no answer except saying: "Expel the family of Lot from your city. They are a people who would (rather) be pure!"

57.Ahmed Ali: So We saved him and his family except his wife who was destined to stay behind

58.Ahmed Ali: And We rained down on them a shower (of stones). How ruinous was the rain that fell on those who had been warned (but warned in vain)

59.Ahmed Ali: Say: "All praise be to God, and peace on those of His creatures whom He has chosen." Is God better or those they associate with Him -

60.Ahmed Ali: Who created the heavens and the earth, who sends down water from the sky for you, with which He causes graceful gardens to grow? It was not in your power to make trees germinate. Is there any other god along with God. In fact they are a people who turn away (from the truth)

61.Ahmed Ali: Who then made the earth a habitable place, and made the rivers (flow) in its valleys and dales, and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and kept a barrier between two bodies of water? Is there any other god along with God? In reality most of them do not know

62.Ahmed Ali: Who hears the cry of the anguished (soul) when it calls to Him, and relieves its suffering? And who made you trustees on the earth? Is there any other god along with God? How little it is that you reflect

63.Ahmed Ali: Who then really shows you the way in the darkness of the desert and the sea? And who sends breezes bringing news of His benevolence? Is there any other god along with God? He is far too exalted for what they associate with Him

64.Ahmed Ali: Who creates first then reverts it? And who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth? Is there any other god along with God? Tell them: "Bring your proof, if you are truthful."

65.Ahmed Ali: Say: "No one in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unknown except God, nor can they know when they will be raised again

66.Ahmed Ali: Still less do they comprehend the life to come. In fact they are in doubt about it. Still more, they are blind to it."

67.Ahmed Ali: Those who do not believe, say: "When we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again

68.Ahmed Ali: Indeed we and our fathers had been promised this before. It is nothing but the earlier people's lore."

69.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (bad) was the end of sinners."

70.Ahmed Ali: Do not grieve over them, and do not be distressed by what they contrive

71.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "When will this promise come to pass? (Tell Us) if you speak the truth."

72.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Perhaps some of what you wish to hasten is right behind you."

73.Ahmed Ali: Verily your Lord is gracious to men, though most men are ungrateful

74.Ahmed Ali: Verily your Lord knows what lies hidden in their breasts and what they disclose

75.Ahmed Ali: There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book

76.Ahmed Ali: Indeed this Qur'an explains to the children of Israel much of what they are at variance

77.Ahmed Ali: It is a guidance and grace for those who believe

78.Ahmed Ali: Surely your Lord in His wisdom will decide between them. He is all-mighty and all-knowing

79.Ahmed Ali: So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth

80.Ahmed Ali: You cannot make the dead to listen, or the deaf to hear the call, when they have turned their backs

81.Ahmed Ali: Nor can you lead the blind when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe in Our signs and have come to peace and submission

82.Ahmed Ali: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs

83.Ahmed Ali: The day We shall gather from every community a section of those who denied Our signs, and they will be brought (in separate groups)

84.Ahmed Ali: So that when they come (before the Lord) He will say: "Did you deny My signs without having understood them? Or what was it that you were doing?"

85.Ahmed Ali: When the sentence will have been passed upon them for their wickedness, they will not be able to say a word

86.Ahmed Ali: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest, the day to make things clear? Indeed there are signs in this for people who believe

87.Ahmed Ali: The day the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified, save those whom God please, and all will appear before Him in abjectness

88.Ahmed Ali: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything. He is indeed fully aware of what you do

89.Ahmed Ali: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror

90.Ahmed Ali: But whosoever comes with evil will be flung face forward into the Fire. Can you expect reward for any thing but what you do

91.Ahmed Ali: (Say): "I am commanded to worship the Lord of this land He has blessed, to whom all things belong; and I am commanded to be one of those who submit

92.Ahmed Ali: And to recite the Qur'an." Whoever comes to guidance does so for himself; as for him who stays astray, tell him: "I am only a warner."

93.Ahmed Ali: Say: "All praise be to God. He will show you His signs, and you will recognise them. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do."

1.Ahmed Ali: TA SIN MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: These are the verses of the illuminating Book

3.Ahmed Ali: We narrate to you from the history of Moses and Pharaoh in all verity, for those who believe

4.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh had become high and mighty in the land, and divided the people into different classes, and impoverished one class, slaying its males and sparing its women, for he was indeed a tyrant

5.Ahmed Ali: We wished to favour those who were weak in the land and make them leaders and heirs

6.Ahmed Ali: And establish them in the country; and to make the Pharaoh, Haman and their hordes beware of what they feared from them

7.Ahmed Ali: So We conveyed to the mother of Moses: "Suckle him. If you are afraid for him, cast him in the river without any fear or regret, for We shall restore him to you, and make him an apostle."

8.Ahmed Ali: Then he was picked up by the family of Pharaoh (unaware) that he would become their enemy and a cause for regret. Surely the Pharaoh, Haman and their hordes were habitual sinners

9.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh's wife said: "He will be a comfort to me and to you. Do not kill him. He may well be of some advantage to us, or we may adopt him as a son." They were not aware (of what the future held in store)

10.Ahmed Ali: The mother of Moses was perturbed in the morning. Had We not strengthened her heart to remain a believer she had almost given him away

11.Ahmed Ali: She told his sister: "Follow him." So she kept an eye on him from a distance, unbeknown to them

12.Ahmed Ali: We made (Moses) refuse a wet nurse. So his sister said: "Should I tell you of a household that could bring him up for you and take care of him?"

13.Ahmed Ali: Thus We restored him to his mother that she may be tranquil and not grieve, and know that the promise of God is true, though most men do not know

14.Ahmed Ali: When he had grown up to full maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We recompense the doers of good

15.Ahmed Ali: He came to the city when the people were in a care-free mood, and saw two men quarrelling, one belonging to his community, the other to his enemies. The man who belonged to his community appealed for help against the one who belonged to the enemies. Moses struck him a blow with his fist and finished him off. "This is of Satan's doing," he said. "He is certainly an enemy and a corrupter."

16.Ahmed Ali: "O Lord," he prayed, "I have done wrong, forgive me." And God forgave him. Verily He is forgiving and kind

17.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "O Lord, as You have been gracious to me I will never aid the guilty."

18.Ahmed Ali: In the morning he came to the city, fearful and hesitant. Just then he who had asked him for help the day before called out for help (again). "You are indeed a meddlesome fellow," Moses said to him

19.Ahmed Ali: Then as he was about to lay hands on the one who was their common enemy, he cried out: "O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed that person yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."

20.Ahmed Ali: There came a man running from the other part of the city. "O Moses," he said, "the chiefs are deliberating to kill you. Go away from the city. I wish you well."

21.Ahmed Ali: So he left the city, fearful and hesitant, (and) prayed: "O Lord, deliver me from these wicked people."

22.Ahmed Ali: Then as he turned his face to Midian, he said: "Maybe my Lord will show me the right way."

23.Ahmed Ali: And when he came to the waters of Midian he found a crowd of people watering (their flocks), and saw two maidens holding back (their cattle). He asked: "What is the trouble with you?" They said: "We cannot water our flock till the shepherds have driven away theirs, and our father is a very old man."

24.Ahmed Ali: So he watered (their flock), and moved into the shade and prayed: "My Lord, I have need of whatever good you send me."

25.Ahmed Ali: Then one of the (maidens) came to him walking bashfully, (and) said: "My father invites you that he may repay you for having watered our flock." So, when (Moses) came to him and told him his story, he said: "Have no fear. You have escaped from the wicked people."

26.Ahmed Ali: Said one of the maidens: "O father, employ him. Surely the best (man) to employ is one who is strong and honest."

27.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I would like to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you if you agree to work for me on hire for eight years. And if you stay on for ten, it is up to you. I do not wish to impose any hardship on you. God willing you will find me a man of honour."

28.Ahmed Ali: (Moses) said: "This is (agreed) between you and me. Whichever term I fulfil, no injustice will be done to me. God is witness to our agreement."

29.Ahmed Ali: When Moses had fulfilled the term and was journeying with his family, he noticed a fire on the side of the mountain. "Wait here," he said to his family; "I have seen a fire. I may haply bring some news from there, or an ember that you may warm yourselves."

30.Ahmed Ali: When he drew near, a voice called out to him from the tree on the blessed spot on the right side of the valley: "O Moses, I am verily God, the Lord of all the worlds

31.Ahmed Ali: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent, he turned about and fled without turning. "O Moses, approach," (said the Voice), "and have no fear. You will be safe

32.Ahmed Ali: Put your hand inside your shirt. It will come out white without a tarnish of blame; and do not be perturbed or afraid. These are two proofs from your Lord for the Pharaoh and his nobles. They are certainly a rebellious people."

33.Ahmed Ali: He said: "O Lord, I have killed a man of theirs, and fear they would kill me

34.Ahmed Ali: So send my brother Aaron with me as helper for he is more fluent than I with words, that he should affirm me, for I fear that they would call me a liar."

35.Ahmed Ali: (And) God said: "We shall strengthen your arm with your brother, and give you power with Our signs and give you authority, so that they will not be able to harm you. Both of you and your followers will be victorious."

36.Ahmed Ali: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs they said: "This is nothing but magic he has contrived, for we have not heard of this from our fathers of old."

37.Ahmed Ali: But Moses said: "My Lord knows well who has come with guidance from Him, and for whom is the guerdon of Paradise. But surely the wicked will not prosper."

38.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh said: "O nobles, I am not aware of any other lord of yours but myself. So, O Haman, fire some clay (bricks) to build a tower for me that I may mount up (and see) the God of Moses; for I think he is a liar."

39.Ahmed Ali: He and his soldiers had become arrogant in the land for no reason, and did not think that they have to come back to Us in the end

40.Ahmed Ali: So We seized him and his hordes and threw them into the sea. Behold then how was the end of the wicked

41.Ahmed Ali: We made them the leaders of those who call to Hell; and on the Day of Judgement they will not be helped

42.Ahmed Ali: A curse lies upon them in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be despised

43.Ahmed Ali: After We had destroyed the earlier generations We gave Moses the Book as evidence for mankind, and a guidance and grace, so that they may remember

44.Ahmed Ali: You were not there on the western side (of Mount Sinai) when We gave the commandments to Moses, nor were you witness (to the event)

45.Ahmed Ali: We raised (many more) generations and prolonged their lives. You did not live with the people of Midian, nor recited to them Our revelations; but We kept on sending messengers

46.Ahmed Ali: You were not present on the side of Mount Sinai when We called. And all this (knowledge that you are given) is by the grace of your Lord so that you may warn a people to whom no admonisher had come before you, that they may take heed

47.Ahmed Ali: And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves, they should say: "O Lord, why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands, and been with those who are believers;"

48.Ahmed Ali: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve before in what was given to Moses? They said: "Both are imposters one like the other," and added: "We do not believe in either."

49.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Then bring a Book from God which gives better guidance than these so that I may follow it, if you speak the truth."

50.Ahmed Ali: Then, if they cannot give you an answer, know that they are only following their lusts. And who can be farther astray than he who follows his lust without any guidance from God? And certainly God does not guide an unjust people

51.Ahmed Ali: We have been sending word to them that they may take a warning

52.Ahmed Ali: Those to whom We gave the Book before this do believe in it

53.Ahmed Ali: And when it is read out to them, say: "We believe in it. It's the truth from our Lord. We had committed ourselves before it came."

54.Ahmed Ali: These will be given their recompense twice, for they persevered and repelled evil with good, and spent of what We had given them

55.Ahmed Ali: When they hear idle talk they turn aside and say: "To us our actions, to you yours. Peace on you; we do not look for the ignorant."

56.Ahmed Ali: You cannot guide any one you like: God guides whosoever He please. He knows best who will come to guidance

57.Ahmed Ali: They say: "If we followed your guidance we would be driven from the land by force." Have We not set up a sanctuary for them, to which is brought a wealth of everything as provision from Us? But most of them do not understand

58.Ahmed Ali: How many habitations that had come to boast of their resources have We destroyed? These their dwellings were never inhabited except rarely after them; and they came back to Us

59.Ahmed Ali: But your Lord does not destroy habitations without having sent an apostle to their metropolis to read out Our commandments to them. We would never have destroyed cities if their inhabitants were not given to wickedness

60.Ahmed Ali: Whatsoever has been given you is the stuff this life is made of, and only its embellishment. What is with your Lord is better and abiding. Will you not understand

61.Ahmed Ali: Can one who was given a better promise, which he will find come true, be like him who was given a little enjoyment of this life, but who will afterwards be brought (to judgement) on the Day of Resurrection

62.Ahmed Ali: That day God will call them and ask: "Where are they you imagined were My compeers?"

63.Ahmed Ali: Those against whom the sentence is justified will say: "O Lord, these are those we had led astray as we had ourselves gone astray. We clear ourselves before You: They never worshipped us."

64.Ahmed Ali: (The sinners) will be told: "Invoke your partners." They will call on them, but they will not answer; and they will see the torment (and wish) if only they had come to guidance

65.Ahmed Ali: (God) will ask them on that day: "What answer did you give the apostles?"

66.Ahmed Ali: Then all news will be blacked out for them, and they will not even ask one another

67.Ahmed Ali: But he who repents and believes and does good things may well be among the successful

68.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord creates what He wills and chooses. The good is not for them to choose. Too holy and high is God for what they associate with Him

69.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord well knows what they hide in their breasts and what they disclose

70.Ahmed Ali: He is God. There is no god but He. His alone is praise first and last, and His the judgement, and to Him will you be brought back in the end

71.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Just think, if God were to cover you up with night for ever until the Day of Doom, what other god apart from God will give you light? Why do you not pay heed?"

72.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Just think. If God were to make the day perpetual till the Day of Resurrection, what other god but God would bring you night for rest? Why do you not reflect

73.Ahmed Ali: Yet in His benevolence He made you night and day that you may rest and seek His bounty during them, and haply maybe grateful."
