102.Ahmed Ali: When he was old enough to go about with him, he said: "O my son, I dreamt that I was sacrificing you. Consider, what you think?" He replied: "Father, do as you are commanded. If God pleases you will find me firm."

103.Ahmed Ali: When they submitted to the will of God, and (Abraham) laid (his son) down prostrate on his temple

105.Ahmed Ali: You have fulfilled your dream." Thus do We reward the good

106.Ahmed Ali: That was indeed a trying test

107.Ahmed Ali: So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice

108.Ahmed Ali: And left (his hallowed memory) for posterity

110.Ahmed Ali: That is how We reward those who do good

111.Ahmed Ali: He is truly among Our faithful creatures

112.Ahmed Ali: So We gave him the good news of Isaac, apostle, who is among the righteous

113.Ahmed Ali: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants are some who do good, but some who wrong themselves

114.Ahmed Ali: We were indeed gracious to Moses and Aaron

115.Ahmed Ali: And saved them and their people from great distress

116.Ahmed Ali: And helped them, so they were victorious

117.Ahmed Ali: We gave them the explicit Book

118.Ahmed Ali: And showed them the straight path

120.Ahmed Ali: Peace be on Moses and Aaron

121.Ahmed Ali: That is how We reward those who do good

122.Ahmed Ali: They are among Our faithful devotees

123.Ahmed Ali: Verily Elias is one of the apostles

124.Ahmed Ali: When he said to his people: "Will you not be mindful of God

125.Ahmed Ali: Would you call on Baal and leave the best of creators

126.Ahmed Ali: God, your Lord, and the Lord of your fathers?"

127.Ahmed Ali: They denied him, and will surely be brought to punishment

128.Ahmed Ali: Except the chosen creatures of God

129.Ahmed Ali: And We left his (memory) for posterity

131.Ahmed Ali: That is how We reward those who do good

132.Ahmed Ali: He is truly among Our faithful devotees

133.Ahmed Ali: Verily Lot was one of the apostles

134.Ahmed Ali: Wherefore We saved him and his entire famil

135.Ahmed Ali: Except an old woman who was one of those who stayed behind

137.Ahmed Ali: You pass by (their habitations) in the mornin

138.Ahmed Ali: Or at night. Then how is it you do not understand

139.Ahmed Ali: Verily Jonah is one of the apostles

140.Ahmed Ali: When he fled on the laden ship

141.Ahmed Ali: And lots were cast (when a storm overtook them), he was rejected, (and thrown overboard)

142.Ahmed Ali: Then he was swallowed by a large fish as he was worthy of blame

143.Ahmed Ali: Had he not been one of those who struggled hard

144.Ahmed Ali: He would have stayed in its belly till the day the dead are raised

145.Ahmed Ali: So We cast him, sick, on a barren shore

146.Ahmed Ali: And We made a gourd tree grow over him

147.Ahmed Ali: We sent him to a hundred thousand men or more

148.Ahmed Ali: And they came to believe; so We allowed them to enjoy the good things of life for an age

149.Ahmed Ali: Now ask them if their Lord has daughters, and they sons

150.Ahmed Ali: Or did We make the angels females, and they witnessed it

151.Ahmed Ali: Is it not a lie invented by them when they say

152.Ahmed Ali: "God has begotten (children)?" They are liars indeed

153.Ahmed Ali: Does He prefer sons to daughters

154.Ahmed Ali: What ails you that you judge in such a wise

156.Ahmed Ali: Or have you received some clear authority

157.Ahmed Ali: Then bring your scripture, if what you say is true

158.Ahmed Ali: They link Him with jinns by lineage, yet the jinns know they will be brought before Him

159.Ahmed Ali: God is too glorious for what they ascribe to Hi

160.Ahmed Ali: Except His chosen creatures who do not

161.Ahmed Ali: So neither you nor those you worshi

162.Ahmed Ali: Can mislead anyone away from Him

163.Ahmed Ali: Except one who is (destined) to burn in Hell

164.Ahmed Ali: "There is not one of us who does not have his appointed place," (declare the angels.

165.Ahmed Ali: "And we are truly those who stand in rows

166.Ahmed Ali: And we are those who sing hallelujas to Him."

168.Ahmed Ali: If we had the account of earlier people with us

169.Ahmed Ali: We would have been the chosen creatures of God."

170.Ahmed Ali: Yet now (that it has come) they refuse to believe in it; but they will come to know soon

171.Ahmed Ali: Our word had already been given before to Our votaries, the apostles, -

173.Ahmed Ali: And that certainly Our armies will be victorious

174.Ahmed Ali: So you ignore them for a tim

175.Ahmed Ali: And wait; they will come to know soon

176.Ahmed Ali: Do they want to hasten Our punishment

177.Ahmed Ali: When it comes down on their plains, it will be an evil dawn for those who had been warned

178.Ahmed Ali: So turn away from them for a tim

179.Ahmed Ali: And watch; they will come to know soon

180.Ahmed Ali: Too glorious is your Lord, the Lord of power, for what they ascribe to Him

181.Ahmed Ali: So peace be on the messengers

182.Ahmed Ali: And all praise to God, the Lord of all the worlds

1.Ahmed Ali: SAD. I CALL to witness the admonishing Qur'an

2.Ahmed Ali: But the unbelievers are still full of pride and hostility

3.Ahmed Ali: How many generations have We destroyed before them who cried (for mercy) when it was too late for escape

4.Ahmed Ali: They were surprised that one of them had come to them as warner; and the unbelievers said: "He is a deceiving sorcerer

5.Ahmed Ali: Has he turned so many gods into one deity? This is indeed a strange thing!"

6.Ahmed Ali: And their leading chiefs said: "Remain attached to your gods. There is surely some motive behind it

7.Ahmed Ali: We never heard of it in the former faith. It is surely a fabrication

8.Ahmed Ali: To him of all of us has the Reminder been sent down?" They are still in doubt about My admonition; but they have not tasted My punishment yet

9.Ahmed Ali: Do they have the stores of the mercy of your Lord, the mighty and munificent

10.Ahmed Ali: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, theirs? Then let them climb up the ladders (to the heavens)

11.Ahmed Ali: They will be one more army vanquished among the many routed hordes

12.Ahmed Ali: Even before them the people of Noah, 'Ad, the mighty Pharoah

13.Ahmed Ali: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, as well as the dwellers of the Wood, had denied. These were the hordes

14.Ahmed Ali: Of all these there was not one who did not deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified

15.Ahmed Ali: They await but a single blast which will not be repeated

16.Ahmed Ali: Still they say: "O Lord, give us our share before the Day of Reckoning."

17.Ahmed Ali: Bear with patience what they say, and remember Our votary David, man of strength. He surely turned to Us in penitence

18.Ahmed Ali: We subjugated the chiefs (of tribes) to struggle day and night with him

19.Ahmed Ali: And the levied Tair. They were all obedient to him

20.Ahmed Ali: So We further strengthened his kingdom, and bestowed wisdom on him, and judgement in legal matters

21.Ahmed Ali: Have you heard of the litigants who jumped over the wall into his chamber

22.Ahmed Ali: When they came before David, he was frightened of them. "Do not be afraid," they said. "The two of us are disputing the wrong one has done the other. So judge between us with equity, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the right path

23.Ahmed Ali: This man here is my brother. He has ninety and nine ewes while I have only one. He demands that I should give him my ewe, and wants to get the better of me in argument."

24.Ahmed Ali: (David) said: "He is unjust in demanding your ewe to add to his (many) ewes. Many partners are surely -- unjust to one another, except those who believe and do the right; but there are only a few of them." It occurred to David that he was being tried by Us, and he begged his Lord to forgive him, and fell down in homage and repented

25.Ahmed Ali: So We forgave him. He has surely a high rank with Us and an excellent place of return

26.Ahmed Ali: "O David, We have made you trustee on the earth. So judge between men equitably, and do not follow your lust lest it should lead you astray from the way of God. Surely for those who go astray from the way of God, is severe punishment, for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning

27.Ahmed Ali: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all for nothing. Only those who deny imagine so. So for the unbelievers there is woe from the fire

28.Ahmed Ali: Should We equate those who do the right with those who spread corruption in the land? Should We make those who are morally integrated equal to those who seek disintegration

29.Ahmed Ali: We have sent down a Book to you which is blessed, so that people may apply their minds to its revelations, and the men of wisdom may reflect

30.Ahmed Ali: We bestowed Solomon on David who was an excellent devotee, for he turned to God in penitence

31.Ahmed Ali: When they brought fleet-footed chargers in the evening to show him

32.Ahmed Ali: He said: "The love of horses is worthy of desire to me for the remembrance of my Lord;" and when they were out of sight, (he said)

33.Ahmed Ali: "Bring them back to me," and he began to rub and stroke their shanks and necks

34.Ahmed Ali: We surely tried Solomon, and placed another body on his throne. So he turned to Go

35.Ahmed Ali: Saying: "O Lord, forgive me, and give me such a dominion as none will merit after me. You are the great bestower."

36.Ahmed Ali: So we subjugated the wind to his service which carried his merchandise wheresoever he wished

37.Ahmed Ali: And the devils -- the builders and divers of all kinds

38.Ahmed Ali: And many others bound in bond

39.Ahmed Ali: "This is Our gift," (We said to him), "so bestow freely or withhold without reckoning."

40.Ahmed Ali: He has a high position with Us and an excellent abode

41.Ahmed Ali: Remember Our votary Job because he called to his Lord: "Satan has afflicted me with disease and distress."

42.Ahmed Ali: "Go swiftly to the spring," (We said). "This cold water is for bathing and for drinking."

43.Ahmed Ali: We restored his family to him with others similar to them, as a blessing from Us and a reminder for men of wisdom. -

44.Ahmed Ali: "Take a handful of herbs," (We said to him), and apply and rub them, and do not make a mistake." We found him patient in adversity, an excellent devotee, always turning in repentance

45.Ahmed Ali: Remember Our votaries Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of power and insight

46.Ahmed Ali: We distinguished them for the distinct remembrance of the abode (of the Hereafter)

47.Ahmed Ali: They are the chosen ones, the excellent in Our sight

48.Ahmed Ali: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. Every one of them is among the best

49.Ahmed Ali: This is a commemoration. Surely for those who take heed for themselves is an excellent place of return -

50.Ahmed Ali: Gardens of Eden with gates open wide to them

51.Ahmed Ali: Where they will take their ease, calling for fruits in plenty, and for wine

52.Ahmed Ali: With companions of modest look, the same in age, by their side

53.Ahmed Ali: This is what is promised you for the Day of Reckoning

54.Ahmed Ali: This is surely Our provision never-ending

55.Ahmed Ali: This (for the virtuous); but for the transgressors the evil destination

56.Ahmed Ali: Hell, in which they will burn. How vile a resting place

57.Ahmed Ali: There will be boiling water for them and cold, clammy, fetid drink to taste

58.Ahmed Ali: And other similar torments

59.Ahmed Ali: Here is a multitude rushing headlong with you. There is no welcome for them. They will roast in the fire

60.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "In fact, it is you who will have no welcome. It is you who brought this upon us. What an evil place of rest!"

61.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "O Lord, give him who has brought this upon us two times more the torment of Hell;"

62.Ahmed Ali: And will add: "O what has happened to us that we do not see the men we counted among the wicked

63.Ahmed Ali: Did we laugh at them (for nothing), or our eyes fail to pick them out?"

64.Ahmed Ali: This contending of the inmates of Hell will surely be real

65.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am only a warner, and there is no other god but God, the one, the omnipotent

66.Ahmed Ali: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all-mighty, all-forgiving."

67.Ahmed Ali: Say: "This is a momentous message

68.Ahmed Ali: To which you pay no heed

69.Ahmed Ali: I had no knowledge of the higher Assembly when they discussed it among themselves

70.Ahmed Ali: Only this has been revealed to me that I am a distinct warner

71.Ahmed Ali: When your Lord said to the angels: "I am going to create a man from clay

72.Ahmed Ali: And when I have made him and have breathed into him of My spirit. Fall down in homage before him."

73.Ahmed Ali: Then the angels bowed before him in a body

74.Ahmed Ali: Except Iblis. He was filled with pride and turned an unbeliever

75.Ahmed Ali: Said (God): "O Iblis, what hindered you from adoring what I created by My own authority? Are you too proud, or too high and mighty?"

76.Ahmed Ali: He said: "I am better than he. You created me from fire, and him from clay."

77.Ahmed Ali: (God) said: "Then go hence, ostracised

78.Ahmed Ali: Upon you will be My damnation till the Day of Doom."

79.Ahmed Ali: He said: "O Lord, give me respite till the day the dead rise from their graves."

80.Ahmed Ali: (God) said: "You have the respit

81.Ahmed Ali: Till the appointed day."

82.Ahmed Ali: He said: "By Your authority, I will lead them astray

83.Ahmed Ali: Other than the chosen ones among Your creatures."

84.Ahmed Ali: (God) said: "This is right by Me, and what I say is right

85.Ahmed Ali: I will fill up Hell with you together with those who follow you."

86.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I do not ask any compensation of you for it, nor am I a specious pretender

87.Ahmed Ali: This is only a warning for mankind

88.Ahmed Ali: You will come to know its truth in time."

1.Ahmed Ali: THE REVELATION OF this Book is from God, the mighty and all-wise

2.Ahmed Ali: We have revealed to you the Scripture with exactitude; so worship God with devotion all exclusive for Him

3.Ahmed Ali: Remember that devotion is exclusively for God. Those who have taken protectors other than Him, say: "We worship them that they may bring us nearer to God." Surely God will judge between them in what they are differing about. Verily God does not show the way to an ungrateful liar

4.Ahmed Ali: Had God pleased to take a son, He could have chosen whom He liked from among those He has created. Glory be to Him. He is God, the one, the omnipotent

5.Ahmed Ali: He has created the heavens and the earth with precision. He folds the day up over the night, and folds the night up over the day. He has subjugated the sun and moon, (so that) each runs its appointed course. Is He not all-mighty and forgiving

6.Ahmed Ali: He created you from a single cell, then from it created its mate; arid provided eight varieties of cattle for you. He formed you in the mother's womb, formation after formation in three (veils of) darkness. He is God your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god other than He. How then can you turn away

7.Ahmed Ali: If you are ungrateful, then remember! God is independent of you, and He does not favour ingratitude on the part of His creatures. If you are grateful He will be pleased with you. For no one who carries a burden bears another's load; and your returning is to your Lord, when He will tell you what you used to do. Surely He knows what is in the hearts

8.Ahmed Ali: When man is afflicted with adversity he turns to his Lord, and prays to Him. But when He bestows His favour on him, he forgets what he prayed for before, and sets up others as compeers of God to mislead (people) from His way. Say: "Take advantage of your denying for a while: You will be among the inmates of Hell."

9.Ahmed Ali: Can one who prays in the watches of the night, bowing in homage or standing attentive, fearful of the life to come, and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (be like one who does not)? Say: "Can those who know, and those who do not know, be equal? Only they think who are wise."

10.Ahmed Ali: Tell them: "O my creatures who have come to belief, have fear of displeasing your Lord. There is good for those who do good in this world, and productive is God's earth. Only those who persevere will get their reward measureless."

11.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am commanded to worship God with obedience all-exclusive for Him

12.Ahmed Ali: And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit."

13.Ahmed Ali: Say: "If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of an evil Day."

14.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I worship God with devotion all-exclusive for Him

15.Ahmed Ali: You may worship what you will apart from Him." Say: "Surely the greatest losers will be those who will lose their own selves and their people on the Day of Resurrection." Remember, this will be an all-too-evident loss

16.Ahmed Ali: Above them will be a covering of fire, below them a cloud (of flames). With this does God warn His creatures: "O My creatures, fear Me."

17.Ahmed Ali: There are happy tidings for those who keep away from the worship of false gods and turn to God in repentance. Give glad tidings to My creatures

18.Ahmed Ali: Those who listen to the Word and then follow the best it contains, are the ones who have been guided by God, and are men of wisdom

19.Ahmed Ali: Can he against whom the sentence of punishment has been justified (be rescued)? Can you save him who is in the Fire

20.Ahmed Ali: But for those who fear displeasing their Lord there are lofty mansions built above mansions, with rivers rippling past below them: A promise of God; (and) God does not go back on His promise

21.Ahmed Ali: Do you not see that God sends down water from the sky, then makes it flow in rills on the earth, and brings forth corn from it which, having passed through changes of shade and colour, comes to ripen, and you see it autumnal yellow; then He reduces it to chaff. There are indeed lessons in this for those who are wise

22.Ahmed Ali: Will he whose breast has been opened up to peace (not be) in luminescence from his Lord? Alas for those whose hearts have been hardened to God's remembrance! They wander (astray) in clear error

23.Ahmed Ali: God has sent down the very best discourse, the Book conformable in its juxtapositions, which makes all of those who fear their Lord, shudder. So their hearts and bodies become receptive to the remembrance of God. This is the guidance of God with which He guides whosoever He will; but whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way

24.Ahmed Ali: Can he who will have to shield himself against the torment of the Day of Resurrection (be the same as one at peace)? The evil-doers will be told: "So taste what you earned."

25.Ahmed Ali: Those before them had denied, then punishment had overtaken them is from a quarter they did not suspect

26.Ahmed Ali: Then God made them taste of disgrace in this life; and the torment of the life to come is greater, if they understand

27.Ahmed Ali: We have given examples of every kind for men in this Qur'an so that they may contemplate

28.Ahmed Ali: A clear discourse which expounds all things without any obliquity, so that they may take heed for themselves

29.Ahmed Ali: God advances the example of a man who is owned (as slave in common) by a number of men at loggerheads, and another man who is owned by only one. Are these two alike in attribute? God be praised; yet many of them do not know

30.Ahmed Ali: Verily you will die, and so will they

31.Ahmed Ali: Then on the Day of Resurrection you will dispute before your Lord

32.Ahmed Ali: Who does greater wrong than he who tells a lie against God, and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there no place for unbelievers in Hell

33.Ahmed Ali: He who brings the truth and verifies it, -- such are the people who are God-fearing

34.Ahmed Ali: They shall have what they wish from their Lord. This is the recompense for the good

35.Ahmed Ali: That God may absolve them of their sins and reward them for the best that they had done

36.Ahmed Ali: Is not God sufficient for His devotee? Still they frighten you with others apart from Him. Whoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way

37.Ahmed Ali: And none can lead him astray who has been guided by God. Is not God all-mighty, the lord of retribution

38.Ahmed Ali: If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will answer: "God." Say: "Then just think. Can those whom you worship apart from God remove the distress God is pleased to visit upon me, or withhold a blessing God is pleased to favour me with?' Say: "God is all-sufficient for me. The trusting place their trust in Him."

39.Ahmed Ali: Say: "O people, act as best you can on your part, I am acting too. You will come to know in tim

40.Ahmed Ali: Who suffers the shameful punishment, and on whom falls the everlasting torment

41.Ahmed Ali: We have Sent down this Book to you with the truth for all mankind. So, he who comes to guidance does so for himself, and he who goes astray does so for his own loss; on you does not lie their guardianship

42.Ahmed Ali: God gathers up the souls of those who die, and of those who do not die, in their sleep; then He keeps back those ordained for death, and sends the others back for an appointed term. Surely there are signs in this for those who reflect

43.Ahmed Ali: Have they appointed intercessors other than God? Say: "Even though they have no power in the least, nor do they understand?"

44.Ahmed Ali: Say: "God's is the intercession entirely; His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; then to Him you will return."

45.Ahmed Ali: When God alone is mentioned the hearts of those who do not believe in the life to come, are filled with resentment. But when others are mentioned apart from God, they begin to rejoice

46.Ahmed Ali: Say: "O God, the originator of the heavens and the earth, the knower of the unknown and the known, You alone will judge between Your creatures for things they differed about."

47.Ahmed Ali: Even if the sinners possessed whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and as much more, they would offer it to ransom themselves from the torment of the Day of Resurrection; yet what they did not even imagine would appear to them from God

48.Ahmed Ali: And the evil of what they had earned would become visible to them; and what they used to mock would surround them from all sides

49.Ahmed Ali: When a man is in trouble, he prays to God; but when We bestow a favour on him he says: "It has come to me through my acumen." In fact, this is an illusion, but most men do not know

50.Ahmed Ali: Those before them had also said so, and yet nothing of what they did availed them in the least

51.Ahmed Ali: Then the worst of what they had done overtook them. So will the evil deeds of those who are sinners among them recoil back on them. They cannot get the better (of Us)

52.Ahmed Ali: Do they not know that God enhances or restricts the provision of any one He will. Surely there are signs in this for people who believe

53.Ahmed Ali: Say: "O creatures of God, those of you who have acted against your own interests should not be disheartened of the mercy of God. Surely God forgives all sins. He is all-forgiving and all-merciful

54.Ahmed Ali: Turn towards your Lord and obey Him before the punishment comes upon you when you will not be helped

55.Ahmed Ali: Follow the best of what has been revealed to you by your Lord before the punishment overtakes you suddenly and you are caught unawares

56.Ahmed Ali: Lest a soul should say: "Alas, I was heedless of God and only laughed;"

57.Ahmed Ali: Or say: "If only God had guided me I would have been a man of fear and piety;"

58.Ahmed Ali: Or say on seeing the punishment: "If I could only return I would be among the good."

59.Ahmed Ali: Why, My revelations had come to you, but you denied them and were filled with pride, and were among the disbelievers

60.Ahmed Ali: If you see those who had imputed lies to God on the Day of Resurrection, black would be their faces (with disgrace). Is there not a place in Hell for the arrogant

61.Ahmed Ali: God would rescue those who fear Him (and guide them) to places of safety. Neither will evil touch them nor regret

62.Ahmed Ali: God is the creator of all things, and He is the guarantor of all things

63.Ahmed Ali: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers

64.Ahmed Ali: Say: "O you ignorant people, do you bid me to worship someone other than God

65.Ahmed Ali: Surely you have been commanded, as those before you were: "If you associate (any one with God), wasted will be all your deeds, arid you will perish."

66.Ahmed Ali: So, you should worship only God, arid be among the grateful

67.Ahmed Ali: They do not esteem God as is rightly due to Him. The whole earth would be a fistful of His on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens would be rolled up in His right hand. Too immaculate is He and too high for what they associate with Him

68.Ahmed Ali: When the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will swoon away, except those God please. When the blast is sounded the second time, they will stand up all expectant

69.Ahmed Ali: The earth will light up with the effulgence of her Lord; and the ledger (of account) will be placed (in each man's hand), and the apostles and the witnesses will be called, and judgement passed between them equitably, and no wrong will be done to them

70.Ahmed Ali: Each soul will be paid in full for what it had done. He is cognisant of what you do

71.Ahmed Ali: The unbelievers will be driven into Hell in groups till, when they reach it and its doors are opened up, its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles of your own come to you reciting your Lord's revelations, warning you of this your day of Doom?" They will answer: "Yes;" but the sentence of punishment was justified against the unbelievers

72.Ahmed Ali: "Enter the gates of Hell," they will be told, "and there abide for ever." How grievous a destination for the haughty

73.Ahmed Ali: Those who were mindful of their duty to their Lord will be driven in groups to Paradise, till they reach it and its gates are opened, and its keepers say to them: "Peace be on you; you are the joyous. So enter here to live for ever."

74.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "All praise be to God Who has fulfilled the promise He had made to us, and bequeathed to us this land for dwelling in the garden wheresoever we like." How excellent the recompense for those who act

75.Ahmed Ali: You will see the angels hover round the Throne, singing the praises of their Lord; and justice will be done between them equitably, and it would be said: "All praise to God the Lord of all the worlds."

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: The revelation of this Book is from God the all-mighty and all-knowing

3.Ahmed Ali: Forgiver of trespasses, acceptor of repentance, severe of retribution, lord of power. There is no god but He. Towards Him is your destination

4.Ahmed Ali: Only the unbelievers dispute the revelations of God. So do not let their activities in the land deceive you

5.Ahmed Ali: The people of Noah had denied before them, and many factions after them. Every nation has intrigued against its apostle and afflicted him, and argued with false arguments to condemn the truth. Then I seized them. How was then My retribution

6.Ahmed Ali: In this way the sentence of your Lord against the infidels that they would be the inmates of Hell, was justified

7.Ahmed Ali: The bearers of the Throne, and those around it, sing the praises of their Lord and believe in Him, and seek forgiveness for those who believe: "O our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge embrace everything; so forgive those who turn to You in repentance and follow Your path; and preserve them from the torment of Hell

8.Ahmed Ali: Admit them, O Lord, to the garden of Eden which You promised them, and those of their fathers, spouses and progeny who are upright. You are truly all-mighty and all-wise

9.Ahmed Ali: Protect them from evil; and whosoever You preserve from evil on that Day shall have surely received Your mercy. This will be the great triumph."

10.Ahmed Ali: Those who disbelieve will certainly be told: "God's displeasure was greater than your disgust of your selves when you were called to belief and refused to believe."

11.Ahmed Ali: They say: "O Lord, twice You made us die, and twice You made us live. We admit our sins. Is there still a way out for us?"

12.Ahmed Ali: This has come upon you because when God alone was invoked you disbelieved; but when partners were associated with Him, you believed. But judgement belongs to God, the all-high and supreme

13.Ahmed Ali: It is He who shows you His signs, and sends you food from the heavens. Yet none takes a warning except him who turns to Him

14.Ahmed Ali: So call on God with exclusive obedience, howsoever the unbelievers may dislike it

15.Ahmed Ali: Most exalted of position, Lord of power, He directs inspiration by His command to any of His creatures as He will, to warn (men) of the Day of Meeting

16.Ahmed Ali: The day when they will come out (of their graves), with nothing of them hidden from God. Whose then will be the kingdom? -- God's, the one, the omnipotent

17.Ahmed Ali: Each soul will be recompensed that Day for what it had earned. There will be no depriving on that Day. Surely God is swift at reckoning

18.Ahmed Ali: Warn them of the coming day inevitable, when hearts would jump to the throats, filling them with anguish. The sinners will have neither friend nor intercessor whose (word) will be heeded

19.Ahmed Ali: Known to Him is the treachery of the eye, and what the breasts conceal

20.Ahmed Ali: God decides with justice. But those they call apart from Him can not adjudge in the least. Verily God is all-hearing, all-perceiving

21.Ahmed Ali: Have they not travelled on the earth that they could see what happened to those before them? They were greater in strength than they, and have left behind them traces on the earth. Yet they were seized by God for their sins, and had none to protect them against God

22.Ahmed Ali: This was so because their apostles came with clear proofs to them, but they refused to believe. So they were seized by God. Surely God is powerful, unrelenting in retribution

23.Ahmed Ali: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authorit

24.Ahmed Ali: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun. But they said: "He is only a deceiving sorcerer."

25.Ahmed Ali: And when he brought the truth to them from Us, they said: "Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women." But the unbelievers' stratagem is bound to fail

26.Ahmed Ali: "Let me kill Moses," the Pharaoh said, "and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he will change your faith and spread corruption in the land."

27.Ahmed Ali: Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every insolent imposter who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

28.Ahmed Ali: A believer from the House of Pharaoh who had kept his faith to himself, said: "Will you kill a man because he says: 'My Lord is God,' when he has brought clear signs from his Lord to you? If he is a liar his lie will recoil back on him; but in case he speaks the truth, then what he predicts will befall you. Surely God does not show the way to the shameful liar

29.Ahmed Ali: O my people, authority is yours today being the most powerful in the land; but who will save us from the scourge of God if it fall upon us?" "I show you," said the Pharaoh, "only what I see (is right), and guide you but to the right path."

30.Ahmed Ali: But the man of belief said: "O my people, what I fear for you is the like of what befell the communities (of old)

31.Ahmed Ali: Like the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, and those that came after them. God does not want to be unjust to His creatures

32.Ahmed Ali: O my people, what I fear for you is the day of gathering, crying and calling

33.Ahmed Ali: The day you will turn your backs and flee, with none to defend you against God. Whoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way

34.Ahmed Ali: Joseph had indeed come to you before with clear proofs, but you did not cease to doubt what he had brought until he died, when you said: 'God will not send a prophet after him.' That is how God leads the waster, the sceptic astray

35.Ahmed Ali: Those who dispute God's revelations, with no authority having come to them, (are) greatly odious in the sight of God, and the sight of those who believe. That is how God seals every proud and perverse heart."

36.Ahmed Ali: The Pharaoh said: "O Haman, build me a lofty tower that I may perhaps find the mean

37.Ahmed Ali: Of reaching the tracts of heaven and look at the god of Moses, though I think that he is a liar." Thus were the evil deeds of Pharaoh made to look attractive to him, and he was hindered from the path. So the stratagem of Pharaoh was bound to perish

38.Ahmed Ali: The man who believed said: "O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the right path

39.Ahmed Ali: O people, the life of this world is ephemeral; but enduring is the abode of the Hereafter

40.Ahmed Ali: Whoever does evil will be requited in accordance with it; but whoever does right, whether man or woman, and is a believer, will enter Paradise, where they will have provision in abundance

41.Ahmed Ali: O my people, what is wrong with me that I am calling you to preservation, while you invite me to the Fire

42.Ahmed Ali: You are asking me to disbelieve in God, and to associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, yet I invite you to the all-mighty, all-forgiving

43.Ahmed Ali: What you are calling me to is surely not worth the calling in this world or in the next, because our returning is to God; and because the transgressors will be inmates of Hell

44.Ahmed Ali: You will remember what I say in time to come; I submit my case to the judgement of God. Surely God keeps an eye on His creatures."

45.Ahmed Ali: So God preserved him from the evil they were planning; and a dreadful doom encompassed the people of Pharaoh

46.Ahmed Ali: Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. The day the Hour is proclaimed (it will be said:) "Admit the people of Pharaoh to the severest punishment,"

47.Ahmed Ali: As they will noisily argue in the Fire, the weaker ones will say to the arrogant: "We were your followers, so will you take over some of our share of the fire?"

48.Ahmed Ali: The arrogant will answer: "All of us are in it. Surely God has judged between His creatures."

49.Ahmed Ali: Those in the Fire will say to the warders of Hell: "Ask your Lord to reduce the punishment by a day for us."

50.Ahmed Ali: They will say: "Did not your apostles come to you with clear proofs?" They will answer: "Indeed, they did." "Then pray," will (the warders) say. But the praying of unbelievers will be all in vain

51.Ahmed Ali: We will certainly help Our messengers and those who believe, in this world, and on the day the witnesses take their stand

52.Ahmed Ali: The day upon which their excuses will not benefit the evil-doers, and the condemnation and evil abode will be theirs

53.Ahmed Ali: Verily We showed Moses the way, and bequeathed the Book to the children of Israel

54.Ahmed Ali: A guidance and reminder for men of wisdom

55.Ahmed Ali: So persevere; the promise of God is true; and seek forgiveness for your sins, and chant the praises of your Lord evening and morning

56.Ahmed Ali: Verily those who argue in the matter of God's revelations, without authority having reached them, have nothing but pride in their hearts, and they will not achieve their end. So take refuge in God: Surely He is all-hearing and all-seeing

57.Ahmed Ali: The creation of the heavens and the earth is indeed of greater magnitude than the creation of mankind; but most men do not understand

58.Ahmed Ali: The blind and the seeing are surely not alike, nor those who believe and act rightly and those who do evil. Little do you reflect

59.Ahmed Ali: The Hour will certainly come; there is no mystery about it; but most men do not believe

60.Ahmed Ali: Your Lord has said: "Call to Me that I may answer your call. Surely those who disdain worshipping Me will enter Hell, disgraced."

61.Ahmed Ali: It is God who made the night for you to rest, the day to make things visible. Indeed God is gracious to men, but most men are not grateful

62.Ahmed Ali: He is God your Lord, creator of everything. There is no god but He. How then do you turn away (from Him)

63.Ahmed Ali: Only they are turned away thus who deny the signs of God

64.Ahmed Ali: It is God who made the earth a dwelling for you, and the sky a vaulted roof, who fashioned you and gave you excellent form and provided you with clean and wholesome things. He is God, your Lord. So blessed be God, the Lord of all the worlds

65.Ahmed Ali: He is the living. There is no god but He. Therefore pray to Him with obedience all-exclusive. Praise be to God, the Lord of all the worlds

66.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am forbidden to worship those you call apart from God, since clear signs have come to me from my Lord, and I am commanded to submit to the Lord of all the worlds."

67.Ahmed Ali: It is He who created you from dust, then a drop of semen, then the embryo; afterwards He brings you forth as a child; then you attain the age of manhood, and then reach old age. But some of you die before you reach the appointed term that you may haply understand

68.Ahmed Ali: It is He who gives you life and death. When He creates a thing, He has only to say: "Be," and it is

69.Ahmed Ali: Have you not seen how those who dispute the signs of God are turned away

70.Ahmed Ali: Those who deny the Book and what We have sent down with Our apostles, will soon come to kno

71.Ahmed Ali: When, with (iron) collars and chains around their necks, they will be dragge

72.Ahmed Ali: Through boiling water, and then burnt in the Fire

73.Ahmed Ali: They will then be asked: "Where are they you took as partner

74.Ahmed Ali: Apart from God?" They will answer: "They have left us in the lurch and fled. In fact it was nothing that we prayed to before." That is how God sends the unbelievers astray

75.Ahmed Ali: "This is so because you went about exulting wrongfully in the land," (will they be told), "and you were insolent

76.Ahmed Ali: So enter the gates of Hell to abide in it for ever." How evil the abode of the arrogant

77.Ahmed Ali: So you persevere with patience (in your mission). The promise of God is true. Whether We show you some of the punishment We have promised them, or gather you up in death, they have to come back to Us

78.Ahmed Ali: Surely We have sent apostles before you, some of whose account We have related to you, and that of some We have not told you. But no apostle was given a miracle unless God dispensed. But when the decree of God comes the sentence is passed with justice; and the lovers of vice and vanity will then come to grief

79.Ahmed Ali: It is God who made the cattle for you so that some you ride and some you eat

80.Ahmed Ali: There are advantages for you in them, so that you may satisfy your needs through them, and may be borne upon them and on ships

81.Ahmed Ali: He shows His signs. How many of God's signs will you then deny

82.Ahmed Ali: Have they not travelled in the land and seen how was the end of those before them who were far more numerous than they and more strong, and have left behind them traces on the earth. And yet nothing of what they did profited them

83.Ahmed Ali: For when Our apostles came to them with clear proofs, they boasted and exulted at the knowledge they possessed; but what they used to mock recoiled back on them

84.Ahmed Ali: So that when they saw Our might, they said: "We believe in God the one and single, and reject those we associated (with Him)." -

85.Ahmed Ali: But then their affirming served them nothing after they had seen Our torment. This is the law of God that has prevailed among His creatures, Then the unbelievers went to rack and ruin

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: A revelation from the most benevolent, ever-merciful

3.Ahmed Ali: A Book whose verses have been distinguished and explained, a lucid discourse for people who understand

4.Ahmed Ali: Announcing happy news and warnings. And yet most of them are averse and do not listen

5.Ahmed Ali: And say: "Our hearts are immured against what you call us to. There is a deafness in our ears, and a veil lies between us and you. So act (your way), we are acting (ours)."

6.Ahmed Ali: Say: "I am a man like you, (but) it is revealed to me that your God is one God, so take the straight path to Him, and ask Him to forgive your sins. Woe to the idolater

7.Ahmed Ali: Who do not give a due share of their wealth for the welfare of others, and do not believe in the Hereafter

8.Ahmed Ali: But those who believe and do the right, will have a continuing reward

9.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Do you refuse to believe in Him who created the earth in two spans of time, and set up compeers to Him, the Lord of all the worlds

10.Ahmed Ali: He placed firm stabilisers rising above its surface, blessed it with plenty and growth, and ingrained the means of growing its food within it, sufficient for all seekers, in four spans

11.Ahmed Ali: Then He turned to the heavens, and it was smoke. So He said to it and the earth: "Come with willing obedience or perforce." They said: "We come willingly."

12.Ahmed Ali: Then He created several skies in two spans, and ingrained in each sky its function, decking the nearest heaven with lamps, and guarded it. This has been determined by the mighty and all-knowing

13.Ahmed Ali: If even then they turn away, tell them: "I forewarn you of a terrible punishment like the thunderbolt that fell upon the 'Ad and Thamud."

14.Ahmed Ali: Their apostles came to them one after the other (saying): "Do not worship any one but God." They said: "If our Lord had pleased He would have sent the angels down. We reject what is sent with you."

15.Ahmed Ali: So those who were 'Ad turned insolent unjustly in the land, and said: "Who is stronger than us?" Did they not see that God who created them was greater far in power than they? Yet they refused to believe Our signs

16.Ahmed Ali: So We let loose on them a violent wind for several days of distress to make them taste a most disgraceful punishment here in this world, and far more shameful will be the punishment in the Hereafter, and there will be no succour for them

17.Ahmed Ali: As for the (tribe of) Thamud, We tried to guide them, but they preferred blindness to guidance; then they were seized by the torment of a humiliating punishment as requital for their misdeeds

18.Ahmed Ali: But We saved those who believed and took heed for themselves

19.Ahmed Ali: The day the enemies of God will be gathered at the Fire and the records of their deeds will be distributed

20.Ahmed Ali: So that when they reach it their ears and eyes and persons will testify to what they did

21.Ahmed Ali: And they will say to their bodies: "Why did you testify against us?" They will answer: "God, who gave all things power of articulation, made us speak. It is He who created you the first time, and to Him you will return

22.Ahmed Ali: You did not hide your (doings) so that your ears or eyes or persons should not testify against you. In fact you thought that God did not know the things you used to do

23.Ahmed Ali: It is this notion you had of your Lord that caused your ruin, and you are lost."

24.Ahmed Ali: Even if they are patient, their abode is Hell; and if they beg for favour, none will favour them

25.Ahmed Ali: We had assigned to them close companions who made their past and present look attractive to them; and the fate that had once befallen the communities of jinns and men before them was justified upon them. They were indeed bound to perish

26.Ahmed Ali: The disbelievers say: "Do not listen to this Qur'an, and shout away (its reading); you may haply prevail."

27.Ahmed Ali: We shall make the disbelievers taste the severest punishment, and retribute them for the worst that they had done

28.Ahmed Ali: This is the requital for God's enemies: Hell, where they will have their lasting home, as punishment for denying Our revelations

29.Ahmed Ali: Those who disbelieve will say: "O Lord, show us those among the jinns and men who had led us astray that we may trample them underfoot and make them wholly abject."

30.Ahmed Ali: Surely the angels will come down to those who say, 'Our Lord is God' and then remain steadfast, saying: "You should have neither fear nor regret, but rejoice in the happy news of Paradise that has been promised you

31.Ahmed Ali: We are your friends in this life and in the Hereafter where you will get whatever your hearts desire, and have whatsoever you ask for

32.Ahmed Ali: As a gift from the forgiving, ever-merciful (God)."

33.Ahmed Ali: Whose word is better than his who calls to God and does the right, and says: "I am of the obedient?"

34.Ahmed Ali: Good and evil are not alike. Repel evil with what is good. Then you will find your erstwhile enemy like a close. affectionate friend

35.Ahmed Ali: Only they attain it who forbear, and only a man of great good fortune can achieve it

36.Ahmed Ali: If the Devil incite you to evil, seek refuge in God. He is all-hearing and all-knowing

37.Ahmed Ali: The night and day and the sun and moon are (only) some of His signs. So do not bow before the sun and the moon, but bow in homage to God who created them, if you truly worship Him

38.Ahmed Ali: But if they become haughty (then remember) that those who are close to your Lord sing His praises night and day and do not grow weary of (doing so)

39.Ahmed Ali: It is among His signs that the earth you see all barren and desolate begins to stir and sprout when We send down rain upon it. Surely He who gives it life will also give life to the dead. Indeed He has power over everything

40.Ahmed Ali: Surely those who slander Our signs are not hidden from Us. Then, is he better who will be cast into Hell, or he who will come out safe on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will, He sees whatsoever you do

41.Ahmed Ali: Those who reject the Reminder when it has come to them (should know) that it is a Book inviolate

42.Ahmed Ali: Falsehood cannot enter it from any side: It's a revelation from the all-wise and praiseworthy (God)

43.Ahmed Ali: Nothing is said to you which had not been said to other apostles before you. Surely your Lord is the lord of forgiveness, but also the lord of severe retribution

44.Ahmed Ali: If We had made it a discourse in an obscure tongue, they would have said: "Why were its revelations not expounded distinctly? A foreign tongue and an Arab (audience)?" Say: "For those who believe it is a guidance and a healing; but for those who do not believe it is a deafness in the ears, and a blindness. They are those one calls to from far away

45.Ahmed Ali: Verily We gave Moses the Book; but they began to differ about it. If the Word of your Lord had not preceded it the matter would have been settled between them. They are still in doubt about it and uneasy

46.Ahmed Ali: Whoever does good does so for himself, and whoever does wrong bears the guilt thereof. Your Lord does no wrong to His creatures

47.Ahmed Ali: He alone has knowledge of the Hour (of change): No fruit comes Out of its spathe, no female conceives or gives birth, but He has knowledge of it. The day He will call them (and ask): "Where are the compeers (you ascribed to Me)?" They will answer: "We profess to You not one of us can vouch for them."

48.Ahmed Ali: And those they used to worship will leave them in the lurch, and they will realise there is no escape for them

49.Ahmed Ali: Man never tires of praying for good; but if evil assails him he begins to despair

50.Ahmed Ali: If We give him a taste of Our favour after some distress he has known, he says: "It was my due. I cannot imagine the Hour will come. And even if I go back to my Lord, there will surely still be the best for me with Him." We shall tell those who do not believe what they used to do, and inflict on them a heavy punishment

51.Ahmed Ali: When We show Our favours to man he moves away and turns aside; but when in trouble he prays a great deal

52.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Just think. If this is from God and you deny it, who will be in greater error than he who is in open dissent?"

53.Ahmed Ali: We will show Our signs to them in the horizons of the external world and within themselves, until it becomes clear to them that it's the truth. Is your Lord not sufficient? He is a witness over all things

54.Ahmed Ali: In truth they are in doubt that they will ever face their Lord. Do they not know that He surrounds all things

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: 'Am Sin Qaf

3.Ahmed Ali: So has God, all-mighty and all-wise, been revealing to you and to others before you

4.Ahmed Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth, belongs to Him. He is all-high and supreme

5.Ahmed Ali: The skies are near to bursting asunder above them (for awe of Him), and the angels sing the praises of their Lord, imploring forgiveness for the dwellers of the earth. Is it not that God is forgiving and merciful

6.Ahmed Ali: Those who have taken protectors other than Him, are watched over by God. It is not for you to be their guardian

7.Ahmed Ali: We have, therefore, revealed to you the eloquent Qur'an that you may warn the people of the Metropolis, and those who live around it, of the Day of Gathering, of which there is no doubt, (when mankind would be assembled) some in Heaven, some in Hell

8.Ahmed Ali: If God had pleased He would have made them one community of belief; but He admits whom He please to His grace; yet the sinners have neither friend nor helper

9.Ahmed Ali: Have they taken others beside Him as protectors? It is God who protects; it is He who gives life to the dead, for He has power over everything

10.Ahmed Ali: In whatever matter you disagree the ultimate judgement rests with God. This is God, my Lord; in Him have I placed my trust, if to Him I turn

11.Ahmed Ali: Originator of the heavens and the earth, He has made your consorts from among you, and made pairs of cattle. He multiplies you in this way. There is no other like Him. He is all-hearing and all-seeing

12.Ahmed Ali: He holds the keys of the heavens and the earth. He increases or decreases the provision of any one He will. He has knowledge of everything

13.Ahmed Ali: He has laid down for you the (same) way of life and belief which He had commended to Noah, and which We have enjoined on you, and which We had bequeathed to Abraham, Moses and Jesus, so that they should maintain the order and not be divided among themselves. Heavy is to idolaters what you invite them to. God chooses whom He please for Himself, and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him

14.Ahmed Ali: Yet they did not differ about it until knowledge came to them, through rivalries among themselves. If the Word of your Lord, (staying) it for a time ordained, had not preceded it, the matter would have been settled among them. But those who came to inherit the Book after them are also in doubt and disturbed about it

15.Ahmed Ali: Yet to that (law) you should call them, and be constant as commanded. Do not follow their passing whims, but say: "I believe in whatever Scripture God has revealed, and I am commanded to act with equivalence among you. God is our Lord and your Lord. To us our actions, to you your deeds. There is no dispute between you and us. God will gather us all together, and to Him is our returning."

16.Ahmed Ali: As for those who argue in the matter of God after He has been fully acknowledged, their disputing has no force with their Lord. Upon them is (God's) anger, and the punishment for them will be severe

17.Ahmed Ali: It is God who has sent down the Book with the truth, and the Balance. How do you know the Hour is not near

18.Ahmed Ali: Only they who do not believe in it wish to hasten it; but those who believe are in fear of it, for they know it to be true. Surely those who are in doubt about the Hour are wandering far astray

19.Ahmed Ali: God is gracious to His creatures, and bestows favours on whosoever He will. He is all-powerful and all-mighty

20.Ahmed Ali: Whoever desires the fruits of the Hereafter, We shall add to his fruit. As for him who desires the fruits of this world, We shall give to him of these, but he will have no share in the Hereafter

21.Ahmed Ali: Have they other associates who have prescribed another law for them which has not been dispensed by God? But for the decisive Word (of God) a sentence would have been passed amongst them. Surely there is a grievous punishment for the ungodly

22.Ahmed Ali: You will see the evil-doers full of fear of what they deserve, yet it will come to pass. But those who believe and do the right will be in gardens of Paradise. They will receive what they wish from their Lord; and this will be the greatest favour

23.Ahmed Ali: This is the good news that God gives to His creatures who believe and do good. Say: "I ask no recompense of you for it other than obligations of relationship." We shall give more excellence to him who acquires excellence. Surely God forgives and accepts (gratitude)

24.Ahmed Ali: Do they say he has fabricated a lie about God? He could have sealed your hearts if He pleased; but God blots out the false and vindicates the truth by His dispensations, for He knows the secrets of the hearts

25.Ahmed Ali: It is He who accepts repentance from His creatures and forgives their trespasses, for He knows what you do

26.Ahmed Ali: He answers (the prayers) of those who believe and do good, and gives them more of His bounty. But for the unbelievers there is severe punishment

27.Ahmed Ali: If God were to give in abundance to His creatures they would fill the earth with oppression. So He gives according to measure as He will. He knows (what is good for) His creatures. He is all-aware and all-seeing

28.Ahmed Ali: It is He who sends down rain when they had despaired of it, and showers His benevolence. He is the protector worthy of praise

29.Ahmed Ali: The creation of the heavens and the earth and all the living things dispersed in them, are a sign of His. He has the power to gather them together when He will

30.Ahmed Ali: Whatever misfortune befalls you is a consequence of your deeds; yet He forgives much

31.Ahmed Ali: You cannot thwart Him on the earth, and have no friend or helper apart from Him

32.Ahmed Ali: Ships sailing in the ocean like ensigns are a sign of His

33.Ahmed Ali: He could stop the wind if He pleased, then they would be stranded on its surface. Surely there are signs in this for every one who perseveres and is grateful

34.Ahmed Ali: Or He could wreck them for what they have done; yet there is much that He pardons

35.Ahmed Ali: Let those who dispute Our signs know that there is no way of escape for them

36.Ahmed Ali: Whatsoever you have been given is only this life's merchandise; but what is with God is better and more lasting for those who believe and place their trust in their Lord

37.Ahmed Ali: Who avoid the deadly sins, immoral acts, and forgive when they are angered

38.Ahmed Ali: Who obey the commands of their Lord and fulfil their devotional obligations, whose affairs are settled by mutual consultation, who spend of what We have given them

39.Ahmed Ali: And those who defend themselves when they are wronged

40.Ahmed Ali: The retribution of evil is the equal of evil (done); yet those who forgive and rehabilitate will be rewarded by God. Verily He does not like those who do wrong

41.Ahmed Ali: If one avenges himself after he has been wronged, there is no way of blaming him

42.Ahmed Ali: Blame lies on those who oppress, and terrorise the land unjustly. For them there is painful punishment

43.Ahmed Ali: But he who bears with patience and forgives, surely complies with divine resolve

44.Ahmed Ali: He whom God leads astray has no one except God to protect him. You should see the sinners when they face the punishment. They will say: "Isn't there a way of going back?"

45.Ahmed Ali: You should see them brought before the Fire, abject in disgrace, looking stealthily. And those who believe will say: "They who forfeit their souls and families on the Day of Resurrection will really be losers." Is it not that sinners will suffer a lasting torment

46.Ahmed Ali: They will have no protector to help them other than God. He whom God allows to go astray has no way

47.Ahmed Ali: Hearken to your Lord before the Day arrives from God that will not be averted. You will have no place of refuge then nor time for denying

48.Ahmed Ali: If they turn away (you are not responsible); We have not appointed you a warden over them. Your duty is to deliver the message. When We let man taste of Our favours he begins to exult; but if misfortune befalls him, as a consequence of his own deeds, man is surely then ungrateful

49.Ahmed Ali: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatsoever He wills, bestows daughters on whosoever He will, and gives sons to whom He choose

50.Ahmed Ali: On some He bestows both sons and daughters, and some He leaves issueless. He is all-knowing and all-powerful

51.Ahmed Ali: It is not given to man that God should speak to him except by suggestion or indirectly, or send a messenger to convey by His command whatsoever He please. He is all-high and all-wise

52.Ahmed Ali: So have We revealed to you the Qur'an by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture was before, nor (the laws of) faith. And We made it a light by which We show the way to those of Our creatures as We please; and you certainly guide them to the right path

53.Ahmed Ali: The path of God to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And will not all things go back to God

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: I call to witness the lucent Book

3.Ahmed Ali: That We made it a distinctly lucid Qur'an that you may understand

4.Ahmed Ali: It is inscribed in the original Book (of Books) with Us, sublime, dispenser of (all) laws

5.Ahmed Ali: Should We have withdrawn the Reminder from you as you are a people who exceed the bounds

6.Ahmed Ali: Many a prophet had We sent to the earlier communities

7.Ahmed Ali: But never did a prophet come at whom they did not scoff

8.Ahmed Ali: So We destroyed far more powerful (nations) than they. The example of earlier people is there

9.Ahmed Ali: If you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will answer: "The Mighty and All-knowing created them,"

10.Ahmed Ali: He who made the earth a bed for you, and laid out tracks upon it so that you may find the way

11.Ahmed Ali: Who sent down water in due measure from the sky, then quickened a region that was dead -- So shall We bring you forth -

12.Ahmed Ali: He who created pairs of everything, and fashioned for you boats and beasts on which you ride

13.Ahmed Ali: So that when you sit astride of them and think of the bounties of your Lord, you may say: "All glory to Him who subjugated these for us. We were incapable of doing so

14.Ahmed Ali: Surely we have to go back to our Lord."

15.Ahmed Ali: Yet they make some of His creatures His offspring! Man is surely most ungrateful

16.Ahmed Ali: Or has He taken from those He has created daughters for Himself, and assigned sons to you

17.Ahmed Ali: Yet when news of (a daughter) they had reserved for Ar-Rahman comes to one of them, his face is blackened (with shame), and he grieves in silence inwardly

18.Ahmed Ali: Can one who has been raised on ornaments and cannot present her case coolly in a dispute (be associated with God?

19.Ahmed Ali: Yet they have made the angels, who are creatures of Ar-Rahman, females. Did they witness their creation? We shall record their testimony, and they will be interrogated

20.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "If Ar-Rahman had so pleased we would not have worshipped them." They have no knowledge of it in the least. They only make up lies

21.Ahmed Ali: Did We give them a Scripture before this to which they are holding fast

22.Ahmed Ali: In fact they say: "We found our fathers following a certain way, and are guided by their footprints."

23.Ahmed Ali: Thus, We never sent an admonisher to a settlement before you but the decadent among them said. "We found our fathers following this way, and we are walking in their footsteps."

24.Ahmed Ali: "Even if I bring you a better guidance," he rejoined, "than the one you found your fathers on?" Still they said: "We do not believe in what you have brought."

25.Ahmed Ali: Then We punished them. So look at the fate of those who denied

26.Ahmed Ali: When Abraham said to his father and his people: "I am rid of what you worshi

27.Ahmed Ali: Other than Him who created me. He will show me the right way."

28.Ahmed Ali: This is the legacy he left to his descendants so that they may turn (to God)

29.Ahmed Ali: In fact, I allowed them and their fathers to enjoy this life till the truth, and the apostle preaching it lucidly, came to them

30.Ahmed Ali: Yet when the truth had come to them, they said: "This is sorcery. We shall never believe in it."

31.Ahmed Ali: They also said: "Why was this Qur'an not sent down to some great man of the two cities?"

32.Ahmed Ali: Are they the ones who dispense the favour of your Lord? It is He who apportions the means of livelihood among them in this world, and raises some in position over the others to make some others submissive. The favours of your Lord are better than what they amass

33.Ahmed Ali: Had it not been that all people would become one community (of unbelievers), We might have given those who disbelieve in Ar-Rahman roofs of silver for their dwellings and (silver) stairs for mounting

34.Ahmed Ali: And doors (of silver) for their houses, (silver) couches for reclining

35.Ahmed Ali: And ornaments of gold. But all this would have been nothing but the vanity of this world. The Hereafter with your Lord is for those who take heed for themselves and follow the straight path

36.Ahmed Ali: We shall attach to him who goes blind to the remembrance of Ar-Rahman a devil as companion, -

37.Ahmed Ali: Surely the (devils) obstruct them from the path, though they think they are rightly guided, -

38.Ahmed Ali: Until when he comes before Us he will say (to the devil): "Would to God there was a distance of the East and West between you and me, for you were an evil companion!"

39.Ahmed Ali: But nothing will avail you on that day, for you were unjust, and you will be partners in the punishment

40.Ahmed Ali: Can you make the deaf to hear, or show the blind, and those lost in clear error, the way

41.Ahmed Ali: We shall punish them whether We take you away

42.Ahmed Ali: Or show you some of what We have promised them. They are certainly well within Our power

43.Ahmed Ali: So hold fast to what has been revealed to you. You are truly on the right path

44.Ahmed Ali: It is a (source) of greatness for you and your people. You will surely be questioned about it

45.Ahmed Ali: Inquire of apostles We had sent before you if We appointed gods to be worshipped other than Ar-Rahman

46.Ahmed Ali: We sent Moses with Our signs to the Pharaoh and his nobles. He said: "I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds."

47.Ahmed Ali: But when he brought to them Our signs they laughed at them

48.Ahmed Ali: (Even though) each miracle that We showed them was greater than the other. So We seized them with chastisement so that they may turn back

49.Ahmed Ali: But they said: "O sorcerer, call on your Lord for us in accordance with the compact He has made with you. We shall certainly come to guidance."

50.Ahmed Ali: Yet no sooner did We take away the affliction from them than they broke their pledge

51.Ahmed Ali: And the Pharaoh said to his people: "O people, is not mine the kingdom of Egypt and these rivers that flow at my feet? Can you still not comprehend

52.Ahmed Ali: Am I (not) better than him who is contemptible, and cannot even express himself clearly

53.Ahmed Ali: Why were then no bracelets of gold shed upon him from above, or angels sent down as a retinue with him?"

54.Ahmed Ali: Thus he made light (of the matter) to his people, and they obeyed him. They were certainly wicked

55.Ahmed Ali: But when they roused Our anger We inflicted retributive punishment and drowned them all

56.Ahmed Ali: And made them a precedent and example for posterity

57.Ahmed Ali: When the example of Mary's son is quoted before them, your people cry out at it

58.Ahmed Ali: And say: "Are our deities better or he?" They say this only for disputing. Surely they are a contentious people

59.Ahmed Ali: (Jesus) was only a creature whom We favoured and made an example for the children of Israel

60.Ahmed Ali: If We pleased We could have put angels in place of you as trustees on the earth

61.Ahmed Ali: He is certainly the sign of the Hour (of change). So have no doubt about it, and listen to me. This is the straight path

62.Ahmed Ali: Let not Satan misdirect you. He is your open enemy

63.Ahmed Ali: When Jesus came with the signs, he said: "I have come to you with authority, and to explain some thing about which you are at variance. So fear God, and follow me

64.Ahmed Ali: Verily God is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him. This is the straight path."

65.Ahmed Ali: But the factions differed among themselves. Woe alas to the sinners for the torment of the grievous Day

66.Ahmed Ali: Are they waiting (for any thing) but the Hour (of Doom) which would descend upon them suddenly, and catch them unawares

67.Ahmed Ali: Friends will turn into enemies on that day, except those who fear and follow the straight path

68.Ahmed Ali: O My creatures, there will be no fear or regre

69.Ahmed Ali: For (those of) you on that day who believed in My revelations and submitted

70.Ahmed Ali: (You will) enter the garden, you and your spouses, and be glad."

71.Ahmed Ali: Golden platters and goblets will be passed around, and everything the heart desires and pleases the eye will be there, where you will abide for ever

72.Ahmed Ali: This is the Paradise you will inherit (as meed) for your deeds

73.Ahmed Ali: You will have fruits in abundance there to eat

74.Ahmed Ali: The sinners will certainly dwell for ever in the torment of Hell

75.Ahmed Ali: It will not decrease for them; dumb with despair they will stay in it

76.Ahmed Ali: We did not wrong them, they wronged themselves

77.Ahmed Ali: They will call (to the keeper of Hell-gate): "O Malik, let your Lord decide our fate." He will answer: "You are to stay."

78.Ahmed Ali: We have brought to you the truth, but most of you despise the truth

79.Ahmed Ali: Have they settled upon a plan? We shall also settle on one

80.Ahmed Ali: Or do they think We do not hear their secrecies and stealthy consultations? In fact, Our messengers who attend them record everything

81.Ahmed Ali: Say: "If Ar-Rahman had a son I would have been the first of worshippers."

82.Ahmed Ali: All too glorious is He, Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of all power, for what they ascribe to Hi

83.Ahmed Ali: Leave them to their vain discoursing and horse-play till they come to meet their promised day (of reckoning)

84.Ahmed Ali: He is God in heaven and God on earth, and He is all-wise and all-knowing

85.Ahmed Ali: Blessed be He, who holds the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. He alone has knowledge of the Hour, and to Him will you return

86.Ahmed Ali: Those they invoke apart from Him have no power of intercession, except those who testify to the truth and have knowledge

87.Ahmed Ali: If you ask them who created them, they will answer: "God." How then can they turn away

88.Ahmed Ali: And (the Prophet) will say: "O Lord, these are certainly a people who do not believe."

89.Ahmed Ali: Turn away from them and say: "Peace." They will come to know soon

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: The perspicuous Book is witnes

3.Ahmed Ali: (That) We sent it down one night of blessing -- so that We could warn -

4.Ahmed Ali: On which all affairs are sorted out and decided

5.Ahmed Ali: As commands from Us. It is indeed We who send (messengers)

6.Ahmed Ali: A mercy from your Lord. Verily He is all-hearing and all-knowing

7.Ahmed Ali: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you really do believe

8.Ahmed Ali: There is no god other than He, who gives you life and death, your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of old

9.Ahmed Ali: Yet they are lost in doubt and play

10.Ahmed Ali: So watch for the day when the sky begins to emit clear smoke

11.Ahmed Ali: Which would envelope mankind. That would be a grievous affliction

12.Ahmed Ali: "O Lord, take away this torment from us," (they will pray); "we have come to believe."

13.Ahmed Ali: How can a warning benefit them? The Apostle who explained all things clearly had come to them

14.Ahmed Ali: But they turned away from him, and said: "He is well-instructed, (but) possessed."

15.Ahmed Ali: If We remove the torment a little, you revert back (to misdeeds)

16.Ahmed Ali: The day that We shall seize them with a grievous hold, We will indeed castigate them

17.Ahmed Ali: We had tried the people of Pharaoh before them. A respected prophet had come to them (saying)

18.Ahmed Ali: "Deliver the creatures of God to me. I am the trusted messenger sent to you

19.Ahmed Ali: Do not think yourselves to be above God: I have come to you with clear authority

20.Ahmed Ali: I have taken refuge in my Lord and your Lord against your stoning me to death

21.Ahmed Ali: If you do not believe in me, leave me alone."

22.Ahmed Ali: Then he called to his Lord: "These are a sinful people."

23.Ahmed Ali: "Journey by night with My devotees," (it was said); "you will certainly be pursued

24.Ahmed Ali: (Cross and) leave the sea undisturbed. The (pursuing) hosts will surely be drowned,"

25.Ahmed Ali: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind

26.Ahmed Ali: And fields and stately mansions

27.Ahmed Ali: And the comfort they enjoyed

28.Ahmed Ali: Thus it was; and We passed them on to another people

29.Ahmed Ali: Neither did the heavens weep for them, nor the earth, nor were they granted respite

30.Ahmed Ali: So We saved the children of Israel from degrading sufferin

31.Ahmed Ali: They (had experienced) under the Pharaoh. He was certainly a tyrant, guilty of excess

32.Ahmed Ali: And We exalted them over the other people knowingly

33.Ahmed Ali: And sent them tokens to bring out the best in them

34.Ahmed Ali: Even then they say

35.Ahmed Ali: "There is no dying for us but once; and we shall not be raised again

36.Ahmed Ali: So bring our ancestors back, if you are truthful."

37.Ahmed Ali: Are they better than the people of Tubba, and those who had lived before them, whom We destroyed as they were sinners

38.Ahmed Ali: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, out of play

39.Ahmed Ali: We created them with definite purpose; but most of them do not understand

40.Ahmed Ali: The Day of Judgement is your promised day of meeting

41.Ahmed Ali: The day when friend will help no friend in the least, nor will they be helped

42.Ahmed Ali: Apart from those to whom God is kind. He is all-mighty and all-merciful

43.Ahmed Ali: The tree of Zaqqum will indeed b

44.Ahmed Ali: The food of sinners

45.Ahmed Ali: It is like pitch. It will fume in the bell

46.Ahmed Ali: As does boiling water

47.Ahmed Ali: "Seize him and drag him into the depths of Hell," (it will be said)

48.Ahmed Ali: "Then pour over his head the torment of scalding water."

49.Ahmed Ali: "Taste it," (they will be told). "You were indeed the mighty and noble

50.Ahmed Ali: This is certainly what you had denied."

51.Ahmed Ali: Surely those who fear and follow the straight path will be in a place of peace and securit

52.Ahmed Ali: In the midst of gardens and of springs

53.Ahmed Ali: Dressed in brocade and shot silk, facing one another

54.Ahmed Ali: Just like that. We shall pair them with companions with large black eyes

55.Ahmed Ali: They will call for every kind of fruit with satisfaction

56.Ahmed Ali: There they will not know any death apart from the first death they had died, and will be kept safe from the torment of Hel

57.Ahmed Ali: By the beneficence of your Lord. This will be the great success

58.Ahmed Ali: Therefore We have made this (Qur'an) easy in your tongue. They may haply take a warning

59.Ahmed Ali: So you wait. They are also waiting

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: The revelation of this Book is from God, the mighty and all-wise

3.Ahmed Ali: Indeed there are signs for believers in the heavens and the earth

4.Ahmed Ali: In creating you and spreading all the moving things (on earth) are signs for people firm of faith

5.Ahmed Ali: As there are signs in the alternation of night and day, and in rain that God sends with which He revives the earth once dead, as there are in the changing of the winds, for people who can understand

6.Ahmed Ali: These are revelations of God which we recite to you correctly: In what other lore but God and His manifestations would they then believe

7.Ahmed Ali: Alas the woe for every dissembling sinne

8.Ahmed Ali: Who hears the revelations of God being recited to him, yet persists in denying with arrogance as though he had never heard them! So warn him of a painful punishment

9.Ahmed Ali: When he comes to know something of Our messages he makes fun of them: For them is shameful punishment

10.Ahmed Ali: There is Hell before them; and whatever they have earned will not avail them in the least, nor those whom they take as friends apart from God. There is great chastisement for them

11.Ahmed Ali: This is guidance. Those who deny the revelations of their Lord will suffer a dreadful doom

12.Ahmed Ali: It is God who subjugated the ocean for you so that ships may ply through it by His command, and you may seek His bounty, and may haply be grateful

13.Ahmed Ali: He subjugated for you whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth, each and everything. Verily there are signs in this for those who reflect

14.Ahmed Ali: Tell the believers to forgive those who do not fear the visitations of God, so that He may requite the people for their deeds

15.Ahmed Ali: He who does good does so for himself; and he who does evil suffers the consequence thereof. You have then to go back to your Lord

16.Ahmed Ali: We gave the children of Israel the Book, and the judgement and the prophethood, provided them with good things, favoured them over other people

17.Ahmed Ali: And gave them a clear exposition of Our laws. And they did not differ until after knowledge came to them, through mutual jealousies. Verily your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgement in what they differed about

18.Ahmed Ali: We have put you on the right way in the matter (of divine law). So follow it, and do not follow the wishes of those who are ignorant

19.Ahmed Ali: They will not avail you in the least against God. Surely the wicked are each other's friends, but God befriends those who fear and follow the right path

20.Ahmed Ali: These are precepts of wisdom for men, and guidance and grace for people who believe with certainty

21.Ahmed Ali: Do those who seek evil think that We shall make them equal in life and death to those who believe and do good? How bad is the judgement that they make

22.Ahmed Ali: God has created the heavens and the earth with reason, so that He may reward each soul in accordance with what it has done; and no wrong will be done to them

23.Ahmed Ali: Just think: Who apart from God can show the way to him who deifies his ego into his god, whom God allows to go astray knowingly, and seals his ears and heart, and covers over his eyes with a veil? Why then do you not contemplate

24.Ahmed Ali: Yet they say: "There is nothing but the life of this world. We die and we live, and only time annihilates us." Yet they have no knowledge of this: They only speculate

25.Ahmed Ali: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, their only argument is to say: "Bring our ancestors back, if what you say is true."

26.Ahmed Ali: Say: "God, who gives you life and makes you die, will (raise the dead) then gather you (and your ancestors) together on the Day of Resurrection of which there is no doubt." And yet most men do not understand

27.Ahmed Ali: God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. The day the Hour is proclaimed the liars will be losers

28.Ahmed Ali: You will see each community kneeling down; and each community will be summoned to its ledger (of good and evil deeds). You will receive upon that day your recompense for what you had done

29.Ahmed Ali: This, Our record, will speak about you truthfully. We had everything you did recorded in it

30.Ahmed Ali: So, those who believed and did good things will be admitted to His favour by their Lord. This will be a clear triumph

31.Ahmed Ali: As for the infidels, (it will be said): "Were not My messages read out to you? But you behaved with self-conceit, and became a sinful people

32.Ahmed Ali: Whenever it was said: 'God's promise is certainly true, and there is no doubt about the Hour,' you replied: 'We know not what the Hour is. We have only a vague idea, but are not certain.

33.Ahmed Ali: The evil of what they had done will become clear to them, and they will be seized by what they had scorned

34.Ahmed Ali: "We shall ignore you today," they will be told, "as you had forgotten the meeting of this Day. Your dwelling place is Hell, and there is none to save you

35.Ahmed Ali: This because you laughed at God's revelations and were taken in by the life of the world." So they will neither be taken out of it, nor will be asked to seek God's favour on that day

36.Ahmed Ali: All praise be to God, Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of all the worlds

37.Ahmed Ali: His is the supremacy in the heavens and the earth; and He is the all-mighty and all-wise

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Ahmed Ali: HA MIM

2.Ahmed Ali: The revelation of this Book is from God, the mighty and all-wise

3.Ahmed Ali: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them but with a purpose for an appointed time. Yet the unbelievers turn away from the warning

4.Ahmed Ali: Say: "Have you thought of those you invoke apart from God? Show me what they have created of the earth, or, do they have a share in the heavens? Bring me an earlier Book than this, or inherited knowledge, if you are truthful."

5.Ahmed Ali: Who is more astray than he who calls on those, apart from God, who cannot answer their prayers till the Day of Resurrection, and are even unaware of being called

6.Ahmed Ali: When all men are gathered together (on that Day) they will become their enemies and deny their worship

7.Ahmed Ali: When Our clear revelations are read out to them, the infidels say of the truth, when it has come to them: "This is pure magic."

8.Ahmed Ali: Do they say: "He has fabricated it?" Tell them: "If I have fabricated it, you have no power to save me from God. He knows what you are busy with concerning this. He is sufficient as witness between you and me; yet He is forgiving, ever-merciful."
